loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es: Mauricio Antonio   tiene 28 años de edad, su actividad económica es la  venta de productos varios, tiene un hijo a su cargo que está recién nacido él junto a su esposa ha salido a delante con mucho esfuerzo. El objetivo que tiene Mauricio con el préstamos es para comprar y abastecerse de productos como plata, cosmético, ropa, zapatos y poder así brindar a los clientes variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Mauricio Antonio is 28 and his principal economic activity is selling various goods. He has a newborn son and he and his wife have gotten ahead through a great deal of hard work. 

Mauricio’s goal is to use the loan to buy supplies such as silverware, cosmetics, clothing and shoes and to provide his customers with a variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as silverware, cosmetics, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Ivania

texts.es:
Ivania trabajadora, madre de familia, casada, sus planes es mejorar poco a poco la infraestructura de la vivienda, construyo la pared con el préstamo anterior, surgieron dificultades con el negocio al dar al crédito a persona que no cumplieron con el pago de los productos retirado de su pulpería y sin poder hacer nada ante las autoridades para recuperar alguna parte de la perdida y tener necesidad de ingreso económico a su hogar empezó a buscar trabajo encontrando y desempeñándose actualmente como domestica, trabajo humilde y de mucho esfuerzo mental, físico pero siendo una fuente de ingreso.
A pesar de todo lo sucedido sigue con sus planes de mejorar su nivel de vida, su vivienda. Esta solicitando este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de láminas de zinc, perlines, golosa, para cambiar el techo de su cuarto ya que esta en malas condiciones y requieren cambiar. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo constante para al desarrollo de su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ivania is a hardworking mother.  She is married.  Her plans are to improve the infrastructure of her home little by little.  She built a wall with her last loan.  

She overcame difficulties with her store after giving credit to someone who did not make their payments and has retired from the store.  The authorities were not able to recover any part of her loss.  Since her family needed income, she started to look for work.  She currently works as a maid, which is humble work that takes a lot of mental and physical effort, but it is a source of income.  

In spite of everything that happened, she continues with her plans to improve her quality of life and her home.  She is asking for this loan to purchase zinc sheets, roofing beams, and screws to change the roof which is in bad condition and needs to be changed.  She is thankful to the lender for their constant support as she improves her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheets to put a roof on her home.

loans.name: Felicidad Maria

texts.es: La cliente Felicidad tiene 33 años de edad con la actividad comerciante ambulante (venta de DVD, Memorias, cargadores de celular, audífonos) casada con el señor Ramiro quien es mensajero de una institución privada,  La pareja no tiene niños por el momento, pero su deseo en un futuro es tener familia, viven en casa del suegro de la Sra. felicidad ubicado en la zona de alto Escobar,  El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como ser dvd´s , flash memory´s y cargadores de celular al por mayor que es el comercio principal  que tiene la cliente y quiere abastecerse de mercadería para estas fiestas de fin de año, su deseo es el tener un puesto fijo para poder ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Sra. Felicidad is 33 years old and is a traveling saleswoman (she sells DVDs, memory sticks, cell phone chargers and earphones). She is married to Sr. Ramiro who is a messenger with a private agency. The couple does not have children at the moment, but their desire is to have a family in the future. They live in her father-in-law’s home in the Upper Escobar area.

Felicidad is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as DVDs, flash drives and cell phone chargers wholesale, which are her principle sales, since she wants to stock goods for the year-end holidays. Her wish is to have a fixed stall from which to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy DVDs and flash drives.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, canned food and other foods.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 59 años y vive en la aldea de Monte Fresco en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella es separada y tiene 4 hijos mayores de 27, 31, 33 y 38 años de edad. Los cinco aportan económicamente a los gastos familiares. 

Desde pequeña, doña Ana quiso ser modista y su ex-esposo le ayudó a sacar cursos y aprender el oficio. Inició su negocio hace 28 años. Ella labora 8 horas diarias elaborando ropa de dama, caballero, uniformes de colegio, cortinas y cameras para el dormitorio. 

Solicitó este crédito de L15,000 para la compra de telas, agujas, hilo, y aceite para su maquina. Ella espera seguir adelante y producir más con el negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana is 59 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Monte Fresco in the town of San Pedro Sula. She is separated from her spouse and has four adult children (ages 27, 31, 33, and 38). The five of them support one another financially with the family expenses.

At a young age, Doña Ana wanted to become a seamstress. Her ex-husband helped to pay for her courses so that she could learn the trade. Ana started her business when she was 28. She works eight hours a day making men’s and women’s clothing, high school uniforms, curtains, and bedroom linens.

Ana is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL so that she can buy fabrics, needles, thread, and sewing machine oil. She hopes to move forward and produce more in her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, needles, thread, and sewing machine oil.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: El señor Isaac a sus 61 años de edad, es dueño de una ferretería hace más de 16 años. En su local, el señor Isaac vende todo lo relacionado con productos para la construcción. El señor Isaac trabaja solo en una jornada de todos los días. El señor Isaac necesita realizar adecuaciones locativas para su negocio como lo serán dos puertas en rejas para la seguridad propia y de su negocio, además necesita de la compra de surtido como metales, clavos, martillos, entre otros. El sueño del señor Isaac es sacar adelante a su hijo y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Isaac, 61, has owned a hardware store for more than 16 years. In his shop he sells all kinds of construction-related products.  He works alone every day and needs to do some remodeling at his business, such as installing two barred doors, for his own and his shop’s security. As well, he needs to buy supplies, such as metal, nails and hammers among other items.

Sr. Isaac’s dream is to help his son get ahead and to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and do some remodeling.

loans.name: Mujeres Decididas E Independientes Group

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 55 años ella es una señora muy hábil a ella le gusta aprender nuevas cosas sobre todo manualidades,  al principio lo hacía por entretenimiento pero con el tiempo  se convirtió  en su principal fuente de ingreso es así que ella prepara artículos según las festividades como el día de la madre, del padre,  san Valentín etc. Prepara todo tipo de artículos como manteles, cojines, muñecos etc. Ella realiza exposiciones de todo lo que confecciona y los vende a sus amigos, vecinos y personas que ya conocen su trabajo, las exposiciones las realiza en su misma casa, ahora se está preparando para las fiestas navideñas para eso es que utilizara su préstamo para comprar telas y  adornos alusivos a la navidad, gracias a su trabajo es que ha podido ayudar a sus 4 hijos con los estudios y de alguna manera sacarlos adelante, ella es viuda y le ha costado mucho sacrificio todo lo que ha logrado, actualmente es socia del grupo” MUJERES DECIDIDAS E INDEPENDIENTES”.
* Gladys es la cuarta de la derecha esta sentada y viste de rojo
texts.en:
Gladys is 55 and a very skilled woman. She enjoys learning to do new things, above all handicrafts. Initially, she made them for entertainment but in time they became her principal source of income. Thus, she prepares items according to holidays, such as Mother’s Day, Father’s Day, Valentines, etc. She makes all kinds of articles such as  tablecloths, cushions, dolls, etc. She presents expositions of her crafts and sells them to her friends, neighbors and others who hear about her work. She holds these exhibitions in her own home.

Gladys is currently  preparing for the Christmas holidays and will use her loan to buy fabric and Christmas ornaments. Thanks to her work she has been able to help her children with their studies and in some way to get ahead. She is a widow and she has sacrificed a great deal in order to succeed. At present she is a member of the ” MUJERES DECIDIDAS E INDEPENDIENTES” communal bank.

*Glaydys is dressed in red and seated the fourth from the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fabric and Christmas ornaments.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo, un joven trabajador de 22 años; vive en una casa alquilada que junto a su pareja Devora de 18 años, anhelan tener un buen futuro. Máximo, es un joven que se dedica al trabajo de construcción; empezó a trabajar hace 05 meses; y cada mañana se levanta para poder trabajar. Ya que con el dinero que gana ahorra para poder construir su propia casa. En el trabajo le va muy bien, y disfruta cada vez que conversa con sus compañeros de trabajo, sin embargo termina muy agotada por esta actividad muy dura. Con el crédito solicitado podrá  avanzar con la construcción de su propia casa ya que es su mayor anhelo. Este será su préstamo número 01 con MFP y esta contento con el apoyo financiero que le brindaron ya que así puede cumplir con su objetivo. En su banco comunal agradece a las personas que le dieron esta oportunidad. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles podrá comprar materiales de construcción para la construcción de su casa, como: fierros, alambres, cemento.
texts.en:
Máximo, a young 22-year-old worker, lives in a rented house with his 18-year-old partner, Devora. They both long for a better future. Máximo works in construction and began this job 5 months ago. Each morning he gets up ready to work. He is saving the money he earns in order to be able to build his own house. His work is going very well and he enjoys talking to his fellow workers. Nevertheless, he ends the day exhausted from the very difficult tasks he performs.

Máximo will use the loan he has requested to move ahead in building his own house since this is his greatest wish. This will be his first loan with MFP and he is pleased with the financial support they have given him so that he can fulfill his goal. He is grateful to the people in his communal bank who have given him this opportunity. With the 1,500 nuevos soles, he will be able to buy construction materials to build his house, such as rebar, wire and cement.

loans.use: to buy rebar, wire and cement.

loans.name: Paula Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Paula es soltera pero  tiene una niña de 16 años  que se encuentra estudiando, ella sola saca adelante a su hijita,  la clienta vive en la casa de su  Padre en la zona de ciudad Satélite La cliente tiene la actividad de comercio ambulante por el centro de la ciudad (venta de variedades adornos de cocina, etc. ) con esta actividad ella corre con los gastos del hogar, con el dinero del crédito para  comprar variedad de mercadería para estas fiestas de fin de año, ya que la Sra. tiene varios pedidos de productos ya que tiene mucha clientela, ella es una persona amable y se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado, su deseo es el de ver a su hija profesional en un futuro sentirse orgullosa ya que  su sacrificio valió la pena.
texts.en: Mrs. Paula is single but has one 16-year-old daughter who is in school. She is the only provider for her little girl. Paula lives in her father's home in the city of Satélite. She has a stall downtown where she sells various decorations and accessories. She is able to cover her household costs thanks to this business. She will use this loan to buy a variety of merchandise for the end of the year, since she has various orders and a large customer base. She is a very kind person and is very grateful to the Institucion for this support. Her desire is to see her daughter become a professional in the future, and to be proud, because her sacrifices will have paid off.

loans.use: to buy home accessories.

loans.name: Irma Marina

texts.es: Irma Marina tiene 22 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdo tiene 3 hijos que están actualmente a su cargo. Ella inicie este negocio para poder tener ingresos y a pesar que no tenía mucha experiencia lo inicio para poder apoyar a la familia, ahora ya tiene 5 años en el negocio y ha salido adelante con mucho esfuerzos. Irma Marina su objetivo con el crédito que está solicitando es para comprar más cerdos.
texts.en: Irma Marina is 22 and raising three children. She raises and sells hogs, and started this business, despite having little experience, in order to have an income and support her family. She now has five years' experience in this business and has been able to succeed through great hard work. Irma Marina's goal with this loan is to buy more hogs.

loans.use: to buy more hogs.

loans.name: Buenos Aires Group

texts.es:
Amenecia es miembro y coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Buenos Aires, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, es madre soltera de siete hijos y junto a su familia reside en el Barrio Jesús en el municipio de Juticalpa. 

Doña Amenecia inició a ganarse la vida desde muy temprana edad como empleada doméstica y un día cansada de tanto trabajar para otros decidió poner su propio negocio y desde hace varios años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Tiene una pequeña tortillera, que atiende ella y sus cuatro empleados desde las 4 am hasta las 2 pm. Su ventaja es que tiene una buena clientela que empieza a llegar a comprar las tortillas desde las 5 am y su desventaja es que el alquiler del local es muy caro y prácticamente lo que le queda en ganancias es para cubrir el pago. 

El préstamo de diez mil lempiras que Amenecia está solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo todo en la compra de maseca y leña. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos para ella y sus empleados. 

Las metas de doña Amenecia son tener su propia casa y un local propio para su tortillería. Tiene 5 años de trabajar con los préstamos de FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de manera puntual y los prestamos obtenidos le han ayudado a mejor su condición de vida y su negocio ha crecido.
texts.en:
Amenecia is a member and coordinator of the Buenos Aires communal bank. She makes and sells tortillas. She is a single mother of seven children, and lives with her family in the Jesús neighbourhood of the Juticalpa municipality.

Mrs. Amenecia began working for a living at a young age. She worked as a maid, but one day she got tired of working so much for other people, so she decided to open her own business. For several years now she has made and sold tortillas. She has a small tortilla shop which she and her four employees tend to from 4:00 am to 2:00 pm. She has a good customer base who start arriving to buy tortillas around 5:00 am. Unfortunately, the rent for her store is very high and almost all of her earnings go toward paying it.

Amenecia needs this loan of ten thousand lempiras to invest in the purchase of maseca [a popular brand of instant corn masa mix] and firewood. With the support of this loan, she will be able to continue having a source of income for her family and her employees.

Amenecia's goals are to have her own home as well as her own store for her tortilla shop. She has worked with FAMA loans for five years and has payed off her quotas punctually. These loans have helped her to improve her living conditions and her business has grown.

loans.use: to buy firewood and Maseca [brand of instant corn masa mix]

loans.name: Dunia Elisabett

texts.es:
La señora Dunia tiene 40 años de edad y vive en la Colonia Los Torres en el municipio de Choloma.  Ella vive con su pareja Rubén. Dunia tiene una hija de 11 años de edad, la cual está estudiando. 

Doña Dunia trabajaba en una maquila pero hace 3 años ella quiso independizarse y trabajar en su propio negocio. Inició una pulpería donde trabaja 14 horas diarias vendiendo productos de la canasta básica y de primera necesidad y recargas electrónicas. 

Solicitó este crédito de L15,000 para la compra de productos alimenticios para surtir su negocio. Ella espera crecer en el negocio y mejorar la nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Dunia is 40 years old and resides in the subdivision of Los Torres in the town of Choloma. She lives with her partner Rubén. Dunia has an 11-year-old daughter who is in school.

Doña Dunia worked at a factory, but three years ago she decided to become independent and work in her own business. She started a grocery store where she works 14 hours a day. Dunia sells household products, basic necessities, and rechargeable phone cards.

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL in order to buy food products to restock her business. Dunia hopes to grow her business and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy various food products.

loans.name: Isabel Lucia

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer casada de 54 años de edad, ella se dedica la venta de abarrotes  (arroz, azucar, leche, entre otros) junto con su esposo que la ayuda constantemente en sus ventas,  Isabel es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y muy luchadora con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia lleva en el negocio desde el año 2009, gana semanalmente un promedio de  S/. 240 soles con el préstamo que se le otorgara gracias a Kiva de S/. 1500 soles lo invertirá para darle mantenimiento a su casa ( construcción de baño), 
uno de sus sueños es que su negocio siga creciendo para que de esta forma tengan mas ingresos y puedan llevar una mejor calidad de vida, su asesor cree que es una buena cliente.
Isabel  vive y trabaja en famous Nazca, or Nasca, Perú. The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines- a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city, generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited in the region from 300-800 AD. As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism. But Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have preserved despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.
texts.en:
Isabel, 54, is married and with her husband’s help, sells groceries (rice, sugar, milk, etc).   Isabel is a hard-working entrepreneur who since 2009 has struggled to get her family ahead with her business.  She earns on average 240 sols weekly.  With the loan offered her by Kiva of 1500 sols, she will construct a bathroom for her house.

One of her dreams is that her business continues growing which will give her more earnings and  give the family a better quality of life.  The foundation consultant considers her a good client.

Isabel works and lives in the famous Nazca, or Nasca, Peru.  The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines- a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city.   These lines are generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited the region from 300-800 AD. As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism. But Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have persevered despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.

loans.use: to fix her house (build a bathroom).

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva, de 50 años, esposa de Simeón, juntos viven en su casa propia en compañía de sus 03 hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Hace 05 años que Eva, empezó a vender salchipollo en un stand movil sanguchero, en la cual todas las tardes se va al ovalo de su ciudad para expender a sus asiduos clientes o de aquellos que pasan por la calle. Eva es una mujer humilde y amable con sus clientes, la gente que va a comer su rico salchipollo salen satisfechos por la buena atención que les brinda. Lo que más le gusta es dejar contentos a sus clientes y considera que lo más difícil es tener que estar parada atendiendo hasta altas horas de la noche. Con el crédito solicitado, podrá comprar productos para la preparación de su plato como: papa, pollo, especias. Así dejará satisfechos a sus clientes. Este será su primer préstamo con MFP y agradece la oportunidad que le brindan. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar productos para la preparación de su plato como: papa, pollo y especias.
texts.en:
Eva, 50, is the wife of Simeón.  They live together in their own house with their three children, whom they want to offer a better quality of life.  Five years ago, Eva began selling fried chicken from a sandwich stall.  Every afternoon, she moves about her city to serve her eager customers or those who see her in the street.  Eva is sincere and friendly with her clients.  People who eat her delicious chicken leave satisfied with how well she takes care of them. She really enjoys making her clients happy, but the hardest part for her is to have to stay parked, serving customers until late into the night.

This loan will enable her to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her dish, such as potatoes, chicken, and spices, so she can satisfy the demands of her customers.  This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, chicken, and spices for her food stall.

loans.name: Rosa Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive por la comunidad de San Fernando en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que se caracteriza por la belleza de su naturaleza y su mayor atracción es La Laguna de Busa, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, son personas muy amables y de un corazón cálido.

Doña Rosa tiene 29 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 10 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el extranjero ya que a migrado para mejorar la economía de su hogar. 

La Señora Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cuida de sus hijos, en su casa cría y vende pollos y cuyes. Ella  es parte de una asociación en donde sus integrantes se dedican a la elaboración de yogur y conservas de una fruta de la región.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para los mismos.

Su meta es terminar sus estudios secundarios, cursar los  estudios universitarios en las carreras de Licenciatura en Sociales y ser Ingeniera Agrónoma.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is a member of the Génesis communal bank. She lives in the San Fernando community in Cuenca city, an area known for the beauty of its nature. The main attraction is the Laguna de Busa. The residents work in agriculture and raise animals. They are kind, warm-hearted people.

Mrs. Rosa is 29, married, and has two children ages 3 and 10. Her oldest child goes to school in the city. Her husband works outside of the country, as he has emigrated in order to improve their income.

Mrs. Rosa does housework and cares for her children. She raises and sells chickens and guinea pigs in her home. She is part of an association whose members make yoghourt and preserves from a local fruit.

This is her second loan in the communal bank. She joined the bank at the invitation of her mother. She will invest this new loan in the purchase of chickens and chicken feed.

Her goal is to finish her high school and go to university to study social sciences and become an agriculturalist.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana, una joven soltera de 25 años; vive en su casa propia y trabaja por tener una mejor calidad de vida. Hace 03 años que Roxana se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como: conservas, leche, detergentes, embutidos, productos que le brindan una buena sostenibilidad económica para mejorar su condición de vida, amablemente atiende a sus clientes por lo cual ellos salen muy contentos por la buena atención que les brinda Roxana. Le gusta su trabajo ya que puede contar experiencias que tienen con sus clientes y considera que lo más difícil es la falta de algunos productos que se agotan rápidamente. Con el tiempo piensa en comprar más productos para surtir su tienda y que no le falte nada así brindará mejor servicio a sus clientes. Esteserá su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá incrementar productos para su tienda como: conservas, leche, detergentes, embutidos, azúcar y fideos.
texts.en: Roxana is 25; she is young, single, and lives in her own home. She works in order to have a better quality of life. Roxana has sold groceries for three years. She sells items such as: preserves, milk, detergents, and sausages. This business allows her to improve her living conditions. Roxana's customers always leave happy because of her kind, attentive customer service. She enjoys her work because she enjoys interacting with her customers. She finds that her greatest challenge is not having enough of the products that are bought up quickly. With time, she plans to buy more products to stock her store so that she has everything she could possibly offer. This will allow her to provide a better customer service. This will be her first loan with MFP, and she hopes for your collaboration so that she can move ahead with her goals. With the 1,500 nuevos soles, she will be able to increase her stock of items such as: preserves, milk, detergents, sausages, sugar, and pasta.

loans.use: to buy preserves, milk, detergents, sausages, sugar, and pasta.

loans.name: Johanna Kathiuska

texts.es:
La Señora. Johanna es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, su centro histórico es una la mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, la belleza de su naturaleza, su variada gastronomía y el calor de su gente la hacen especial.

Doña Johanna tiene 32 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 12 y 1 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión zapatero y labora en su propio taller, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Johanna se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas y también vende ropa por catalogo, se encuentra en este negocio hace 7 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su cuñada. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y ropa para la temporada navideña.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio propio como un bazar.
texts.en:
Johanna is a member of the “Génesis” communal bank and lives in the outskirts of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate.  Its historic city center with its mix of colonial and modern styles, its natural beauty, its varied food, and the warmth of its people make it special.

Johanna is 32 years old, is married and has two children, ages 12 and 1.  Her oldest child attends the city school.  Her husband is a shoemaker and has his own workshop.  They own their home.

Johanna sells cosmetics of various brands and also sells clothing through catalogs.  She’s been in this business for seven years and works seven days a week without a set schedule.

This will be her second loan through the communal bank, to which she was invited by her sister in law.  She will use the money from this new loan to buy cosmetics and clothing for the Christmas season.

Her goal is to have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Doña Evangelina se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, tiene seis hijos y su esposo es maestro de educacion primaria. 

Evangelina inició a ganarse la vida desde hace mas de diez años vendiendo refrescos y charamuscas en su casa de habitacion. Luego de un tiempo instaló una pequeña caseta donde vendía comida pero tuvo que quitarla porque el alquiler era muy caro y no le quedaban las suficientes ganancias para cubrir el pago. Entonces su esposo y sus hijos le ayudaron a ampliar una parte de su casa y alli instaló una venta de ropa usada y hoy en dia con eso se gana la vida. Trabaja ella sola y los fines de semana sale a vender a las aldeas y mayoreo. 

El prestamo que Evangelina esta solicitando lo necesita para la compra de varios fardos de ropa usada, ya que se avecina la epoca navideña. Con el apoyo de este prestamo ella podra surtir su negocio de nuevos estilos para que todos sus clientes luzcan a la moda actual. 

Su meta es tener un negocio mas grande y ubicado en el centro de la ciudad para asi tener mas afluencia de clientes. Este es su primer prestamo en FAMA y espera cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evangelina sells used clothing. She is 51, married, and has six children. Her husband is an elementary school teacher.

Evangelina started to work for a living over ten years ago, selling pop and charamusca [a frozen juice snack] from her home. After a while, started selling food from a small stand, but she had to stop because the rent was too high and she wasn't making enough money to cover it. So, her husband and children helped her to fit out part of their home and get set up to sell used clothing. This is now how she makes her living. She works alone, and on the weekend she goes out to sell in other villages and to wholesalers.

Evangelina is now requesting a loan for buying several bales of used clothing, since the Christmas season is coming up. With the support of this loan, she will be able to stock her store with new styles so that all of her customers can sport the latest fashions.

Her goal is to have a larger business in the downtown core of the city in order to have a greater influx of customers. This is her first loan with FAMA and she hopes to repay her quotas punctually.

loans.use: to buy several bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es: Emerson, es un joven soltero y trabajador, tiene 28 años; vive en una casa alquilada. Lo que más anhela es triunfar en la vida. Él empezó a trabajar como empleado en una tienda comercial de su ciudad. Desde entonces y cada mañana se levantaba muy temprano para poder dirigirse a una librería, lugar donde trabaja y tiene la esperanza de que algún día pueda tener su propio negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que la gente con quien trabaja son amables, por ser un hombre responsable. Con el tiempo desea abrir su propio negocio, que es la venta de útiles escolares  ya que lo vio rentable y desea con ansias el apoyo de MFP para realizar sus sueños de triunfar en la vida. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles podrá abrir su negocio y vender útiles escolares como: cuadernos, libros, lapiceros, papelotes y plumones.
texts.en: Emerson is 28. He is a young, single, and hard-working man. He lives in a rented home. His greatest wish is to succeed in life. He is an employee in a bookstore in the city. Every morning he gets up very early to go to work. He hopes to have his own business soon. What he likes the most about his job is the kindness of his co-workers. He is very responsible. He wants to open his own business selling school supplies, since he believes this to be profitable. He is eager to have MFP's support in achieving his dreams of succeeding in life. This will be his first loan with MFP, and he hopes to get a small loan so that he can achieve his goals. With these 1,500 nuevos soles, he will be able to open his business and sell school supplies such as: notebooks, books, pencils, paper, and felt-tip pens.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books, pencils, paper, and felt-tip pens.

loans.name: Las Orquideas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Orquídeas esta formado por 6 socias y un socio quienes viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como La Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde diciembre de 1999, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones, son personas muy amables y de un corazón cálido como nuestras socias quienes son personas luchadoras, muy trabajadores quienes con su sacrificio a diario aportan a la economía de sus hogares para salir con  sus familia.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Ines, tiene 23 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido una niña de 5 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un taxi, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña María Ines se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su hija que aun es pequeña, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas, trabaja sin un horario ni día fijo, vende sus productos a sus amigas y conocidas.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas y cosméticos para tener más variedad.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Las Orquídeas [The Orchids] communal bank has seven members: six women and one man. They live in different areas in Cuenca city. This city is known as the city of La Santa Ana de los Cuatro Rios. It was designated a UNESCO World Heritage city in 1999. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. They are very kind, warm-hearted people, and our group members are no exception. They are strong, hard-working people who sacrifice themselves daily to provide for their families.

Mrs. Maria Ines is a member of this group. She is 23, in a common-law marriage, and has one five-year-old daughter who attends school in the city. Her husband is a taxi driver. They do not have their own home; they rent.

Mrs. Maria Ines does the housework and cares for her young daughter. In her free time she sells various brands of cosmetics. She works without a fixed schedule, and sells her products to her friends and acquaintances.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of perfume, creams, and cosmetics in order to have a greater variety of products.

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta, además de alegre y extrovertida, es viuda, y todos sus hijos ya tienen familia, pero la visitan constantemente. Vive en compañía de su sobrino y tiene su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Betty es la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, e iniciando como independiente con una maquina de coser que compró con su propio capital e instalándolo en su casa desde hace 12 años. En un inicio realizó trabajos pequeños a sus vecinos y amistades, con el tiempo fue ganando más clientes a base de buen trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico que le permite solventar sus gastos personales y de su hogar ya que se encuentra sola, además de dedicarse un oficio que le gusta, lo que le permite distraerse. Su plan a futuro es instalar un taller de confección en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a ser puntal con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además de sentirse a gusto con los miembros de  su banco comunal pues los considera personas responsable y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará una maquina recubridora valorada en 600 soles, además de telas e hilos para costura.
texts.en:
Betty, 49 years old, is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman.  Also, she is happy and extraverted.  She is a widow and all her children have their own families but visit her constantly.  She lives with her nephew and has her own home.

Betty sews, which she learned by studying at vocational school.  She started her business independently with a sewing machine that she bought with her own money and set up in her house 12 years ago.  At first she did little jobs for her neighbors and friends and with time, her client base grew because of her good work.  What she likes about her job is being able to count on financial income to cover her personal and household expenses, since she is single.  Also, she enjoys what she does and is able to distract herself with this work.  Her future plan is to set up a workshop in her house.  

This will be her fourth loan with MFP and she hopes the collaboration will help her reach her goals.  On the other hand, she promises to be prompt with her payments just as she was with previous loans.  In addition to feeling comfortable with the members of her communal bank, she considers them responsible and caring people.  With the loan request of 1000 nuevos soles, she will buy a sewing machine worth 600 soles and fabric and thread for sewing.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine, fabric, and thread.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Patricia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Claveles”, del Distrito de Picota, Provincia de  
Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, su edad es 29 años y tiene 02 hijos una de 9 años que  cursa el nivel primario y un niño de 3 años. 
Empezó vendiendo productos de belleza y prendas de vestir, tuvo que dejarlo debido a que sus hijos requerían de sus cuidados. Desde hace dos meses se dedica a la venta de gaseosas. Se inicio con un capital de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, frutos de sus ahorros, su esposo trabaja como chofer de vehículos pesados. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles,  comprará más gaseosas de distintos sabores y golosinas como galletas, chupetines, caramelos, chifles, papitas fritas, chocolates, etc.
Patricia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es implementar su negocio  con muebles adecuados y además dedicarse a otros negocios que le permitan crecer y mejorar económicamente, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella de crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the “Los Claveles” communal bank in the Picota district and province, within the San Martín department.  She’s 29 years old, married and has two children; a nine year old daughter in elementary school, and a three year old son.

She began selling beauty products and clothing, but had to stop because she needed to care for her children.  For the past two months she’s been selling soft drinks.  She began with 300 PEN from her savings.  Her husband works as a heavy vehicle driver.

She will use the money from this loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) to buy more soft drinks of different flavors, and snacks like cookies, lollypops, candy, gum, potato chips, chocolates, etc.

Patricia is a hardworking, enterprising woman.  Her dream is to equip her business with adequate furniture, and also to become involved in other businesses that will allow her to grow and improve financially.  She is very grateful to “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for giving women like her the opportunity to grow financially.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: pay for medical treatment.

loans.name: Darwin Adonay

texts.es:
Darwin tiene 25 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad de Santa Fe en el municipio de Trojes. 

Darwin inició a seis años a dedicarse a la siembra de hortalizas y café y aprendió de estos oficios por su padre. La mayoria del tiempo trabaja solo pero de vez en cuando tiene que contratar dos o tres empleados para realizar ciertas actividades en la tierra cultivada. La jornada laboral en la finca inicia a las 6 am y culmina a las 2 pm para sus empleados, pero él se queda realizando el riego y cuidando los cultivos. 

El prestamo que Darwin esta solicitando lo necesita para pagar la mano de obra de sus empleados por el mantenimiento dado a sus cultivos de tomate y cafe. Con el apoyo del prestamo podrá seguir dandole el mantenimiento adecuado a sus cultivos y sus empleados tendran una fuente de ingresos y sus productos seran de mayor calidad y los vendera a un mejor precio.

Su meta es ser uno de lo mayores productores de la region para darle a su familia una mejor condicion de vida. Darwin ha recibido tres prestamos en FAMA y ha cumplido con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Darwin is 25 years old, married, and has one son.  He lives with his family in the community of Santa Fe in the municipality of Trojes.

Darwin started working at 6 years old planting vegetables and coffee, which he learned from his father.  Most of the time he works alone but sometimes he hires two or three employees to help with some of the jobs cultivating land.  A typical work day on the farm begins at 6 am and ends at 2 pm for the employees but he stays to water and care for the crops.

The loan Darwin requests is needed to pay the employees for their work maintaing the tomato and coffee crops.  With the help of the loan he will be able to adequately maintain his crops, his employees will have a source of income, and his products will be of better quality and sell at a higher price.

His goal is to be one of the biggest producers in the region and give his family a better quality of life.  Darwin has received three loans from FAMA and has completed the payments on time.

loans.use: pay for labor.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La Sra. Angélica pertenece al Banco Comunal “Pachacutec II”, Distrito D. La Banda D. Shilcayo, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 50 años, está casada y tiene 05 hijos independientes.
Hace 10 años que inició su negocio D. venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad, D. esta forma apoyó con la educación D. sus hijos, pero por algunos problemas familiares el negocio fue decayéndose, hace dos años que decidió formar parte del Banquito Comunal y con el préstamo D. S/. 300.00, logró reactivar su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, y actualmente prepara comida (almuerzos) para dar pensión a sus clientes, todo esto la mantiene en actividad, D. esa manera genera sus propios ingresos.
Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00, implementará su negocio con productos como conservas, golosinas, abarrotes y bebidas gasificadas.
Angélica es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora,  su sueño es seguir ampliando su tienda D. abarrotes y tener un restaurante, para lograr la estabilidad económica que tanto anhela.
texts.en:
Angélica belongs to the communal bank “Pachacutec II,” which is in the district La Banda D. Shilcayo, San Martín Province, department of San Martín. She’s 50 years old, married, and has 5 grown children. 

She started her business selling necessities 10 years ago and was able to support her children’s education. However, due to some personal problems the business fell through. Two years ago she decided to join the communal bank, and with a loan of S/. 300.00 she was able to restart her business selling groceries. Now she prepares food (lunches) in order to better serve her customers. All this keeps her in business, and in this manner she generates her own income. 

With this new loan of S/. 1,200.00 she will expand her business with products like preserves, candy, groceries, and soda. 

Angélica is a hardworking and tenacious woman. Her dream is to continue expanding her grocery store and have a restaurant so that she can have the economic stability that she craves.

loans.use: to buy groceries like preserves, sweets, food, and soda.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
La Sra. Diana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Pachacutec II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, su edad es 22 años y tiene una niña de 04 años de edad, que estudia el nivel inicial.
Hace tres años que inició el negocio de compra y venta de gallinas criollas, patos y pavos, en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarapoto con un capital de S/. 300.00, actividad que realiza desde las 5:00 am hasta el medio día, su esposo  le ayuda por dos horas ya que el trabaja con su mototaxi, es así como ambos trabajan mucho para sacar adelante su hermosa familia. Actualmente cuenta con clientes fijos como los restaurantes que venden comida Regionales, y personas particulares que acuden al mercado en busca de estos animales.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00,  comprará  aves de corral como gallinas, patos y pavos para la cena Navideña, cuenta con muchos pedidos para esa fecha.
Diana es una mujer trabajadora,  que sueña con tener un restaurante, para poder trabajar desde casa y cuidar a su pequeña hija, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de generar sus propios ingresos
texts.en:
Diana belongs to the communal bank “Pachacutec II,” which is in the district of La Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín province, department of San Martín. She is 22, in a common law marriage, and has a 4 year old daughter who is in kindergarten. 

She began her business buying and selling native hens, ducks, and turkeys three years ago in the market of Tarapoto city with S/. 300.00. She does this work from 5:00 am until noon. Her husband helps her for two hours since he drives a moto-taxi. In this way they both work together to support their lovely family. Right now she has regular customers like restaurants that serve regional fare and certain people who go to the market looking for those animals. 

With this loan of S/. 1000.00, she will buy barnyard fowl like hens, ducks, and turkeys for Christmas dinner. She has many orders for this date.  

Diana is a very hardworking woman. Her dream is to have a restaurant to be able to work from home and care for her young daughter. She is very thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to earn her own money.

loans.use: to  buy barnyard animals like hens, ducks, and turkeys.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los claveles”, del Distrito D. picota, Provincia D. Picota, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años, estudió la carrera D.  técnica en Enfermería, actualmente  trabaja como docente en un colegio D. su localidad. Tiene 03 hijos, él  mayor tiene 32 años, el segundo 26 años y son independientes y la  menor tiene 22 años D. edad que está a su cargo es estudiante del nivel superior.
Por iniciativa propia incursiona en la venta D. productos D. belleza, al inicio era ayudante D. venta se dio cuenta que siendo directa tenía mucho más descuentos y regalo por parte D. la empresa. Inicia con un capital D. 300.00 nuevos soles que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le brindó. 
Con este préstamo D. S/. 400.00, comprará más cosméticos e incrementará su stock D. productos como: lápices labiales, talcos para el  cuerpo, perfumes, colonias, cremas faciales para  así satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes, amigos (as), familiares, y vecinos. 
La Sra. Ana Mercedes es una mujer muy  trabajadora, anhela ampliar su negocio;  esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella. Y además se siente muy contenta por las sesiones educativas que se realizan y por la unión que existe entre las socias.
texts.en:
Ana Mercedes belongs to the communal bank “Los claveles,” Picota province, department of San Martín. She is 54 years old, married, and studied for a career in nursing. Right now she works as a docent at the local college. She has 3 children. The oldest is 32 years old, and the second is 26. They are living on their own. The youngest is 22 years old and in her care; she is an upper level student.  

Through her own initiative she began selling beauty products. In the beginning she was a sales assistant, and she realized that by being in charge she would have many more discounts and gifts from the company. She began with starting capital of 300.00 nuevos soles that Movimiento Manuela Ramos provided her. 

With this loan of S/. 400.00 she will buy more cosmetics and increase her stock of products like lip liners, talc body powder, perfumes, colognes, and facial cream to meet the needs of her clients, friends, family members, and neighbors. 

Ana Mercedes is a very hardworking woman, and she wishes to expand her business. She is very thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her. Furthermore she is very satisfied with the educational sessions that they put on and for the linkages that exist between the members.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Beily

texts.es:
La Sra. Beily pertenece al Banco Comunal “Pachacutec II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, su edad es 27 años y tiene un hijo de 1 año y 3 meses.
Cansada de estar entre cuatro paredes en su trabajo, decidió iniciar un pequeño negocio para generar ingresos desde casa y con la ayuda del Banquito y un capital de S/.300.00 compró gaseosas, frugos y posteriormente obtiene productos de su chacra como plátanos de diferentes variedades que es de consumo masivo en nuestra ciudad, que también lo esta aprovechando para generar ingresos y continuar contribuyendo con los gastos de su hogar y con la crianza de su pequeño hijo. Su esposo trabaja en una institución pública es por ello que ella se encarga de su negocio sóla.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00,  comprará gaseosas y fertilizantes para mejorar su producción de plátanos y además esta realizando algunos arreglos en el pequeño espacio que le cedió su mamá para que pueda realizar la venta de sus productos.
Beily es una mujer trabajadora y  entusiasta,  su sueño es tener un Mini Market como negocio para generar mayores ingresos y poner en práctica la carrera técnica que estudió Contabilidad, y de esta manera dar trabajo a mujeres que necesitan independizarse, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por los talleres de capacitación que viene recibiendo, porque fortalece sus capacidades para seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Beily belongs to the communal bank “Pachacutec II,” district of La Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín province, department of San Martín. She is 27, married, and has a son who is one year and three months. 

Tired of being between four walls at work, she decided to begin a small business to generate an income from home. With the help of the communal bank and a loan of S/.300.00 she bought sodas and fruits. Later she got products from her ranch like different varieties of plantains that are widely eaten in her city. She’s making the most of being able to earn an income, to continue contributing to the household expenses, and to raise her young daughter. Her husband works in a public institution, and for that reason the business is solely in her care. 

With this loan of S/. 2,000.00 she will buy soda and fertilizers to improve her plantain crop. She is also making some adjustment to the small space which was given to her by her mother so that she can sell her products. 

Beily is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman. Her dream is to have a mini market business to generate a better income and to put into practice her accounting education. In this manner she will give work to women who need to be able to support themselves. She thanks Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the training workshops that she has been receiving because they enhance her ability to continue moving forwards and to realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy sodas

loans.name: Sulmi

texts.es:
La Sra. Sulmi, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Pachacutec II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, de 32 años de edad y tiene 02 hijos de 12 y 07 años de edad, que están estudiando el nivel secundario y primario.
Al ingresar como socia del Banquito, emprendió su negocio de venta de asados en la vereda de su casa con un capital de S/. 300.00,  pero por problemas de salud lo dejó, y decidió vender sábanas y zapatos artesanales que su esposo le trae de sus viajes, además compra  y vende  artefactos de segunda mano, es así como viene generando ingresos para su  hogar, su esposo como trabajador de una institución pública, le ayuda a conseguir clientes fijos. Actualmente cuenta con clientes fijos y personas particulares.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00,  comprará sabanas y zapatos para satisfacer a sus clientes, durante la campaña Navideña.
Sulmi es una mujer trabajadora,  que tiene como sueño ahorrar dinero para contar con fincas de plantaciones de cacao, para procesar los granos y obtener  chocolates.
Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella de generar sus propios ingresos y fomentar la cultura del ahorro para hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sulmi belongs to the communal bank "Pachacutec II" in the La Banda de Shilcayo district in the province and department of San Martin.  She is 32,  lives with a partner, and has 2 children aged 12 and 7 who are in middle and elementary school.

When she joined the communal bank, she started up her own business selling grilled meat at the front of her house with capital of 300 Peruvian soles.  But she stopped doing that because of health problems, and she decided to sell bed sheets and hand-made shoes that her husband brings her from his travels.  In addition, she buys and sells second hand appliances, and in this way she has been generating income for her household.  Her husband works for a public institution, and he helps her to get regular customers.  Now she sells to regular customers and individuals.

With this loan of 1,200 Peruvian soles, she will buy bed sheets and shoes to satisfy the demands of her customers during the Christmas season.  

Sulmi is a hardworking woman who has a dream of saving money in order to have farms where she could cultivate cocoa, process the beans and make chocolate.

She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for providing opportunities to women like herself to generate their own income, and for promoting a culture of saving so that they can make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets and shoes

loans.name: Luz  Magaly

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz Magaly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Pachacutec II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de  San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 27 años, está casada y tiene 02 hijos menores de edad de 10 y 03 años, la mayor está estudiando el nivel Primario. 
Empezó vendiendo productos de belleza, al ingresar al banquito ya hace mas de un año decidió incrementar sus ingresos con un nuevo negocio con la venta de salchipapas, su esposo la ayudó con la compra de un carrito salchipapero y le faltaban los insumos, es asi que el primer préstamo de S/.300.00, lo usó  para comprar  insumos como papa, aceite, hot dog, y desde entonces viene trabajando todos los días de 5:30 pm hasta las 10:00 pm, para generar ingresos que pueda contribuir con la economía de su hogar, su esposo le ayuda con la atención de los clientes que son sus vecinos, transeúntes.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00,  comprará  productos e ingredientes al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos como papas por sacos, aceite por galones y los condimentos, además comprará los envases descartables que utiliza en su negocio y gaseosas que es un complemento para su negocio. 
Luz Magaly, es una mujer trabajadora, su sueño es construir su casa para tener un local propio donde pueda implementar un negocio familiar que les permita  crecer  y mejorar económicamente, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de generar sus propios ingresos, y fomentarles la cultura del ahorro para poder cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Luz Magaly belongs to the communal bank Pachacutec II, in the district of La Banda de Shilcayo, in the province of San Martín, in the Department of San Martín. She is 27 years old, married and has 2 young children 10 and 3 years old and the older child attends primary school.

She began selling beauty products, starting with a little bench, and more than a year ago decided to increase their income with a new business by selling salchipapas [fried potatoes and hot dogs or sausages served with condiments]. Her husband helped by buying a salchipapero [a cart from which to sell salchipapas] but it lacked supplies, and this is the reason for her first loan of 300 soles. She used it to buy supplies such as potatoes, oil, hot dogs, and since then she has been working every day from 5:30PM until 10:00PM in order to earn income that she can contribute to the household expenses. Her husband helps her by tending to the customers who are her neighbors and passers-by.

With this loan of 1000 soles she will buy wholesale products and ingredients and thus reduce the costs, such as sacks of potatoes, gallons of oil, and the condiments, and she will also buy the throwaway containers that she uses in the business and soft drinks that round out the meal.

Luz Magaly is a hardworking woman, and her dream is to build a house in order to have her own facility where she can expand her family business that  will permit her to grow and improve financially. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to earn her own income, and to foster a culture of savings in order to be able to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sacks of potatoes, oil by the gallon, and condiments

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La Sra. Magdalena pertenece al Banco Comunal “Consuelo”, del Distrito de San Pablo, Provincia de Bellavista y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años, y 04 hijos todos están a su cargo, el mayor  tiene 15 años estudiante del 4to de secundaria, la segunda de 11 años cursa  el sexto de secundaria, el tercero de 6 años cursa el primero de secundaria y el menor de 2 años.
Al tener pareja se dedica a la agricultura, por iniciativa se de su esposo incursiona en el negocio de salchipollo  que no le va bien , después decide incursionar en el negocio de ropa de segunda mano y actualmente lo sigue haciendo además incorporo útiles escolares, su esposo le ayuda esporádicamente. Se inicio con un capital de 300.00 nuevos soles que le brindo el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará  fardos de ropa usada para dama, caballero y niños, útiles escolares. 
La Sra. Magdalena  se considera una mujer exitosa, anhela  incrementar prendas de vestir y que sus hijos sean profesionales, está muy satisfecha con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Magdalena belongs to the communal bank “Consuelo” in the San Pablo district of the province of Bellavista and department of San Martin.  She lives with her partner, is 37 years old and has 4 children, all of whom are in her care.  The oldest is 15 years old and in his fourth year of secondary school, the second oldest is 11 and in sixth grade, the third is 6 in first grade and the youngest is 2.  

When she got married she worked in farming, an initiative her husband started in Salchipollo that didn’t go well.  Afterwards, she decided to get into the business of selling second hand clothing.  Now she keeps selling clothes and has also added school supplies.  Her husband helps occasionally.  She started with 300.00 nuevos soles given to her by Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

With this loan of 1,500.00 soles, she will buy bundles of used clothes for women, men, and children, and school supplies.

Magdalena considers herself a successful woman.  She years to increase her articles of clothing and hopes that her children will be professionals.  She is very happy with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her have opportunities to develop and move forward.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second hand clothes and school supplies.

loans.name: Lisbith

texts.es:
La Sra. Lisbith,  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Pachacutec II”, Distrito de La banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de  San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 42 años, está separada y tiene 05 hijos de los cuales 04 viven con ella, 01 trabaja para ayudarla con los gastos de la casa y 02  están estudiando el nivel secundario y 01 el nivel primario.
Siempre trabajó para generar sus propios ingresos, cuando se separó de su esposo se vió en la necesidad de obtener más  ingresos para mantener a sus hijos,  lavando ropa,  limpiando pisos pudo ahorrar algo de dinero  para emprender un nuevo negocio compró su parrilla y el primer préstamo del banquito S/.300.00,  le sirvió para comprar insumos, es así como empezó vendiendo en la vereda de su casa, pero lo que vendía  a penas le alcanzaba para los gastos básicos, pero decidió llevar su venta a la esquina de su casa,  por ser un lugar estratégico, desde entonces puede ahorrar para hacerse de algunos artefactos que necesitan en su hogar , esto con la ayuda de sus hijos. Actualmente cuenta con una amplia clientela que la busca por la amabilidad y el buen trato que les brinda, además de su rica preparación, ha salido adelante con sus hijos a los que mantiene y le brinda educación.
Con este préstamo de S/.1500.00,  comprará  productos paraimplementar su negocio con pollos vivos, ingredientes para sazonar, carbón para asar sus  parrillas y preparar comida, para así captar nuevos clientes y mantener satisfechos a sus clientes actuales, pues su negocio está bien ubicado.
Lisbith, es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un local para implementar un restaurant, donde pueda trabajar junto a sus hijos, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo que le permite seguir generando sus propios ingresos, y hacer realidad sus sueños.
La foto está unpoco oscura debido a que se tomó de noche.
texts.en:
Lisbith belongs to the communal bank “Pachacutec II” in the district of La banda de Shilcayo, Province of San Martin, Department of San Martin.  She is 42 years old and is separated from her husband.  She has five children, four of whom live with her and work to help her with the household expenses.  Two of them are in secondary school, and one is in primary school.

She always has worked to earn her own income.  When she separated from her husband, she realized that she needed more income to take care of her children.  By washing clothes and cleaning floors was able to save some money to start her own business.  With her first loan she purchased a grill and supplies, which allowed her to start selling food items in front of her home.  However, her earnings from this barely covered her basic expenses.

She decided to move her business to a corner, since it was a strategic location.  This, along with the help of her children, has allowed her to save enough to buy some items that her family needs.

Currently she has many customers, who seek her out for her friendly demeanor and the good service she provides.  They also like her tasty dishes.  She has made much progress with her children and is able to provide for their education.

With this loan, she will buy products for her business, including live chickens, seasoning, and charcoal for her grill.  This way she will be able to gain new customers and keep her current customers satisfied, since her business is in a good location.

Lisbith is a very hardworking and enterprising woman.  Her dream is to have her own restaurant, where she can work alongside her children.

She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for making this loan possible, which will allow her to continue earning her own income and make her dreams a reality.

The photo is a little dark since it was taken at night.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es socia del Banco Comunal “Candelaria” del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación primaria.

Trabaja desde hace un año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de granos de la región, también se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Con éste nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, etc,  para su tienda.
La señora trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Lima como costurero.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa y su carro.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y la puntualidad
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the Candelaria Communal Bank in the district and province of Puno. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children in primary school. She has worked with Movimiento Manuel Ramos for one year. Her first loan was for the sum of 500 new soles which she invested in her business buying and selling grains from her region. She also engages in the sale of groceries. With this new loan in the amount of 300 new soles she will purchase rice, sugar, etc. for her shop.

Irene works alone in her business. Her husband works in the city of Lima as a tailor. Her dream for the future is to have her own house and car. What she likes most about her communal bank are the opportunity to save money and the encouragement to pay loans punctually.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, etc.for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth es socia del Banco Comunal “Candelaria” del centro poblado Poccona, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y cuenta con estudios de educación secundaria (incompleta).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro ciclos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio compra y venta de papa y chuño.

Con éste préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles comprará diez sacos de papa y chuño, los productos los compra en Yunguyo y los vende en la ciudad de Ilo.  Trabaja junto con su papá

Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar y seguir  con el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el dialogo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a partner of "Candelaria" communal bank in Poccona village, in the district and province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 21, single and has completed some levels of secondary education (not all).

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four loan cycles. Her first loan was for the amount of S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, that she invested in her business, which is buying and selling potatoes and chuño.

She will use this loan of S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles to buy ten bags of potatoes and chuño. She buys these products in Yunguyo and sells them in Ilo city.

She works together with her father.

Her dream is to improve and keep her business in the future.

What she likes the most about her communal bank is the possibility of dialogue and savings.

loans.use: To buy ten bags of potatoes and chuño.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Luordes vive en casa de sus padres, ella desea el credito debido a que ahora se aproximas las festividades de fin de año y desea comprar mercaderia como harinas, huevos y otros de modo que ahora podra surtir su pequeño de ventas de alimentos y no vender solo verduras, de este modo que pueda obtener mejores ingresos y poder brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su hija.
Lourdes comprara todo tipo de insumos, desde alimentos ya procesados como insumos para procesar.
El credito anterior que obtuvo le sirvio de mucho ya que se dio cuenta que ella tiene la capacidad de poder generar mejores ingresos al invertir en capital. Por ello se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que confiaron en ella.
texts.en: Lourdes lives in her parent’s house.  She wants this loan because now that the end of the year festivities are coming up she wants to buy products like flour, eggs, and others so that she may vary her food sales, not just vegetables.  In this way she will make more income and be able to give her daughter a better quality of life.  Lourdes will buy all kinds of supplies, from prepared foods to ingredients.  The last loan she received helped her a lot and she realized she has the capacity to generate more income to invest in capital.  She is very grateful for the people who believed in her.

loans.use: Compra de insumos y mercaderia para actividad de venta de tienda de barrio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Rey Mariano

texts.en: Rey Mariano is single. He is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. Rey operates a specialized retail store, which sells a variety of food products, in the local community to earn a living. He has been doing this for 17 years and every month he earns PHP7,000 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP15,000 to purchase additional products to sell. Rey Mariano has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Rey Mariano hopes to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 43 years old. She is married with two children, and she's from Gala Ozamiz City. 

Susan has been operating a farming business for 20 years, and she earns 20,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Susan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Susan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van is a local farmer who has been living in Kompong Speu province. She grows rice crops on her own farmland for livelihood, earning approximately $2.00 per day, while her husband works as a construction worker with his team. She is the mother of four single children, two of whom are attending school and live under her income. The other daughters are working in a garment factory as sewing staff. The purpose of this loan is to cover the ground in her house with mortar. This will cost KHR2,000,000. And she hopes that it will provide a comfortable living environment for her family.

loans.use: to cover the ground in her house with mortar.

loans.name: Rimnan

texts.en:
Rimnan is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Rimnan is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Rimnan operates a specialized retail business, selling electronic products in the local community. Rimnan has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. Rimnan is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2010, Rimnan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to expand the product offerings in her retail electronics store.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria is a 44-year-old married woman with 11 children. She resides at Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Silveria owns and operates a business venture selling "kangkong" (swamp cabbage or water spinach) in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business 14 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 with her business. 

Silveria is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year, and she has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 in order to purchase more kangkong to sell. In the future, Silveria wants to make improvements of her house and to finish educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase more kangkong to sell.

loans.name: Medelyn

texts.en:
Medelyn is a 44-year-old married woman with three children who resides at Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, Medelyn owns and operates a gardening business, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been in this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 with her business. 

Medelyn has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In the future, Medelyn wants to make improvements to her house and to finish educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Davaahuu

texts.en: Davaahuu is 43 years old and lives with her sister in ger(Mongolian yurt) in Govi-altai province, Mongolia. Her sister is a college student. Davaahuu started her business in 2009 by selling garments in the market. Even though she is fairly new to the business, her products are very stylish and cheap; therefore her products sell fast. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to fill her supplies with warmer clothes; therefore, she is requesting 3,800,000 MNT to buy new dresses and winter coats. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "My business is going so well and if I dont sell warmer clothes, my business will shutdown."

loans.use: To buy new dresses and winter coats.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 39 years old and married with two children. She is from Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Geraldine runs a general store in the local community, selling a variety of food and home use products such as candies and cigarettes, etc. She has been in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately PHP 3,000 a month.

In 2009, Geraldine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Geraldine is requesting a loan of PHP 4,550, which she will use to purchase new items and expand the product offerings in her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to expand the product offerings in her store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda, 56, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Rosalinda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 6000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosalinda hopes to grow her business and increase her clients in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Gombo

texts.en: Gombo is 72 years old and lives with with his wife and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His one child attends university. His wife and son both help him with the business. He was an agronomy teacher until 1995 when he started his own business by growing vegetables. He has his own storage and 0.2 acres of land. His wife sells the vegetables in market in her own counter. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says "Man doesn't retire. Nowadays, people say they are retired and just simply stay at home." He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more seeds.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 53 years old, married and has 7 children. She lives in the Philippines.

Evangeline is a farmer who operates a gardening business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years and every month she earns PHP 2,000 from this work. Evangeline has been a member of GDMPC for a year.  She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Enhjil

texts.en: Enhjil is 29 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in ger (Mongolian yurt) in Baganuur province, Mongolia. His wife runs a small grocery shop and his daughter goes to kindergarten. He started his internet cafe and pc repairing business in 2010 by renting a space in building. His business is highly profitable however his computer's condition is poor; therefore, he needs to upgrade his computers in order to be more competitive. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says " While I am young, I need to stable my business." He is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase computer equipment to upgrade his computers.

loans.use: To purchase computer equipment to upgrade his computers.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with one child. Jennifer is 26 years old, residing at Baliangao, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Jennifer owns and operates a fishing business venture where she sells seafood products including crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Each month, she earns 2,800.00 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 4,000.00 to repair her fishing boat. Jennifer has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Jennifer wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a 30-year-old married man who has been blessed with two children. For a living, Noel has been engaged in the agricultural business for eight years. He particularly grows rice crops on his farm land. Noel works hard to support the needs of his family.

Noel and his wife do some of the farming activities to minimize their expenses in hiring laborers. However the budget they saved for the next preparation of his rice field is not enough.
