For this reason, Noel is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy supplies to improve the farm land and growth of rice crops, such as fertilizer and medicines. 

He hopes that through providing complete medicines and fertilizer to his crops, he will gain a plentiful harvest. Noel also prays that he can support the educational needs of his children.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizer and medicines for his crops.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Erdenetsetseg is 33 years old and lives with her son in ger (Mongolian yurt) in Baganuur province, Mongolia.  Her son is a school student. She started her garment and accessories retail business in 2006 by renting a counter in the market. She found out that her customers demand more high quality products therefore she needs to buy some higher quality garments and accesssories to keep up with the market. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "I am the only one supporting my son therefore, I need to do everything I can to make my son happy." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT to buy luxury, such as a pendants or earrings to sell in the new year.

loans.use: To buy higher quality items, such as a pendant or earrings, to sell in the new year.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna has been married for seven years, and is blessed with three children. Until now her family has not been very fortunate, even though they do have some income. Together with her spouse, who is a farmer in the village where they live, they plant and harvest rice which they sell. They have been doing this since they got married. They cultivate a hectare plot of land which they inherited from her in-laws. 

She is now asking for loan because she wants to improve her crop production. She is asking for PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides to use on their farm. 

She hopes this loan will be granted to her as it will help to develop her business and improve her family's life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides to use on her land.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 28 years old and married.  She is from the village of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Jona sells banana cue (deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar) in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

Jona is requesting a loan for 30,000 PHP,, which she will use to purchase raw materials need to make banana cue.  Banana cue is made from Saba bananas. Jona joined GDMPC for financial assistance as additional investment to her business. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials  need to make banana cue

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Myagmarsuren is 31 years old and lives with his wife and son in ger (Mongolian yurt) in uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is a cook in a local café and his son goes to kindergarden. He started his taxi service business in 2008 using his own car. He bought a car for his wife using the profits from his business. His business is stable and gives enough support to the family. However during the winter he loses a lot of money to pay the garage. This year, he is building his own garage in his yard therefore he is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy building materials. He has some experience in build a building therefore, he is not particularly worried about the construction work.

loans.use: To buy building materials for his garage.

loans.name: Gundsambuu

texts.en: Gundsambuu is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bulgan province, Mongolia. Her husband is a school teacher and her two kids go to kindergarden. She started her hairdressing business in 2005 by renting a space in a market. Her hairdressing skills are excellent, however she's losing a lot of customers due to her rusty old equipment. Therefore she is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy new equipment. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy new hairdressing equipment.

loans.use: To buy new hairdresser equipment.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 40, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Vilma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help continue operations, she is requesting a Php 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Vilma hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
This is Maureen, 37, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Edwin, an overseas contract worker, and she is a mother to three children. She, together with her children, manages the own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maureen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maureen hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor is  46 years old and has two children. The eldest attends college while the youngest is in elementary school. He runs a farming business as his source of his income. He had been in the rice production business for 10 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP during harvest.

Melchor is requesting for a loan for 10,000 PHP, which he will use to buy herbicides and pesticides for his farming business. He hopes to achieve an abundant harvest to increase his earnings and keep sending his children to school. Melchor's priority is to support his family and assure them of a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Guideon

texts.en:
Guideon says that "determination and perseverance" are the characteristics needed in managing a rice farming business. He is 45 years old and married, having only one child.

Guideon plans to increase his yield despite the high cost of basic commodities, farm inputs, and labor cost of hiring laborers. He is determined to obtain his goal but due to a shortage of financial matters, he is asking for additional working capital worth 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). This amount will enable him to buy necessary farm inputs to make his rice farming more productive and profitable. He would be grateful for the requested amount because with the profit, he could provide basic necessities for his family and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for his rice farming business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, 26, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Arlene operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help continue operations, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Arlene hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Namoz

texts.ru: Намоз 49 – летний женатый мужчина. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка, один из сыновей занимается растениеводством. Сам он зарабатывает путем разведения курпнорогатого скота. Кроме того в свободное время он предоставляет услугу, такси. Кредит берет для закупа двух коров.
texts.en: Namoz is a forty-nine-year-old married man with five children. His wife is a homemaker, and one of his sons raises crops. Namoz's line of work is raising longhorn cattle. Apart from that, in his spare time he has a taxi service. He plans to use his loan to buy two cows.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy snacks, bread, jam, cheese, eggs, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Fayzikhon

texts.ru: Файзихон 32 – летний женатый мужчина. У него семеро детей. Он занимается торговлей национальной мужской одежды. Еще он продает тюбетейки. Кредит берет для приобретения новых видов тюбетеек.
texts.en: Fayzikhon is thirty-two and married with seven children. He makes his living selling ethnic clothing for men. He also sells skullcaps. He plans to use his loan to buy new styles of caps.

loans.use: to buy new styles of skullcaps.

loans.name: Etibarkhan

texts.ru: Этибархан 53 года,  растит одного сына. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2006 году Этибархан начала свой бизнес в торговле орехами и сухофруктами, использовав в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS).  Взяв в аренду торговое место на рынке, Этибархан приложила все усилия для развития бизнеса и добилась успехов – она является одним из ведущих поставщиков и продавцов сухофруктов на местном базаре. На сегодняшний день, ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, поэтому Этибархан обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS). Закуп товаров позволит ей расширить ассортимент, увеличить количество клиентов и повысить продажи.  В будущем, Этибархан планирует дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Etibarkhan is fifty-three and is raising one son.  In search of a source of income for the family, she started a business  in 2006 selling nuts and dried fruit with starting capital of 10,000KGS. After leasing space at the market, she put all her energy into developing the business and achieved success.  She became one of the leading suppliers and vendors of dried fruit at the market.  At present Etibarkhan doesn't have a wide enough assortment of items, so she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 110,000KGS.  Buying inventory will allow her to widen her selection, enhance the quality of her clientele and boost sales.  In the future she plans to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of goods.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Фируз житель района Яван. Возраст, 20 лет. Холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Уже пять лет как он занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания и парфюмерию. Кредит берет для приобретения шампуней, мыла, моющего средства, порошка, подгузников и продуктов.
texts.en: Firuz is a resident of the Yavan region. He is 20 years old, single and lives with his parents. He has been engaged in trade for five years. He has his own shop where he sells food products and perfumes. He will take a loan to buy shampoo, soap, powdered detergent, diapers and food.

loans.use: To purchase shampoo, soap, powdered detergent, diapers and food

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Amelia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She also buys and sells green and yellow bananas.  She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and bananas.

Amelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Amelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and bananas.

loans.name: Jeruk Manis 2 Group

texts.en:
Lince is a mother of two.  Her children are four and six years old.  The older one is of school age and is currently attending.  Lince has had a mobile phone counter since 2009 in front of her house.  Business has been steady and the income supplements her husband's income as a mechanic.  Together, they have been able to improve the well-being of their family. 

Long term, Lince hopes she can open a shop selling mobile phones, minutes, and accessories.  Additionally, she wants to be able to send her children to university.  

Other group members will use their loans to help their businesses which include selling yellow rice, making pastries, and selling side-dish food items.

loans.use: to pay for mobile phone minutes and accessories to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a 34 year old married woman with five children, two of whom attend school while the rest are still too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the basic provisions that the family needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwanarusi has operated a café for the past ten years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer needs in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, beans, rice and cooking oil for her café. She decided to join Yehu to access financial facilities.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, beans, rice and cooking oil for her café.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Fe has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, vegetables, spices, and firewood. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, vegetables, and firewood.

Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

Naneth has a shop that sells snacks like banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with caramelized brown sugar) and pancakes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Naneth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Rosemelia

texts.en:
Rosemelia is 36 years old and married to her husband Maximo, who is a farmer in Dalaoig, Alcala, Cagayan. To make a living, Rosemelia and her husband are both involved in rice production. They have been cultivating a hectare rice field, which enables them to produce yield of about 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per harvest season. Harvest falls twice a year during the months of April and November.

As of now, Rosemelia had insufficient funds so she is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers necessary in maintaining good crops.

In the future, Rosemelia hopes to strengthen her business and continue to send her two children into college education.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizers necessary for maintaining good crops.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a 45 year old married woman with eleven children, six of whom attend school while the rest are grown up. Her husband is a mechanic who contributes to the basic provisions the family needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Biasha has operated as a food vendor for the past three years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Rosalie Ann

texts.en:
Rosalie Ann is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Rosalie Ann has a carenderia (food shop) that sells cooked food like beef stick, adobo (a marinated stew) and afritada (chicken stew). She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients to make her dishes. 

Rosalie Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalie Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make cooked dishes to sell.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Gilbert has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gilbert has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gilbert hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Teresa has a shop that sells fish such as sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy fish to sell.

Teresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Teresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Fuamaitu

texts.en:
Fuamaitu is 32 years of age, married and has two children.

Fuamaitu owns and operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Fuamaitu needs a loan of WST $1500 to invest in expanding her business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Fuamaitu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fuamaitu's 2nd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and plastic bags.

loans.name: Judilin

texts.en:
Judilin is a 32-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, the Philippines. 

To earn her living, Judilin owns and operates a business venture selling a variety of different fruit and vegetables. She has been in this business for three years, and from it she earns PHP 4,000 each month. 

She requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell. Judilin has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Judilin wants to build herself a house and to ensure her children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Vabel

texts.en:
Vabel is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Vabel has a shop that sells coconut meat and fruit salad. She has had this business for seven years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts to make fruit salad.

Vabel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vabel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to make fruit salad.

loans.name: La Reforma 5 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Cristina is the coordinator of her group named La Reforma 5 & 7 (Reform). She has a long term partner and is a mother with 4 children, all living with her in a simple structure home, in a rural villa of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity here is the free trading zone, a cement factory, and other businesses.

Cristina has been operating gasoline sales for aproximately 10 years. She used some money she had to start doing business. She plans to use this loan to buy Gallon of gasoline. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business, this is a way to expand her sales and to supply more clients.  this is her 9th loan with us, and she is very exciting for it, from the beginning she had invested every loan in her business which she run from her house, in one of the main route in her community. 

Cristina thanks you all for your support to their dreams.

loans.use: to buy gasoline

loans.name: Tuinanau

texts.en:
Tuinanau is 52 years old and married with seven children.

Tuinanau works in her business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has three years of experience in this business. Tuinanau needs a loan of 1800 Samoa Tala (WST) to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 WST or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Tuinanau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Tuinanau's 3rd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Rosalinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to PHP buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Tavau

texts.en:
Tavau is a married mother with 10 children. She is 50 years old.

Tavau owns and operates a business venture, selling breadfruit products in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Tavau needs a loan of 1,500 Somoa Tala (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST or US $188 per week) to supplement her family's income.

Tavau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tavau's 2nd loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is from Baringin Sur. He is 48 years old and is married with three children. He works hard to give his family a better quality of life by doing something that brings additional income and will allow him to support his children and extended family. Rolando has been engaged in farming. He usually plants and harvests rice and sells it to the buyers. He is also engaged in a hog-raising business for their extra income. 

According to him, the income from his businesses will help him to cope with the needs of his family. Thus, Rolando wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested for the further growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландом уже десять лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку, где продает в оптом муку. Ей 46 лет. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Гуландом берет кредит для покупки муки.
texts.en:
Gulandom has been engaged in trade for ten years. She has a store where wholesale flour is sold. She is 46 years old, divorced and has two children. 

Gulandom is taking a loan to buy flour.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Maksudakhon

texts.ru:
Максудахон 61 год, замужем и воспитала четверых детей. Максудахон работает учителем  в местной школе и известна как принципиальный и взыскательный преподаватель.
К сожалению, зарплата учителей не является высокой, поэтому Максудахон решила  параллельно с основной деятельностью заняться своим бизнесом в торговле.  Использовав в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 20,000 сом , Максудахон приложила все усилия для развития деятельности  - она заготавливает и закупает у местного населения яблоки  для последующей перепродажи. Для этих целей, был построен специально герметизированный сарай, где при определенной температуре хранятся фрукты и приобретена машина для транспортировки на местный рынок. Это позволяет Максудахон получать прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом ежемесячно. 
 В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Максудахон обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 тонн яблок. Закуп товара позволит ей увеличить количество клиентов и повысить продажи.  В будущем, Максудахон планирует построить еще один большой склад для хранения фруктов.
texts.en:
Maksudakhon is 61 years old, married and raised four children. Maksudakhon works at a local school and is known as a principled and demanding teacher.

Unfortunately, a teacher's salary is not high, so Maksudakhon decided in parallel with her main work to do a trade business. Using a sum of 20,000 Kyrgyz Som (KGS) as starting capital, Maksudakhon made every effort to develop the activities -- she harvest and purchases apples from the local population for resale. For these purposes, a specially sealed barn was built, where fruits are stored at a certain temperature and a car was purchased for transportation to the local market. This allows Maksudakhon to earn a monthly profit of 20,000 som. 

In order to further develop her business, Максудахон contacted the company Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy five tons of apples. Procurement of these goods will allow her to expand the number of customers and increase sales. In the future, Maksudakhon plans to build a large warehouse for storage of fruit.

loans.use: to purchase fruits for resale

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 3 children.

Cherry has a shop that sells fish like mackerel, trout and sardines. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Cherry has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cherry hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio's primary source of income comes from rice farming. He is 56 years of age and yet still single. He is living with his parents. Dionicio aims for better yields and larger profit with every crop. He grows rice crops on his one-hectare rice field.

Dionicio would like to provide his parents needs, so he devotes his time to cultivating his rice field to increase his yields. He is glad because he has spent the last 20 years maintaining his farm and he is able to support his parents. Now that his parents are weak, he needs additional capital because of his expenses for their medicines.

Dionicio decided to avail himself of a loan of 30,000 PHP, allowing him to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides which will be use towards the growth of his rice fields. He is hoping that his plans will be fulfilled.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides which will be used towards the growth of his rice fields

loans.name: Amilani

texts.en:
Amilani is married, 39 years of age, and has six children.

Amilani works in her business, planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. Amilani needs a loan of 1,500 Somoa Tala (WST) to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 WST or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Amilani joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Amilani's 2nd loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Palolo

texts.en:
Palolo is a married mother of five children. She is 57 years old.

Palolo is starting a business venture selling fried foods in the local community. Palolo needs a loan of 1000 Somoa Tala (WST) to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300WST or US$125 per week) to make improvements to her house.

Palolo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Palolo's first loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Lucy has a shop that makes and sells snacks like pan cakes and rice cakes. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Lucy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lucy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is 40 years old. She is not educated as her family's financial situation did not permit it. She is the mother of three children: one daughter and two sons. She doesn’t want her children to have the same destiny as her which is why she has enrolled all her children in school. 
   
Rubina's husband's income relies on his meat business. He runs a butcher shop where he sells red meat (goats) to his customers. His clients come from among his community and his friends. Every month he makes good sales figures and generates a good revenue. He has been working in this business for more than ten years.

To improve the finances of the business and increase their clients, Rubina has asked Kiva partner, Asasah, for a loan. Her husband will use the loan to purchase goats so he can sell their meat. 

She hopes that this investment will have a positive financial impact on the business and that the family will be able to use their increased income to improve their well-being.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell in a butchers shop.

loans.name: Tuaoi

texts.en:
Tuaoi is 39 years of age, married, and has three children.

Tuaoi owns and operates a business venture selling fried foods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Tuaoi needs a loan of 1,500 Somoa Tala (WST) to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tuaoi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tuaoi's 2nd loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Juan

Juan is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which he will use to buy sacks of bananas, coconuts, and ginger. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Juan hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of bananas, coconuts, and ginger.

loans.name: Pura

Pura is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks from Natasha and Avon. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Pura hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from Natasha and Avon.

Manoa needs a loan of Samoan Talas (WST) 1,000 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 WST or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Manoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Manoa's first loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

Roselle Jane has a shop that makes and sells longganisa (home-made sausages). She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy the raw ingredients she needs to make the sausages. 

Roselle Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Roselle Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed to make home-made sausages.

loans.name: Ufiata

Ufiata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ufiata's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. Муборак является матерью троих детей. На сегодняшний день она открыла дилерский центр, где она продает сим карты, занимается пополнением баланса мобильных телефонов. Кредит просит для расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Muborak lives in the Hamadoni area. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of three children. To date, she has opened a shop where she sells SIM cards and engages in topping up services for cell phones. The loan request is to expand her activities.

loans.use: to repair the premises and purchase new SIM cards

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 57 years old and widowed. She lives in the Philippines. Evelyn has a shop that sells coconuts and green bananas. She has had this business for 15 years. 

Evelyn is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts and bananas.

Anita works in her business selling lavalavas ("bottom-half" skirt-like wrap-around print cloth worn by both men and women).  She has 3 years of experience in this business. Anita needs a loan of WST 2,000 to invest in expanding the business by purchasing fabric, threads, needles, and an elei printing board (decorative printing method used to embellish fabric).  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Anita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Anita's 3rd loan with SPBD. 


*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

Rizan has a shop that sells fish such as trout, sardines and mackerel. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more fish to sell.

Rizan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rizan hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

Tusigaigoa needs a loan of Samoan Talas (WST) 1,000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tusigaigoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tusigaigoa's first loan with SPBD.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. Her husband is a fisherman who contributes to the family's basic needs. Fatuma owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Fatuma has operated a vegetable grocery for the past two years; her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of rising prices of commodities in the market. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase more stocks of vegetable such as tomatoes, onions, cabbages and sweet potatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of their quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetable such as tomatoes, onions, cabbages and sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Epripras

texts.en:
Epripras is married and has four children. She is 61 years old, and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, the Philippines. 

Epripras owns and operates a coco plantation, harvesting and selling coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She makes PHP 3,500 a month from her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Epripras has been a member of GDMPC for a year. Epripras wants to save the revenue generated from the business as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 39 year old married woman with seven children. She works in rice production. Her husband is also a farmer who helps her to cultivate their family's land. 

Laila wants to give her children a good life. She will do anything to lift them out of poverty. This is why she has asked for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and rice seedlings. 

Laila believes that this loan will be a tremendous help to her in increasing the yield from her farm.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and rice seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and breads.

loans.name: Pisa

texts.en:
Pisa is a married mother of 5 children. She is 56 years old.

Pisa owns and operates a business venture selling both food & daily use products in the local community. She has many years of experience in this business. Pisa needs a loan of 2,200 Somoa Tala (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400WST or US$167 per week) to financially support members of her immediate family.

Pisa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Pisa fifth loan with SPBD.

Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." loans.name: Seine

texts.en:
Seine is married, 28 years old, and has two children.

Seine works in her plantation business, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has three years of experience in this business. Seine needs a loan of 2,000 Somoa Tala(WST) to  purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST$300 or US$125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Seine joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Seine's 3rd loan with SPBD.

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Ric

texts.en:
Ric manages a small farm in his village. He plants and harvests rice, which he sells to the market. He is 35 years old and is married with two children. The eldest child is currently studying while the youngest one is still an infant. Ric patiently tills his rice farm in order to provide for his family's needs.

Ric has been running his farm for eight years and he only earns PHP 20,000 per crop season. According to Ric, his generated income goes to their daily needs such as paying the electricity bill monthly. Due to increased household expenses, his budget for replanting and maintaining his farm is no longer enough. So, he is asking for financial support from lenders in the amount of PHP 30,000, which he will use to buy fertilizer and insecticides for the  care and maintenance of his rice crops. These inputs will greatly affect his farming for the better, which will enable him to save for the future of his children and improve his business production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for the care and maintenance of his rice crops.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a single mother of one school-going child. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mwanamkuu has operated a retail shop for the past year; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of a lack of enough capital to expand her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the loan for 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of their fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with eight children. 

Clara has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Clara has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Clara hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mariael

texts.en:
Mariael is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Mariael has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Mariael has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mariael hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married mother. She is 56 years old and has 7 children.

Susana owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has 5 years of experience in this business. Susana needs a loan of Samoan Talas (WST) 2,700 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 WST or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Susana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Susana's 6th loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Alipio

texts.en:
Alipio is 47 years old, married and blessed with four children. To make a living, he is runs a farm. It is a great help in providing for the family's necessities. However there are some staple items that he can not afford because his income is not big enough. For example, he suffers from the high prices of food, and as a result, his family is experiencing financial constraints.

This means that he finds it difficult to provide for his family as well as his business. However he is strong, and is striving very hard to earn enough to satisfy his family's financial needs. In order to do so, he needs to invest in his business. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seed, fertilizer, pesticide and also labor that he needs for his farm.

With his unending patience he hopes to get a productive harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, pesticide and labor for his farm.

loans.name: Davlat

texts.ru: Давлат имеет высшее образование. По профессии он преподаватель. В этой области он уже 15 лет. Кроме этой работы он занимается торговлей. Он у себя дома открыл магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Davlat has a higher education.  He is a teacher and has been working in this field for 15 years.  Besides this work, he is involved in sales.  Davlat opened a store with a mixed assortment of goods at home.  He has been involved in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario is 44 years old and a farmer. He is very industrious; in addition to farming, he also raises chickens as an additional source of income. He is married and blessed with one school-aged child. To save for his child's future, he wants to improve his business. He is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for his corn field.

This loan would help him increase his income from his farming business, enabling him to provide for the needs of his family and his child's education.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school while the other one is too young for school. His wife Kwekwe is a farmer who contributes to the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

James has operated a retail shop for the past five years; his potential clients are his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings he wants to purchase more stocks of maize flour, sugar and wheat flour for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize flour, sugar and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran, 55 years old, is a talented lady. Her home-based business is sewing clothes for her relatives and neighbors. She is an expert in her work and does it with great interest. Her interest in work motivates and encourages her to sew dresses with new designs to satisfy her clients. Due to her talents and her flawless work, she has a good reputation among her clients. Her clients don’t argue about rates with her.
 
She is a happily married woman with three children. All of her children are educated and involved in different work. Her second son sells natural herbs. He operates a shop in the community where he deals with his customers. He has obtained a good reputation among his clients due to his high-quality herbs and knowledge about them. He has been managing his business for more than two years.
  
To improve the finances of the business, Ameeran is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. Her son intends to use this loan to purchase natural herbs to resell in his shop. She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy natural herbs

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 23 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Madelyn operates a fishing business, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She has been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 2,800 PHP. 

Madelyn is requesting a loan for 4,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fishing equipment such as hooks and nets. She has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Madelyn hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment such as hooks and nets.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with five children, two of whom are in school. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Hamisi has operated a motorcycle transport business for the past two years; his potential clients are the local area residents and travelers. He faces a major challenge of rising prices for fuel. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the loan for 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) he wants to start another business. He wishes to purchase cereals like maize and cow peas for his new cereals-selling business. He decided to join Yehu to access fund to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals like maize and cow peas for his new cereals-selling business.

loans.name: Levik

texts.en:
Levik is 55 years old. He lives in the Geghamavan village in the Sevan area with his wife, who is a housewife, and his son, who is a disabled person. Levik is a veterinarian. For many years Levik worked in Armenia and Uzbekistan and not only performing his specialty. 

Since 2008 Levik and his wife have been engaged in cattle breeding. Part of what is produced (meat, milk, cheese, butter) they use for their family, but for the most part they sell what they produce to procurement agencies to provide for their family. 

This is Levik’s third loan from Nor Horizon and he always makes his repayments on time.
 
Levik intends to develop his farm and therefore he is seeking a loan for 1,000,000 Armenian drams (AMD) to buy 8 sheep and 1 pig for his farm. He will also buy fodder for his cows and calves.

loans.use: to buy 8 sheep and 1 pig for his farm and fodder for his cows and calves

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwenda has operated a retail shop for the past twenty years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of insecurity. She dreams of operating a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase more stocks of soft drinks, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans for her shop. She decided to join Yehu because they offer quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soft drinks, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans for her shop.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is 52 years old, married, and has five children. He was raised by his parents in the farming business. With his farming business, Alberto is be able to send three of his children to school, while the other two have their own families. 

Alberto is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which he will use  to purchase corn seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers and pay for labor costs needed in planting. He wants to improve his business.

Alberto hopes his children complete their education until they earn degrees. He said that he will be the happiest father if they find a better job someday.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers and pay for labor needed in planting.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. Her husband is a teacher who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Margaret has operated a clothes-selling business for the past four years; her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of low sales in some months. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the loan for 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase more clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loan facilities.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 39 years old, married and has three children. Fernando dreams of lifting his family out of poverty, so he devotes himself to his farm where he plants and harvests rice which he sells. He earned PHP 15,000 from his last crop. He has also had a hog-raising business for the past three years, and earns PHP 3,000 for each piglet. He is thankful because with the income he generates from his businesses he is able to continue sending his children to school.

Fernando wants to take a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy rice seedlings and fertilizer. He says that he is working tirelessly in order to attain his dream and save money to further grow his business.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school. The other child is too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Jane has operated a charcoal selling business for the past four years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She dreams of opening a retail shop.

With the loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase more stocks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a widowed woman with three children, one of whom is attending school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child.

Tima has operated a café for the past two years; her potential clients are her neighbors and passers by. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase more food products like maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil for her café. She decided to join Yehu because of their quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more food products like maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil for her café.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San is a 56-year-old mother, who is married and has six children. Her oldest son works as a car driver for a fee, while some of her other children work at the rice field and are still in school. She started farming on her rice field 30 years ago to support her big family. 

San has been with VisionFund since 2010 and successfully paid back her previous loan with VisionFund. After the first loan cycle with VisionFund, she can afford to buy some basic household necessities for her family. San leads a group of two female members. She is now requesting another loan. She wants to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice field. 

She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it at a good price which will enable her to earn more income to build up some basic household assets and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusuf is a married man with 8 children 5 of whom attend school. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Yusuf has operated a charcoal selling business for the past seven years; his potential clients are his neighbors and friends. He faces a major challenge of transporting his stock from the point of purchase to his places of sale. He dreams of owning a pick-up truck.

With the KES 40,000 he wants to purchase more charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Grace has a shop that sells hardware products like weighing machines, hand globes and nails by the kilo. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of hardware products for her shop.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her hardware shop.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She resides in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Maricel owns and operates a fishing venture, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She has been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 2,800 PHP. 

Maricel is requesting a loan for 4,000 PHP, which she will use to repair her fishing boat for better usage. She has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Maricel wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more computers for his cyber café

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is 60 years old and dreams of improving his family's life. He is married and has five children. Four of his children are married and live with their spouses. The other child is single and lives with them. 

Dominador has been involved in farming since 1975. He is thankful because the family's main source of income comes from his farming business. He devotes all his time to improving his rice field because he would like to earn a bigger income. His wife also contributes to the family's finances through her hog-raising business. Dominador got his previous farm inputs from traders who charge high interest rates, so he had to use the income from the last crop to pay his debts. 

Due to lack of capital, Dominador is has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 which he can use this coming planting season. He will use the loan to purchase farm supplies to improve his rice fields. He hopes to have a good yield, for the business to become profitable, and for them to be able to save regularly for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies to improve his rice fields.

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.ru: Хайринисо жительница района Шахритус. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она занимается торговлей детской и мужской одежды. Ее муж тоже занимается торговлей. Хайринисо просит кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Khayriniso is a resident of the Shahrituz district.  She is 34 years old, married and has three children.  She is involved in selling children's and men's clothing.  Her husband is also involved in sales.  Khayriniso is requesting this loan to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Talaileva

texts.en:
Talaileva is a married mother of 41 with 8 children.


Talaileva owns & operates a business venture, taxi service. She has 4 years of experience in this business. Talaileva needs a loan of WST $2500 to maintain vehicle. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be $300WST or US$125 per week) to make improvements to her house.

Talaileva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Talaileva's 5th loan with SPBD.




*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score". For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feeds, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Carito

texts.en: Carito lives in Baringin Sur, Cauayan City with his wife and three children. For the last 30 years, he has earned a living as a farmer. He is a hard worker and is applying for a loan for PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds. He believes that his land will always provide a good harvest if he works hard enough to make it possible.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun, a widow, is 44 years old and has five children. She works at a rice field and at a rubber plantation as a worker. She started farming on her rice field 17 years ago in a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district to feed her family. 

This is Oun's first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy rice seeds for her rice field. With this loan, she hopes to make more rice and earn more income to better feed her family and also build on some savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sinatai

texts.en:
Sinatai is a 35-year-old married mother of 5 children.

Sinatai owns and operates a business venture, providing general clothing services to local community members. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Sinatai needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional inventory and working capital. She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Sinatai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sinatai's fourth loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score". For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 52 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. She has had a sari-sari store business for the last 10 years. Felicidad sells items like canned goods, school supplies and daily-use products such as soap and shampoo. She earns 10000 PHP each month with her business.

Felicidad has requested this loan to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and soft drinks. Felicidad hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en: Emilio is 48 years old, married and blessed with two school-aged children. For the last 20 years, he has earned a living by growing rice. He is applying for a loan for PHP 30,000 to buy seedlings and fertilizer. He is determined to work hard to provide for his family, and hopes that Kiva will continue to give him financial assistance so that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary Chriz

texts.en: Mary Chriz is 28 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last five years by selling seafood. She makes PHP 2,800 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy new fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She joined GDMPC a year ago as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Budihidihi Sk No 2 Group

texts.fr:
Delphine fait partie du groupe Budihidihi. Elle a 30 ans et elle est mariée avec 2 enfants de 4 à 7 ans, dont 2 scolarisés, elle a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. 

Delphine est cultivatrice de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de suivre tous les conseils donnés par les agronomes. Dans les prochaines années, Delphine voudrait être la grande cultivatrice de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Delphine is part of the Budihidihi group. She is 20 and married with two children, who are 4 and 7 years old. Both go to school. She also takes care of one other person in addition to her children.

Delphine is a rice farmer. This is her second loan cycle with ACB. She will use her loan to buy chemical fertilizers for her rice farm. 

Her strategy for growing her business is to follow all the advice given to her by the agronomists. In the coming years, Delphine would like to be the biggest rice-grower in her region. With the profits from her buisness, she would like to educate her children.

loans.use: Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz.

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en: Zoljargal is 26 years old and lives with her husband and daughter, who is three years old, in a ger that lacks access to the basic infrastructure available in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital. In 2007, she graduated from the Mongolian State University of Education with a major in teaching Japanese. She supports her family by operating a grocery store located her family's yard, and regularly gets help from her husband. They began their business in 2006, and today have 2,300,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) in working capital. She is applying for a loan for 2,000,000 MNT to increase their capital and buy more products to sell during the New Year's holiday. In the future, Zoljargal wants to expand the store and enlarge their house.

loans.use: to buy items to sell during the New Year's holiday.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 57 years old, married and lives with her three children in Capucao, Ozamis City. For the last 20 years, she has earned about PHP 10,000 a month by farming. Last year, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is requesting loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her farm. This will be her third loan from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Wefwile B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wefwile B Group in Western Kenya! Beatrice is the facilitator of the Wefwile B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Beatrice takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 13 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Beatrice was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Beatrice will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Wefwile B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is a married man with 7 children, 5 of whom attend school while the other 2 are still too young for school. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.  

Jumaa has operated a goat-selling business for the past 8 years; in addition he is also a blacksmith. His potential clients are his neighbors and fellow farmers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, where during the rainy season the demand is low. He dreams of expanding his business and opening a retail shop.

With the KES 30,000, he wants to purchase more goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en: Jeralyn is 31 years old, married and lives with her husband and children in Pantaon, Ozamis City. For the last 10 years, she has earned about PHP 5,000 a month by growing fruits and vegetables. She joined GDMPC earlier this year as a way to gain access to financial services that would help her improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to grow a larger banana crop. This is her first loan from GDMPC and she plans to use the additional income she earns to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand the size of her banana crop.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en: Minda is 54 years old, married and lives with her husband and five children in Guingona City. For the last 10 years, she has earned about PHP 5,000 a month by growing vegetables that she also sells in a local market. She joined GDMPC earlier this year as a way to improve her life, and is applying for her first loan, for PHP 5,000, to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand a vegetable-selling business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 47 years old and is married with three children. Her husband is a government employee, but he still helps Remedios to manage their family rice field. Remedios is also engaged in a hog-raising business for additional income. They work hard to lift their children out of poverty. As responsible parents, they want to educate their children so that they are able to find good jobs someday. 

Remedios and her husband would like to expand their rice plantation, but they do not have adequate capital. Therefore, Remedios is asking for additional capital in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy rice seed, fertilizers, and insecticides, and pay labor costs required to plant rice. They believe that this loan will be a enormous help for them to increase their yield.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizers, and insecticides, and pay labor costs required to plant rice

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
