Yawa is a married man with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school while 1 is married. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.  

Yawa has operated as a blacksmith for the past 26 years. In addition he also runs a goat-selling business. His potential clients are the local area farmers. He dreams of expanding his businesses.

With the KES 20,000, he wants to purchase scrap metals and goats for his businesses. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metals and goats for his business

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 51 years old and single. She is from Sinusa, Ozamis City. Dinah has been in this particular business for 10 years, and she earns 3000 PHP a month.

Dinah joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Dinah is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase Guso (seaweed). This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase Guso (seaweed).

loans.name: Kutmanaly

texts.ru:
Кутманали 50 лет, женат, воспитал пятерых детей. 
В поисках источника финансирования своей семьи, 22 года назад Кутманали начал свой бизнес в разведении скота и перепродаже сельхоз продукции. Кутманали использовал стартовую сумму в 3,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы, и сумел развить свое хозяйство, имеющее на сегодняшний день четыре коровы и баранов.  Благодаря ежемесячной прибыли в сумме около 20,000 сом (KGS), Кутманали покрывает ежедневные расходы своей семьи и откладывает деньги на обучение для младшего сына. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кутманали обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи. В ближайшее время, при помощи доходов от кредита, семья Кутманали планирует увеличивать поголовье домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kutmanaly is 50 years old, married and has five children.  In search of a financial source for his family, he started his own business of breeding livestock and reselling agricultural crops 22 years ago.  Kutmanaly used an initial sum of 3,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow and was able to grow his business since then to include four cows and sheep today.  Thanks to the monthly profit of about 20,000 som (KGS), he covers his family's daily expenses and saves money for his youngest son's education.  In order to further develop his business, Kutmanaly requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  In the near future, Kutmanaly's family plans to increase livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Fevie

texts.en: Fevie is 23 years old and married with two children. She is from Pan-taon, Ozamis City. Fevie has been raising pigs for sale for three years, and she earns 5000 PHP a month. In 2011, Fevie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fevie is requesting loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed for the pigs. This will be the first loan taken out by Fevie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pig feed.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is applying for another loan to expand his existing business. He will use this 80,000 KES loan to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, beans and cooking oil for resale. In the future, Hassan aspires to continue improving his business. 

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Hassan has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, beans and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is married with two children. He is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Nelson owns and operates a business venture selling fresh eggs in the local community to earn a living. He has been doing this for seven years, and every month he earns 3000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 25000 PHP to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.

Nelson has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Nelson hopes to help his children finish their studies and to double the income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve his business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 38-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married, living with his wife and two school-aged children. Regardless of the heavy life expenses, his family are really thankful for what he did so far. He decided to start his own work as a photographer seven years ago and has opened his own shop. He’s talented and works with high professionalism. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new supplies such as cameras, lances, films and many other items for his work in order to increase his sales and his revenues. In the future, he plans to open his own photography center.

loans.use: to purchase new supplies such as cameras, lances, films and many other items

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Mrs. Chi is 32 years old and is a loving mother of 4 single children, living in Kompong Speu province. She has worked for a garment factory as a part of the sewing staff since 2000. From this business, she typically gets a monthly salary of $65. Her husband is a local policeman in the province. 

Mrs. Chi wants to take out this loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband. This loan will enable her husband’s business to run smoothly. Mrs. Chi wishes to provide her children with great opportunities to join university after they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband

loans.name: Wefwile A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wefwila A Group in Western Kenya! Paustine is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Paustine takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund's best prices and to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, she had a good maize yield harvesting eight bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest one bag of maize on 1/2 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Paustine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Paustine will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Wefwila A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. She is pictured with her group members in the photograph as shown.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 80,000 KES loan to purchase more fish and a freezer for her business. In the future, Mwanatumu aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanatumu has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fish and a freezer for her business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
This is Thelma, 55, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Rodrigo, who is also her business partner. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, Thelma is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Thelma maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Thelma's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Thelma hopes to grow her business in the coming years and acquire her own house someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Rosadilla

texts.en: Rosadilla is 40 years old and married with seven children. She is from Capucao. Rosadilla owns and operates a farm.  She earns 7000 PHP a month from planting and selling fruit and vegetables. In 2008, Rosadilla joined GDMPC to gain access to to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosadilla is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This will be the third loan taken out by Rosadilla from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita from the village of Panta-on, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Marita is married and has five adult-aged children.

To make a living, Marita own and operates a farm, planting & harvesting corn for sale. Marita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Marita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Recently Marita joined GDMPC to seek for financial Assistance as additional investment to her business. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and portion of it will be save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 40,000 KES loan to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and soap for resale. In the future, Pili aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Pili has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and soap for resale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is from Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. She is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Alicia runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community, such as rice, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps, etc. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

Alicia is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2010, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Genese

texts.en: Genese is 41 years old and married with two children. She is from San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur. Genese has been farming for over 15 years; she earns 15800 PHP a month. In 2008, Genese joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genese is requesting a loan of 20000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Houy

texts.en:
Houy, age 44, is married and has two children who are still in school. She earns a living as a seller, selling food, mangoes, drinks and other fruits. She supplements her income by farming. She has been with her business for 17 years in a village located in the Tbaung Khmum district. 

This is Houy’s first loan with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She will also use some of this loan to increase her business by buying some fruits, drinks, etc. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield as well as her business, and also earn more income so as to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field and food and drinks for her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget, 54, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Nget is a tailor and her husband raises pigs to sell. Nget is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for family use. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
This is Sonia, 54, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. Her husband is Alfredo, a mason. Sonia is also a mother to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Sonia operates a tailoring business. She offers mainly curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like gowns, uniforms, and such are also available all year-round. She also does repairs and alterations. Aside from this, she sells mineral water for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sonia hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her children a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tailoring materials needed in her business

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is 52 years old and married with seven children. She is from Gango, Ozamis City. Merly has been in her current business for three years, and she earns 5000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merly is requesting loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Merly from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 48-year-old married man with 3 children who are all going to school. He owns a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Nicholas has operated a café for the past 2 years with customers who are the local residents. He faces the major challenge of the rising market prices of commodities. His dream for the future is to expand his business into a hotel. 

With a loan of KES 20,000, he wants to purchase more rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil for his café. He decided to join Yehu to get funds to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil for his café.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani, 45, is a talented lady. She is involved in two businesses: sewing and selling fertilizer and seeds. She manages her two businesses with a great sense of responsibility.  

Rani sews clothes for her neighboring clients and earns income by fulfilling her orders on time. She also sells fertilizer and seeds to the farmers and to different shops in the markets to increase her income. She does this work to support her husband financially.  

Rani's husband is a mason by profession. His income is not permanent because he sometimes gets work and sometimes not. Rani is the mother of five sons who are 13, 11, 9, 7, and 5 years old.   

With this loan, Rani will purchase fertilizer and seeds in larger quantity in order to increase her sales and earn better profits. She is hopeful that the loan investment will expand her business and improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for selling.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim is a 44-year-old Lebanese single man who lives alone. He is working to satisfy his own needs and to be capable of covering his life expenses. He has been involved in the tailoring field for the past 15 years. Eight years ago he decided to open his own factory. He loves his work and is always looking for new, different and originA. designs. 

He will use a loan of $3,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase tailoring supplies such as textiles and other items, which he notes will increase his sales by 20%. In the future, he plans to enlarge his factory and hire new designers.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring supplies such as textiles and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 46 years old and married to Naomi. They have two children who go to school. Duncan has operated an electronics sales and repair shop in Olkalau town for the last 15 years. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more electronics spare parts for use in his electronics business. 

In the future, Duncan hopes to expand his business to become one of the leading electronics dealers in Olkalau.

loans.use: To buy electronics spare parts.

loans.name: Sithourk

texts.en:
Sithourk, 40, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Sithourk sells food and her husband raises pigs to sell. 

Sithourk is requesting a loan of USD $500 in order to expand her food-selling business. With the loan, her family will be able to generate more income. She would like to use any additional future income to repair her house. This will be her fifth loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to expand her food-selling business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Lilia is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Lilia is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home used products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo,soaps and many. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Lilia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2007, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to to save as a reserve for future emergencies				.

loans.use: to purchase additional product to sell

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en: Loreto is a jolly and hard-working man. He has a wonderful wife and two children. He has been involved in buying and selling hogs for over two years and has extensive experience in this business. He sells his pigs at the district markets. This business brings in a good profit both to the business and the family budget. Loreto dreams of lifting his family from poverty; this is why he works hard at his hog raising business. He also wants to provide the necessities for his pigs; therefore, he has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for his pigs. He hopes this will make them fit and nourished, and provide higher prices when it is time for them to be sold. He also hopes to grow his business to secure a good living for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has operated his electronics repair business in Olkalau town for the last four years.  He is 30 years old, married to Wangeci and they have one child who goes to school.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. Stephen plans to use the loan amount to buy more chargers, along with radio and electronics spare parts, in order to sustain his business.

In the future, Stephen hopes to expand his business by selling electronics and phones, thereby increasing his income and improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy chargers, radio spare parts and electronics spare parts.

loans.name: N. Eméline

texts.fr: Eméline est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Eméline est mariée à un tourneur du nom de Germain. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Eméline exerce depuis douze ans le métier de tisserand. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Eméline contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Eméline sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement par Eméline a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Emeline is 35 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a lathe operator named Germain. The couple has three children. All attend school and are their dependents. The children live together with their parents and the couple shares responsibility for all household expenses.

For the past 12 years Emeline has worked as an weaver. The income generated by this activity enables her to contribute to various family expenses.

To meet the needs of an increasing number of customers, Emeline is requesting for the second time a credit loan from ALIDé, having fully repaid the previously granted loan.

loans.use: To buy thread for weaving

loans.name: Monina

texts.en: Monina is 51 years old and married with four children.  She is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Monina has been in business for 33 years, and she earns 18920 PHP a month. Monina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monina is requesting a loan of 30000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Monina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Soveat

texts.en:
Soveat, 30, resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Soveat is a traditional musician. 

Soveat is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase new musical instruments for her band to perform in wedding parties. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. 

This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy new musical instruments to perform in wedding parties.

loans.name: Bakereti

texts.en: Bakereti is a 37-year-old married lady with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has a family goal of educating her children.  She has been operating a cosmetics business for twenty years which she started with the capital of five hundred thousand UGX and now has capital of one million UGX.  Her business challenges are high fuel and transportation costs; her business goal is to buy land and grow crops. The purpose of the loan is to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Akodjenou Pierre

texts.fr: Akodjenou Pierre est âgé de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Akodjenou Pierre est marié à une marchande du nom de Jeanne. Le couple a quatre enfants  tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a trois autres enfants en charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Akodjenou Pierre exerce depuis une vingtaine d’années le métier de menuisier dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Akodjenou Pierre  est un éleveur de porc. Grâce au revenu que lui génèrent ces activités, Akodjenou Pierre contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Akodjenou Pierre sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement par Akodjenou Pierre ont été biens remboursés.
texts.en:
Akodjenou Peter is 41 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a retail merchant named Jeanne. The couple has four children all in school and under their care. In addition to their children, they have three other children to care for. The children live together with their parents and the couple shares responsibility for dealing with various household expenses.

To support himself and his children, Peter Akodjenou has worked as a carpenter in his area for the past 20 years. Secondarily, he is also a hog farmer.

With the income generated by these activities Akodjenou Pierre contributes towards his family's various expenditures.

To meet the needs of a steadily growing number of clients, Akodjenou Pierre is requesting for the third time a credit loan from ALIDé. The two previously granted loans were promptly repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy woodworking materials (beams, etc.)

loans.name: Srurn

texts.en:
Srurn, age 31, is married and has three children who are still in school. To earn a living, she has been farming and feeding cows as labor for 10 years in a village located in the Prey Chhor district. Her husband is a palm wine producer. 

This is the first loan for Srurn with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan from VisionFund to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice field.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and also earn more income from her farming which she will use to build on her savings and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 28-year-old hardworking lady with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children.  She has been running a cosmetics business for eight years.  The main challenges are customers not paying on time, high taxes and high fuel and transportation costs; her business goal is to hire employees to expand her business and to move her business to a more permanent location. The purpose of the loan is to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has work in the transport industry in the town of Naivasha for the last four years. He is 27 years old and single.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to repair his motorbike so as to keep his business on course and generate cash to buy a new motorcycle. 

In the future, Simon hopes to buy a car and start a taxi business.

loans.use: to repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Estelita has a shop that sells coconuts for copra. She has had this business for 13 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15000 to buy coconuts.

Estelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Estelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for copra.

loans.name: Misiraly

texts.ru: Мисирали 44 года, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Мисирали работает мастером – отделочником. В связи с нестабильностью заработка, в поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Мисирали  начал активно заниматься животноводством. Начав с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS), благодаря настойчивости и  упорному труду, Мисирали смог увеличить поголовье  на сегодняшний день получает прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов.  В прошлом году ему пришлось продать несколько коров, в связи с этим, Мисирали обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. В дальнейшем, он планирует продолжать свой бизнес в животноводстве.
texts.en: Misiraly is 44 years old, married and has three children.  He works as a master - decorator.  Due to instability in salary and in search of an additional source of income for his family, Misiraly started to get actively involved in animal husbandry.  He began with an initial sum of 20,000 som (KGS), and thanks to his persistence and hard work, was able to increase his livestock headcount and earn a profit of 8,000 som per month today from the sale of dairy products.  Misiraly had to sell several cows last year and, because of that, he requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to increase livestock headcount.  In the future, he plans to continue his animal husbandry business.

loans.use: to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is 46 years old and married with three children. He is from Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. 

Edgardo owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of food products in his local community. Edgardo
has been in business one year and earns 6000 PHP a month. In 2011, Edgardo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Edgardo is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Kijanju Bakyara Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Vannie is a a 29-year-old single, hardworking young woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a fresh foods food stall that she started four years ago with capital worth fifty thousand shillings but now it is worth two hundred shillings. Her business challenges are price fluctuations and inflation. Her dream is to educate her children and expand her business into a pronounced food grocery in Fort Portal. Vannie needs the loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a thirty-six year old married lady with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. The family goal is to educate her children. She has been running a boutique of traditional wear for fifteen years which she started with capital of two hundred thousand shillings and now has capital of three million shillings. 

The challenges she is facing are high fuel and transportation costs, and taxes, however, she has a goal of hiring employees to help expand business and buying land to grow crops. The purpose of the loan is to buy clothes for resale

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Lolina has a shop that sells items such as canned goods, detergents, noodles, and soaps. She has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan for PHP 14000 to buy canned goods, detergents, and soaps for her store.

Lolina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents, and soaps for her store.

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en:
AbdE. Rahman is a 48-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife, three school aged children and one working child. He’s their main source of income and they all depend on him. He’s also paying his children’s educational fees. 

AbdE. Rahman started his metal shop business eleven years ago after twenty five years experience. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new metal equipment for his business, in order to collect higher income and improve his life. In the future, he plans to expand his business and open new branches.

loans.use: to purchase new metal equipment for his business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 44, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. Her husband is Ernesto, an electrician. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Evelyn maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are depending on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 24,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Evelyn hopes to grow her business in the coming years and acquire her own house someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
 
Jean has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 10000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

Jean has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Randee

texts.en:
Randee is 33 years old and married with two children. He is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Randee operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been in this business for one year, and he earns 5000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Randee joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Randee is requesting a loan of 25000 PHP, which he will use to purchase additional vehicle spare parts. Randee hopes to improve/expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Willie

texts.en:
Willie is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Willie has a shop that sells snacks, beverages, and cupcakes. He has had this business for 10 years. Willie requested a loan for PHP 10000 to buy snacks, beverages, and cupcakes for his store.

Willie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, and cupcakes.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann used her first loan amount to buy a motorbike and it has been earning her a good income.

She repaid the loan amount well and in good time. This will be her second loan and she plans to use the loan amount to buy another motorcycle.

In the future, Ann plans to invest more in the transport industry by buying passenger service vehicles and become one of the leading businesswomen in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for her transportation business

loans.name: Marta

texts.en: Marta is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and five children. For the last 20 years, she has earned a living by running a shop where she sells dried fish and squid. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Marta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009 and hopes to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and squid to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Seang is 61 years old and married with four children. Now only one child is dependent. She earns a living as a farmer and her husband works as a district councillor in a village located in the Prey Chhor district. She has been farming on her rice field for 10 years. 

Seang has been with VisionFund since 2009. Since the previous loans with VisionFund, her family has better living conditions and increased crop yield. She successfully paid back the last loan with VisionFund. Now requesting another loan, she will use this one to buy fertilizer for her rice field and also use some of the loan to buy an old motorbike for her husband to use. 

She hopes this loan will help her to make more income, build on some savings for the future, and also keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
This is Lucita, 68, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her two children. She, together with her children, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Lucita operates an aluminum and glass shop. She handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion. They offer made to order aluminum doors & window glass; they also repair any type of aluminum doors or windows.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 5000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies like glass, aluminum materials, silicon and other materials used in the business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lucita dreams of opening new branches and hopes to get to more customers in the market. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; at these meetings she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials for her doors and windows business.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and one sibling. His father is the main income provider in the family and their only support. For this reason, he decided to have his own business hoping to take some responsibilities off of him. After being involved in barber services for nine years, Elias opened his own salon in 2011 and is looking to gain new loyal customers. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to change his salon’s interior design. He notes that this may attract more clients and therefore increase his revenues. In the future, he plans to enlarge his salon and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to change his salon’s interior design.

loans.name: Mbeneka

texts.en:
Mbeneka is a 52-year-old married woman; she has five children and they live in Kaskeu, in the outskirts of Emali.  She sells groceries in the same area and has been doing so for fifteen years now; she earns a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Mbeneka's seventh loan with KADET LTD; she plans to buy vegetables, tomatoes and onions to sell and to also use part of the money to plough her land. In the future, she wants to be financially stable and to be able to feed and clothe her family.

loans.use: to add stocks of vegetables and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Sapiyakhan

texts.ru: Сапияхан 58 лет, замужем, воспитала трех детей.   Муж работает таксистом. С 2008 года Сапияхан занимается откормом и перепродажей скота и полеводством. Упорный труд и настойчивость в делах позволили развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день семь дойных коров и двадцать баранов.  В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Сапияхан обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительной скотины. Доходы от кредита Сапияхан планирует вложить в закуп стройматериалов для постройки дома.
texts.en: Sapiyakhan is 58 years old, married and raised three children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  Since 2008, Sapiyakhan has been involved in fattening up and reselling livestock and agriculture.  Hard work and persistence in business helped her grow her farm that now contains seven dairy cows and twenty sheep.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Sapiyakhan requested a loan in the sum of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional livestock.  Sapiyakhan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a purchase of construction materials to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 60,000 Kes loan to purchase more goats for resale. In the future, Mlongo aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mlongo has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie, 45, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Henry, a welder, and mother to their two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosemarie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 250 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for Php 18,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosemarie hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; at these meetings she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ariole

texts.en: Ariole is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is a single gay man who earns a living by running a beauty shop that provides haircutting, hairstyling, pedicure, manicure and other services. He has been in this line of work for 20 years and is applying for a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy supplies for his shop. Ariole joined HSPFI earlier this year and hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Leonora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Leonora has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mafinga Group

texts.en:
Veronica, who is in her early 50s, is married with seven children; two of them go to school but the rest are grownup. She has been running a charcoal business since 2005. She works from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenje Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the charcoal stock and for household expenses and school fees. She has paid all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Her dream is to one day be able to own her own land.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mafinga," which has 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Hakim Mai's Group

texts.en:
Hakim Mai is 55 years old. She is married and lives with her family, including her two children who are 20 and 22. Her son is a driver by profession while her daughter is studying in 12th standard. 

Hakim Mai's husband is a farmer by profession and is involved in the agriculture business. Besides growing seasonal crops in the field, he also operates an animal-sales business. He keeps goats and buffalo, and sells their milk to generate additional revenue. 
 
With this loan, her husband will purchase a buffalo so he can sell its milk to more clients and generate a good income. She is hopeful that the loan investment will help expand her husband’s business and improve her family’s well-being.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called "Asasah Passbook") is Hakim Mai.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo to sell its milk.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo is 40 years old and he is from Lapasan, Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is married with two children. 

Arnulfo operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been in this business for 13 years and he earns 10000 PHP a month. 

In 2004, Arnulfo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnulfo is requesting a loan of 13,500 PHP, which will be used to pay for the maintenance of and improvements to his motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of and improvements to his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for vegetable production.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Grace has a shop that sells fish like sardines, mackerel and trout. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, single and lives with his five family members.  He and one other family member work.

Since 2009, Hussein has owned a shop where he sells household items. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in the area.

He decided to apply for a $1200 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to buy more household goods to sell. He aims to increase his profits in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to buy more household goods to sell.

loans.name: Jamileh

texts.en:
Jamileh is a 24-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and three children who are still attending school. She has owned a clothing shop since 2010 and works with her husband who has sold cars for the past 26 years. Together they work to raise their income levE. and cover their children’s educational fees.

Today, Jamileh wishes to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase extra products for her shop such as new designs in clothes, accessories, etc. She notes that this Kiva loan will increase her sales and allow her to raise her income.

In the future, she plans to have her own wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy extra products for her shop such as new designs in clothes, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanajuma has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She is now applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 50,000 KES loan to purchase more wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

In the future, Mwanajuma hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders. She aspires to continue improving her business and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 54 years old.  She is married with three children and is from Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Melita owns farmland and operates a farm, harvesting and planting rice to sell in order to earn a living.  She has been in business for 29 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month from this work. 

In 1998, Melita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Melita is requesting a loan of 38,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 43 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines. Luz prepares and sells cassava flakes with sugar melt. She has had this business for five years. 

Luz is requesting a loan for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Luz has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Ayed

texts.en:
Ayed is 48 years old, married, and has three children. He is from Iraq. Ayed is a carpenter.  Since 2007, he has owned a workshop and makes bedrooms and kitchens and repairs old furniture. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local consumers. He is well known in the surrounding areas.

Ayed is requesting a loan for $2,000, which he will use to purchase an electric cutting machine and new tools for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase an electric cutting machine and new tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Matide

texts.en:
Matide is a forty-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She began work as a coffee farmer when she received start-up capital. She has now been running a preserved fish business for ten years. The major hardship in her business is insufficient capital.

Matide needs a loan of 250,000 UGX to buy more salt to preserve fish. Her goal is to have a number of her own fish ponds as well as buying a house.

loans.use: to buy more salt to preserve fish.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 66 years old, married and has three children. She is a farmer who has grown vegetables to earn a living for the past thirteen years.

Filomena has been a member of PMPC for seven years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

In the future, Filomena hopes to be the number one supplier of vegetables in town.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 49 years old and separated with three children. She is from Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Lucia owns and operates a banana farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. Lucia has been in this business for two years and she earns 6000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. 

In 2007, Lucia joined GDMPC gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. Lucia hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a single man who owns a house with piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for himself.

Edwin has operated a nursery school for the past two years. His potential clients are his neighbors’ children. His major challenge is the lack of enough capital to hire professional teachers.

Edwin decided to join Yehu because it has fair loan terms and conditions. With a 20,000 KES loan he wants to purchase text books, desks and chairs for his school. He dreams of expanding his nursery school to include a primary school level.

loans.use: to purchase text books, desks and chairs for his school.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon is 39 years old. She and her husband Heng, who is 44 years old, live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1989 and have two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are garment workers, two attend school, and the other one assists his parents in their farming business.

Yon and her husband are farmers. They grow papaya, corn, and tomatoes on their farmland in the village where they live. Yon is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain their farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children.

Alfredo provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

Alfredo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alfredo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy tools, and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

loans.name: Sleiman

texts.en:
Sleiman is a 45-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-age children. He’s working really hard to be able to cover his family needs as he is their main source of income.

Sleiman decided to start his own business in 1993, so he opened a bakery shop in his town where he’s well known for his delicious food and good atmosphere.

Today he’s asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to expand and renovate his bakery in order to attract more customers and earn more money. In the future, he plans to open a small playground for kids.

loans.use: to expand and renovate his bakery.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is married with 3 children, she is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines.  Hilda is a farmer and purchases coconuts to make copra to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. 

She has requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase coconuts to make copra for her copra business.  Hilda has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Hilda hopes to become a supplier of coconuts in a locality.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts to make copra for her copra business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 19 years old, married, and has one child. He lives with six family members, two of whom work.

Hussein has been an owner of a food market since 2007, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese, and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, and he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2400 to buy a tricycle truck to transport his goods. He aims to gain more profits for the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To buy a tricycle truck to transport his goods.

loans.name: Mukhungula W.g Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Mukhungula W.G Group in Western Kenya! It is headed by Alice as the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Alice is a mother of two children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had a very good maize yield harvesting 11 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest five bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land. With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Mukhungula W.G group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Sony (in the photo) has full-time employment, while his wife is a weaver. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have two young sons. 

Sony is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to repair the house where he lives, making a new stairway and walls.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives, making a new stairway and walls.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, single, and lives with two family members, one of whom works.

Hussein has been an owner of a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $1,800 loan in order to install display cases and refrigerators. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to install display cases and refrigerators.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old.  She is a widow with two children and is from Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental:Philippines. 

Jane owns and operates a business venture, selling mobile phone products in the local community. She has been in this business for five years and earns 3,840 PHP a month. 

In 2006, Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jane is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional mobile phones to sell. She plans to use the revenue generated with this loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Gwede

texts.en:
Gwede is a 24 years old single man who lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for himself and house rent. 

Gwede has operated a tailoring business for the past 3 years, his potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of rising commodity prices in the market. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 30,000, he wants to purchase fabrics and embroideries for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and embroideries for his business.

loans.name: Siman

texts.en:
Siman, pictured with her loom, is a weaver and her husband, Soeurn, is a house constructor. They live on an island in the Mekong River, which is about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh and have four sons who are in school.

Siman is asking for a loan of $200 to buy weaving materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Gaioz

texts.en:
Gaioz is 29 years old and lives in the village of Pkhvenisi in eastern Georgia. He lives with his wife Nina, a 10-year-old son and a 9-year-old daughter. Both children go to school. All family members are internally displaced persons from a nearby region, as a result of a military conflict. They receive a relevant pension from the state. 

The main source of income for the family is agriculture. They own 1.2 hectares of land, where maize, cabbage, tomatoes and wheat are grown, harvested and sold locally. In addition, the family owns three calves, which will produce milk in the spring. The family's total average monthly income is 900 GEL.

Gaioz requested a loan of 2,000 GEL to purchase an additional cow. By spring, the family will have four cows that produce milk and will begin making cheese.  The sale of cheese will significantly increase the family's income. Gaioz and Nina will use the increased income to renovate their house, which is newly constructed.  At present, only two rooms are used as the rest are not unsuitable for living.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to produce milk.

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en: Khoder is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man living with his one parent and sibling. His father is working as a construction worker and he’s the one taking care of the family. He has a previous experience of three years working in a local clothing shop. Since Khoder wishes to help his father with the family expenses, he decided to start his own business last year. He sells children clothes, in addition of selling traditional dresses. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to restore his shop. This may help him attract additional clients, thereby increasing his sales and returns. In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to restore his shop.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married and has nine children.

Since 1993, Haydar has owned a market that sells a variety of cereals and dates. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so a good number of customers regularly pass by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $3,000 in order to pay the annual rent for his market. He aims to increase profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent for his market.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak (in the photo) is single. He lives with his brother and sisters in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sopheak is a garment worker. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 in order to build a restroom for family use and build a kitchen.

loans.use: to build a restroom for family use and build a kitchen

loans.name: Tongnooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOMPASSEKDE  est la représentante du groupe TONGNOOMA. Elle est mariée  et n’a pas d’enfant. Personne ne va à l’école. Elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle vend des  vêtements prêt à porter pour  femmes, filles et garçons depuis  03ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché du secteur 10 en ville .Ses clients sont  les femmes, les filles et les enfants.

Elle veut  s’acheter  02douzaines de hauts pour femmes et filles et 10 complets de tenus pour enfants.

 Elle épargne  ses bénéfices pour  agrandir son commerce. Elle ambitionne  acquérir un motocycle et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: SOMPASSEDKE is the facilitator of the TONGNOOMA group.  She is married and has no children.  Although she does not have school-age children she financially supports one person.  She has been selling clothes for women, girls and boys for 3 years.  She buys her merchandise at the 10th district market, in town.  Her customers are women, girls and children.  She would like to buy 2 dozen tops for women and girls and 10 complete outfits for children.  She is saving her profits in order to increase the size of her business.  Her goal is to buy a motorized bicycle and to help pay for her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy 2 dozen tops for women and girls and 10 complete outfits for children.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 34 years old, married with two children and she's from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Marivic is operating a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community to earn a living. She has been 7 years in this business and she earns 3,200 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Marivic joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Marivic hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Being a father means being responsible to support his family and educate his children. Christopher wants to educate his four children and give them a better future. Aside from farming, he also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. Despite the hardships of life, he has the strong determination to improve their status of living and become successful in the future. 

He planned to improve his hog-raising business but he does not have enough capital, therefore, he is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hog-raising business. He believes that, through this loan, he will be able to improve the business as he continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for hog-raising business

location.town: Bitnong Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Phallin

texts.en:
Phallin (in the photo) runs a grocery store at home in the village and also rents a space in her house to garment-factory workers. Her husband, Sokhom, is now a security guard. They live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and one daughter: two are in school and the other two are still young. 

Phallin hopes to continue her business selling groceries, so she is applying for another loan in the amount of $300 to purchase additional grocery items for sale.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for sale

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is a 27-year-old single man who owns a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for himself and transport. 

Rama has operated a butchery for the past four years; his potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge in the rising prices of livestock in the market. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase more stock of meat for resale. He decided to join Yehu to get capital to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of meat for resale.

loans.name: Hauda

texts.en:
Hauda is a 55-year-old Lebanese woman. She lives on her own after getting divorced. She works to satisfy her own needs and to be capable of living life as it should be. She has owned a women's clothing shop for the past 15 years where she sells stylish, fashionable and trendy clothes, and till now she has been satisfied and looking forward to growing her business. 

Hauda is requesting a $1500 loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase the new winter collection such as dresses, scarves, pants, etc. She notes that this loan will certainly push her to earn higher returns. In the future, she plans to open other branches as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase the new winter collection such as dresses, scarves, pants, etc.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: Toem is a 57-year-old married woman who lives in Kompong Speu province, Cambodia. She is a good mother who always cares for the family and provides a good education to her children at home. Presently, three of her children have their own individual work and businesses. Toem has been a farmer, cultivating rice crops alongside her husband, for a long time. With this loan amount, Toem would like to purchase an additional cow that can be used for farming work. She tells us that it will be much easier to work with two cows rather than one cow on her project. She hopes that she will be able to improve her business through using this loan.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow for farming work.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур женат и имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Баходур занимается купле- продажей скота. Восемь лет назад он начал свой бизнес с купле продажи мелко рогатого скота, а теперь продолжает этот бизнес успешно. Баходур хочет расширить свой бизнес и увеличить свою прибыль, с этой целью он хочет купить скот для пополнения оборотного капитала. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит вас за вашу доброту и милосердие, которая позволит ему улучшить свое финансового состояния.
texts.en: Bahodur is married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Bahodur is involved in buying and selling livestock.  He started his business of buying and selling small livestock eight years ago and continues running this business successfully.  Bahodur wants to expand his business and increase his profit, and wants to purchase livestock to achieve this goal and refill his revolving capital.  He hopes to get your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and mercy, which will allow him to improve his financial condition.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is a 33-year-old farmer from the village of Rekha, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his big family: wife Nanuli, 3 children (13, 7 and 1 years old) and parents. The elder children go to school. All adult members of the family are involved in agriculture, which is the main source of income for the family. 

The family owns 2.5 hectares of land where 100 apple and 100 peach trees are grown. Also, part of the land is used for tomato and cabbage growing. Along with the above-mentioned, the family has a milk cow. They produce cheese and sell it on the local market. 

Giorgi requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. The family will increase cheese production and sales by 100%. It will increase the income of the family. Giorgi plans to reinvest the increased income in further development of the family farm, in order to expand it and make more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Savath

texts.en:
Savath and her husband are farmers and she is also a weaver. She is asking for a loan in the mount of $400 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm. 

Savath and her husband have been married since 1990 and have 3 sons and 1 daughter. One is married, two are in school and another one is a weaver. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

In the photo, Savath is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Sopharn

texts.en:
Sopharn is 35 years old and her husband, Nan, is 38 years old. They have been married since 2000 and have one young son. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sopharn is a weaver, while her husband is a security guard. He also does farming when he is free. Sopharn is asking for a loan of $500 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.  

In the photo, Sopharn is sitting at her loom.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is a responsible and hardworking person. He lives at the village of Villa Marzo, Cordon. He start managing his rice farm in 1986 and continues to manage it now. 

Florencio and his wife work together to earn their living. Their main goal is to lift their lifestyle up, out of poverty. The couple were blessed with four children, three of whom are studying and one is still an infant. Farming is the primary source of income for Florencio's family. Florencio is busy cultivating his farm while his wife is involved in the hog raising business. However, the income is not enough to meet all of the daily needs for this family. So, Florencio has requested a loan of PHP20,000 which will enable him to acquire the necessary farm inputs to continue his business.

Florencio is hopeful that his requested loan will be granted so that he and his wife can attain their goal and be able to support the education of their children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for agricultural business.

loans.name: Musundi B Group

texts.en:
Florence is the facilitator of the Musundi B group. Florence and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Florence takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Florence had a good maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Florence was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Florence and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Florence will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Musundi B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land. 

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vannara

texts.en:
Vannara is 30 years old and her husband, Socheat, is 34 years old. They live in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two daughters who are in school.

Vannara sells grocery items at home. Her husband is assisting his wife in the business. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her daughters to drive to school. 

Photo: The motorbike behind Vannara does not belong to her. It belongs to her customer. They come to buy grocery items.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her daughters to drive to school.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. One of them is working in addition to his father who is the main income provider for the family and the one covering the heavier life expenses. Despite his young age, Ali started his own business in 2010. He has been working as a car mechanic for the past eight years and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. 

Today, he’s looking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to buy new mechanical tools for his business in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. He believes that acting properly and honestly is really essential to build such a good and solid career. In the future, he plans to open his own car showroom.

loans.use: to buy new mechanical tools for his business

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en:
Sokna (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Savoeurn, are silk weavers. In addition, the couple also does a farming business. They have been married since 2006 and have one young son. They live in a village along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
