Sokna is asking for another loan in the amount of $800 in order to continue her silk weaving business by buying silk materials. She will also use another part of the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business and to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with three children. She is 40 years old and presently lives in Sto. Nino, Pagadian City.

She sells dry goods products to earn a living and has had the business for two years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase clothing supplies to expand her business.

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to be successful due to her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing supplies to expand her business.

location.town: Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Maramu Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Maramu Group in Western Kenya! Yumelda is the facilitator of the Maramu group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Yumelda takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Yumelda had a good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Yumelda was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Yumelda and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Yumelda will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Maramu group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Narom

texts.en:
Narom (in the photo), age 30, is single. She lives with her widowed mother in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Narom is a garment worker. She is asking for a loan in the mount of $1,000 to build a kitchen where she can cook because the old one was broken.

loans.use: to build a kitchen where she can cook.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 40-year-old married man with three school-going children. He owns a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Alfred has operated a bar for more than four years; his potential clients are the local area's residents. He faces the major challenge of rising beverage prices in the market. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase more crates of beer for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer for resale.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 58-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and their only daughter who is still studying. He really cares for her future and is trying the best he can to be able to cover her university fees. For this reason, he has worked as a salesperson in a local company since 2008. He is also responsible for its human resource department. 

Today, Hussein is in need of a loan of $1500 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to pay his daughter’s educational fees plus other expenses. His daughter is intellectual and smart and he’s sure that she’ll achieve higher positions after graduation. In the future, he plans to save money in order to buy her a car.

loans.use: to pay his daughter’s educational fees plus other expenses

loans.name: Sokhun

texts.en:
Sokhun is now a garment worker. She also weaves, when she is not at work, because weaving is a traditional professional business. Her husband is a security guard. They have been married since 2001 and have two children who are in school. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokhun is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to get to work because her husband commutes to work by taking a bicycle. 

Photo: Sokhun is spinning.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, aged 51, is married with three children and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez. She sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase rice for her retail business.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.  In the future, she hopes to have her own convenience store in this locality.

loans.use: To purchase rice for her retail business

loans.name: Chamreoun

texts.en:
Chamreoun is a widow and she is also pregnant. She lives with her parents, brother and sister on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chamreoun is a weaver. She is asking for another loan in the amount of $600 to purchase construction materials for her brother’s construction business. He is a house constructor.  

Photo: Chamreoun is spinning.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her brother’s construction business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Saem

texts.en: Saem, 32, resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Saem and her husband produce cow ties to resell and raise pigs. Saem is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to transport cow ties to sell. By doing so, her family will be able to decrease their expenses on public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport cow ties to sell

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en: Maurine is a hardworking 20-year-old married lady with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has a family goal of educating her children. She has been running a cosmetics business for a period of five years. Maurine started this business with capital of only 150,000 UGX and now has capital of 600,000 UGX. She is facing challenges of price fluctuation and inflation; however, she has a dream of moving her business to a permanent location. Maurine needs a loan facility to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Mouhamadou Lamarana

texts.fr:
MOUHAMADOU LAMARANA HABITE DANS LA RÉGION SUD DU PAYS AGE DE 22 ANS CÉLIBATAIRE IL EST DANS LE COMMERCE DEPUIS 2 ANS IL ÉTAIT ÉTUDIANT A L'UNIVERSITÉ DE ZIGUINCHOR MAIS DÉCIDE DE QUITTER L'ÉCOLE POUR LE COMMERCE CAR C'EST UN MÉTIER DU PÈRE .
MOUHAMADOU LAMARANA DANS L'AVENIR SOUHAITERAIT OUVRIR D'AUTRES BOUTIQUES POUR PRÉPARER SON AVENIR ET CEUX DES SES ENFANTS .
texts.en:
Mouhamadou Lamarana lives in the Southern part of the country. He is 22 years old and single.

He has been a retail merchant for two years. He was a student at the University of Ziguinchor but decided to leave school and go into retail trading as this is his father's profession.

Eventually Mouhamadou Lamarana wants to open other shops to prepare for his future and that of his children.

loans.use: strengthen his stock supply

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 63-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children, two of them are working and one still attends school. In order to fulfill his family needs, Haidar works hard and is ready to help whenever they need it. He has worked as a taxi driver since 1975. His job consists of transporting people from inside to outside Lebanon upon request. 

Today, Haidar is facing problems with his car, so he is asking to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to replace his old car with a new one in order to be able to carry on his work properly. In the future, he plans to buy a van and serve a wider range of people.

loans.use: to replace his old car with a new one

loans.name: Tul

texts.en:
Tul (in the photo) is a fisherman. His wife, Saras stays at home because she has diabetes. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have six children (four sons and two daughters). One is a fisherman, three are in school, one is a weaver, and one child lives at home. 
Tul hopes to increase the volume of fish that he catches, so he has decided to request another loan of $800 to buy fishing nets and one additional boat motor for his son who is also a fisherman.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and a boat motor for his son’s fishing business.

loans.name: Silviya

texts.en:
Silviya is a 30-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of 3 and 16, two of them are in school. She has had a business selling from her food stall in Kator, South Sudan for four years.

Silviya requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Nai

texts.en: Nai, 57, lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a motor-taxi driver and raises chickens. His wife raises pigs at home. Nai is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new motorbike to provide transportation services more efficiently. By doing so, his family will be able to generate more income. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to provide transportation services more efficiently

loans.name: Shin

texts.en: Mrs. Shin, 50, is in the business of selling fresh fish in a local market in the Baray district.  Her husband catches fish from dawn to dusk along Tonle Sap River to support her sales. Together, they can generate an income in the neighborhood of $6.00 per day to cover their daily expenses. The purpose of this loan is to buy a boat motor and some fishing tackle for her husband because most of what they have are currently unusable. She lives with her husband and 5 single children.

loans.use: to buy a boat motor and some fishing tackle for her husband.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 34 years old and is married with four children aged between 1 and 12 years old. His business is well organized. He owns a spare parts business and he has five years of experience and employs two people to help him. The hours of his business are from 6am to 6pm during the week and sometimes on the weekend.

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more spare parts for resale. With any profit from this loan, Emmanuel will reinvest in his business, to save for his future and to pay children's school fees.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Sawa Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sawa SHG Group in Western Kenya! Beatrice is the facilitator of the Sawa SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Beatrice takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Beatrice was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Beatrice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sawa SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Beatrice is pictured with her group members. The field officer appears on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Idi

texts.en:
Idi is a 43-year-old married man with two school-going children. His wife, Mwanalima, is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Idi has operated a welding business for the past two years; his potential clients are trailer truck owners. He faces the major challenge of insufficient space in which to conduct his business. He dreams of expanding his business and hiring two assistants.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase a welding machine and hire two assistants to help him run his business. He decided to join Yehu to get funds to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine and hire two assistants to help him run his business.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is 50 years old and lives in Buenavista, Pagadian City. She is married with three children.

Her business is selling fruits and vegetables to earn a living. She earns 5,000 PHP each month from this business. Basilia has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase more fruits and vegetables for her business.

She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 41 years old and is married with one child. Marthe owns a boutique where she sells cooking oil, biscuits, water, soft drinks etc. Her business is well known and well organized. She has two years of experience in this business. She currently employs one person to help her and the hours of her business are from 8am to 8pm during the week but not on the weekend.

Marthe has requested loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase various goods such as cooking oil, biscuits, water, soft drinks etc to sell. With any profit, she will be able to reinvest in her business and to save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cooking oil, biscuits, water, soft drinks, etc to sell.

loans.name: Korb

texts.en: Korb, 52, resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a teacher at a public school, and he buys cows to resell. His wife raises ducks. Korb is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase cows to resell. By doing so, his family will be able to generate more income. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 61 years old and lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with four children. Perla has a buy and sell business and earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month from this business. Perla has requested a loan to buy used clothes to sell.

She has been a member of PMPC for four years, since October 2007. In the future Perla hopes to have her own space in the market for her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Kabende United Group

texts.en: Abbas used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell and to set up a boutique. The hardworking 28-year-old man is grateful to his group members who have always guaranteed him in accessing credit from the institution. He dreams of educating his children and moving his business to town. Abbas needs the loan facility to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sell.

loans.name: Hadidja

texts.en:
Hadidja is 41 years old and is married. Her business is very clean and well-run. She sells food and drinks.  Soft drinks, juice, water, bananas, potatoes, beans, rice etc are all sold in her restaurant. She has three years experience in this business and employs four people to help her. Her business operates from 5am until 9pm every day.

Hadidja has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her restaurant by buying large quantities of food and drinks (soft drinks, juice, water, bananas, potatoes, beans, rice, etc.) to sell. With any profit from the loan, Hadidja will be able to buy more materials to use in her restaurant and to save for her family.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant by buying large quantities of food and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Kuntea

texts.en:
Kuntea (in the photo) is 24 years old and her husband Thet is 26 years old. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2005 and have two daughters-one is in school and another who is not.  

Kuntea and her husband are farmers. They grow cauliflower on their farmland in the village where they live. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her cauliflower farm.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 32-year-old single man who owns a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for himself and transport. 

Stephen has operated a vegetable stall for the past four years; his potential clients are the local area's residents. He faces the major challenge of the rising cost of commodities in the market. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and onions for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access financial facilities to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 57-year-old man. He lives with his wife and two children, one of whom is working. He’s the only one responsible for his family and seeks to offer them a better future. He has operated his own vegetable shop since 1996 and has been working selling all kinds of vegetables for the past 15 years. He is expert in dealing with customers which makes them loyal. 

Today, Mohamad needs to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to increase his inventory of vegetables. In that way he will enhance sales. In the future, he plans to diversify his variety of vegetables and also expand his products to include natural fruits.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of vegetables

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a 30-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of 2 and 12 years; one of them is in school. She has had a business of selling from a food stall in Kator, South Sudan, for three years.

Sandra requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and cabbages. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is widowed with four children. She is now 51 years old and lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.

Victoria is a farmer and grows rice and other vegetable crops as a source of income. She has been doing this for 20 years. Victoria earned 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from this activity. She has requested a loan of 49,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her farming business.
Victoria has been a member of PMPC for four years and one month. in the future, Victoria hopes to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her farming activity.

loans.name: Aramazan

texts.en:
Aramazan is a fifty five year old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.

His family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent home. He has been operating a retail shop for thirty years, which he started with capital of twenty thousand UGX but which has grown to more than two million UGX. His major challenges are price fluctuations and inflation, however, he has a goal of expanding business into new markets. 

Aramazan wants a loan to buy materials to construct his house.

loans.use: To buy materials to construct his house.

loans.name: Sapon

texts.en:
Sapon (in the photo) and her husband are farmers and she is also a weaver. She is requesting another loan in the amount of $500 to continue her farming by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.
Sapon and her husband have been together since 1978 and have 6 sons and 2 daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, three have full time employment and the other four are in school. They live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is 25 years old and is married with three children, aged between 2 and 6 years old. Moussa also takes care of four relatives.  He owns a business selling various goods such as: lotions, soap, rice, sugar, plastic shoe etc. His business is well organized. 

The hours of his business are from 6 am until 7 pm every day and he has three years of experience.  Moussa currently employs one person to help him. 

Moussa has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more and various goods such as: lotions, soap, rice, sugar, plastic shoes etc for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as: lotions, soap, rice, sugar, plastic shoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is widowed with 2 children. Grace is 39 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez.

To earn a living, Grace has business selling sand and gravel. She has had this business for 11 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 14,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase sand and gravel. Grace has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

In the future, Grace hopes to send her children to school and expand her business in town.

loans.use: to purchase sand and gravel for her business.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon is 36 years old and her husband Pheap is 41 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one son and three daughters. Two are weavers, one is in school and another one is too young for school. 

Suon and her husband are farmers and she is also a weaver. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $800 to purchase an irrigation machine to spray her farm and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

Photo: Suon and her loom.

loans.use: To purchase an irrigation machine to spray her farm and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Siliver

texts.en:
Siliver is 30 years old and is married with three children aged between 4 and 9 years old. His business is well organized. He sells items in a boutique such as lotions, rice, sugar, etc. Siliver has five years of experience and employs six people to help him. The hours of his business are from 6am to 7pm each day except on Sunday.

Siliver has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as lotions, rice, sugar, etc. to sell. With any profit from this loan, Siliver will reinvest in his business and pay school fees for his children. Siliver hopes to build a house for his family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as lotions, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with no children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She lives in a rented house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Luvuno has operated a retail shop for the past 2 years; her potential clients are local residents. She faces a major challenge of unpaid debts from her customers. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and soap for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a weighing machine and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is from the village of Gomi in East Georgia. She is 43 years old, married and lives with her family: her husband Vladimer, her daughter in law and 1 year old grandson. Naira works as a milkmaid on a local farm. Along with her main job, Naira is actively involved in operating the family farm. The family has 2 milk cows and 1 calf. They produce cheese and sell it locally. Also the family owns 0.80 hectare land, where maize and beans are grown. Total average monthly income of the family is 950 Laris. 

Naira requested credit to purchase 6-7 calves. He will grow the calves during winter months and sell them in spring for much higher price. It will bring to the family significant additional income, which will be used for improving family living conditions. Also Naira will use 10% of the loaned amount for covering her old loan, taken from Credo.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Khvay

texts.en: Mrs. Khvay is 51 years old and a mother of 2 children. She lives in Baray district where she earns a living through fish selling business. She is a widowed woman and a hardworking mother. Both of her children are now working and one of them is already married. Mrs. Khvay is going to prepare a wedding party for her son in the next month, so she really needs these funds to spend on this party. She is very happy and thankful to all Kiva’s lenders who kindly help her when she is in need.

loans.use: to pay for her son's wedding party.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 33 years old and is married with two children aged between 3 and 8 years old.  Gilbert has five years' experience selling drinks. He currently employs one person to help him and the hours of his business are from 5am to 7pm every day.

Gilbert has requested a loan to purchase large quantities of sorghum to make drinks to sell. With profits from the loan, Gilbert would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and start saving for his future.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of sorghum to make drinks to sell.

loans.name: Wambwa Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wambwa Group in Western Kenya! Joyce is the facilitator of the Wambwa group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joyce takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Joyce had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joyce was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joyce and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Joyce will repay the loan.

In 2012, the members of Wambwa group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Wambwa group members appear in the photograph along with the field officer who appears on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Ren, 27, resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Ren is a teacher. Ren is requesting a loan of USD 350 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. By doing so, his family will be able to reduce the money they spend on public transportation. 

In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to school.

loans.name: Zyeremama

texts.en:
Zyeremama is a thirty year old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Her family goal is to educate her children. She has been trading in coffee for five years. Her main challenge is insufficient capital. Her dream is to become a bigger coffee dealer in the future.

Zyeremama intends to use the loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffElliot sell.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva is a 21 year old married woman with one child who is not in school. For two years, she has had a business selling groundnuts (peanuts) in Kator, South Sudan.

Silva requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase groundnuts. she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts (peanuts) for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 32-year-old single lady who lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself. 

Grace has operated a beauty salon for the past 2 years; her potential clients are women from the local area. She faces a major challenge of clients not paying their debts on time. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase a hair dryer and cosmetics for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Nohad

texts.en:
Nohad is an undergraduate Lebanese woman. She’s 25 years old, single, and living with her parents and two siblings. Her father is their main source of income and they all depend on him. She has been giving private lessons from her home for the past six years. 

Today, she’s asking for a loan of $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay her educational fees in order to graduate and pursue her Master’s degree.  She notes that this may enhance her way of teaching and help her attract more students. 

In the future, she plans to open her own learning center and hire well educated people to work for her.

loans.use: to pay her educational fees

loans.name: Bonaventure

texts.en:
Bonaventure is 34 years old and is married with four children aged between 2 and 8 years old. Bonaventure owns a business selling shoes. His business is well organized. The hours of his business are from 7 am until 6 pm every day except on Sunday and he has six years of experience. Bonaventure currently employs two people to help him.

Bonaventure has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more and shoes for resale. With any profits, he will be able to build his own house and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Joyless

texts.en:
Joyless is a twenty three year old lady with five children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children. 

She has been running a retail business for three years. The challenges she is facing are high commodity prices and her dream is a wholesale shop. 

Joyless needs a loan to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Youn

texts.en:
Youn, 52, resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Youn is a farmer, and her husband is a construction worker. 

Youn is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, her family will be able to reduce the money they spend on public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. 

This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is 26 years old and is married with one child who is 2 years old. Monique sells potatoes. Her business is well known and well organized. She has one year of experience in this business. She currently employs three people to help her and she works from 8am to 4pm every day except Sunday.

Monique has requested his first loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand her agricultural business by cultivating more potatoes to sell. With any profit, Monique will be able to buy her own house, save for her future and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To expand her agricultural business by cultivating more potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a twenty nine year old lady with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. 

She has been running a retail shop for three years and this has enabled her to provide basics for the family. Her major challenge is the high cost of living however, she has a goal to set up a wholesale shop. 

Mary needs the loan to buy matchboxes and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy matchboxes and soap to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 20 year old single woman with no children. She has had a business selling green vegetables in Kator, South Sudan for two years.

Juan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase green vegetables. She will use her extra income to pay her school fees

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables for sale.

loans.name: André

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il pratique l'activité d'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine et ovine.Il achète des vaches et des moutons sur les marchés hebdomadaires de sa région.Après quatre à cinq mois d'engraissement, il les revend avec une marge bénéficiaire assez importante.Il entretient sa famille avec les revenus tirés de cette activité. Pour augmenter ces revenus, il sollicite un prêt de 400000f de l'UIMCEC afin d'acheter 2 bœufs.Son ambition est de clôturer une de ses parcelle pour en faire une ferme d'élevage.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married father of three children. He is a livestock farmer who specializes in fattening cattle and sheep.

He buys cows and sheep at the weekly regional markets. After four to five months of fattening, he sells them with a sizeable margin. He maintains his family with the income from this activity.

To increase the income, he is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs from UIMCEC to purchase two oxen. His aim is to fence in one of his plots to raise livestock.

loans.use: buy two oxen

loans.name: Ruteete Twimuke Group

texts.en:
Teddy is a 60-year old single parent with six children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children and finish work on her house. 

She owns a boutique that she started ten years ago and faces a challenge of bad debtors. In spite of this, she is determined to transform her business into a big boutique specializing in children and women's wear. Teddy needs the loan to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Gratien

texts.en:
Gratien is 32 years old and is married with two children aged between 5 and 7 years old. His business is well organized. He sells retail items such as sugar, cakes, lotions, etc. Gratien has thirteen years of experience and employs one person to help him.

Gratien has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as sugar, cakes, lotions, etc to sell. With any profit from this loan, Gratien will reinvest in his business. He will also be able to buy a bicycle to help him in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as sugar, cakes, lotions, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is applying for another loan to expand her current business. She will use this 100,000 Kes loan to purchase more stocks of clothes for resale. In the future, Lucy aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Lucy has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru:
Жумагуль 38 лет, замужем, воспитывает  4-х детей  школьного возраста.
В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Жумагуль решила заняться торговлей плакатами и бижутерией на центральном рынке г.Кызылкия, вложив  начальную сумму 22,000 сом (KGS). Приложив все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, Жумагуль добилась успеха – на сегодняшний день в ее товарообороте около 100,000 сом (KGS), позволяющий получать доход около 20,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях расширения ассортимента товаров и дальнейшего увеличения своего бизнеса, Жумагуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закуп товара из Бишкека (столица). Доходы от кредита Жумагуль планирует вложить в расширение ее торгового места.
texts.en: Jumagul is 38 years old, married and is raising four school-age children.  In search of a source of income for her family, Jumagul decided to get involved in sales of posters and jewelry at the central market of the Kyzylkiya town, after investing an initial sum of 22,000 som (KGS).  Having put all of her efforts toward developing her business, Jumagul achieved success and has a goods turnover of about 100,000 som (KGS) today, which allows her to earn an income of about 20,000 som per month.  In order to expand the assortment of merchandise and grow her business further, Jumagul requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase merchandise from Bishkek (the capital).  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into the expansion of her retail space.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise from Bishkek

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 48-year-old Lebanese divorced man living on his own. He’s a hard worker, dependent on himself.  

In order to collect money and build a good future he opened his own minimarket in 2010 after being involved in this domain for the past fifteen years.  He knows well how to select his products and serve his customers as well as he can. Today, he wants to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen S.A.L to buy added goods such as daily and dairy products, canned bottles and many other items for his business in order to increase his sales therefore his profits.

In the future, he plans to open his own supermarket.

loans.use: to buy added goods such as daily and dairy products, canned bottles and many other items.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a thirty-five-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda.  Her family goal is to educate her children. 

She has been running a butcher business for ten years and this has enabled her to raise school fees for her children.  Her main hardship is insufficient capital and her dream is to own a ranch.  Susan needs money to buy meat to sell.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a farmer from the village of Zemo Khvedureti in East Georgia. She is 43 years old and lives with her family: husband – Roin, 3 sons (23, 20 and 18 years old) and a daughter in law. One of Nelly’s sons serves in her country's military forces. All the rest of the members of the family are involved in the family agricultural business. In particular, they own 1.3 hectares of land, where onions and beans are grown. Nelly sells harvested vegetables locally in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris. 

Nelly has requested credit for the purchase of 300 kg of onion seeds. Quality seeds will be the prerequisite of a good harvest in spring. The family plans to save part of the received income, for purchasing a house in the village, as their existing one is too small for all family members.

loans.use: to purchase 300 kg of onion seeds

loans.name: Muyazi

texts.en:
Muyazi is a married woman with six children who are all grown-ups. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of her family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Muyazi has operated a café for the past four years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of starting a livestock selling business.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase rice, beans and cooking oil for her café and also to buy livestock for her new livestock selling business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans and cooking oil for her café and also to buy livestock for her new livestock selling business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a twenty-five-year-old hard working woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.  Her family goal is to educate her children.  

She has been operating a butcher shop for two years and the business is now at its boom stage.  The challenge she is facing is insufficient capital to meet the increasing demand and her dream is to set up another butcher shop.  Agnes needs a loan to buy meat to sell.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 30 years old and a married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food on a stall in Kator, South Sudan for four years.

Jackline requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: From Kompong Speu province, Mrs. Men, a married woman and the mother of 5 children, is a hardworking farmer. Her husband is also in the same business. They grow rice crops for their livelihood and are able to earn approximately $ 2.50 per day. Because of the low income, 4 of her children have quit studying and have started working to help support the family's living conditions. Three of her daughters work in a garment factory as sewing staff, while her son is basket weaver. As shown in the picture, Mrs. Men house is being rebuilt again because their old home area is hard to leave. Therefore, she would like to ask for some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy necessary building materials to complete the reconstruction. She is very grateful for the support from lenders. She hopes that this new house will provide her family with a comfortable living space.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials to complete the reconstruction of her home.

loans.name: C 5418 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Elina is 47 years old and she is also the leader of this group (pictured with her hand raised), which is called "Abizeranye" in the local language. Elina  has two years of experience and she works from 5:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m every day. 

Elina has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, etc to sell. With any profit, Elina hopes to reinvest in her business, save for her future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Khalunyanu A Group

texts.en:
Abraham is the facilitator of the Khalunyanu A group. Abraham and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Abraham takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Abraham had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Abraham was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Abraham and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Abraham will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Khalunyanu A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Abraham is pictured with his group members. The field officer is on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is a thirty-nine-year-old, hardworking woman with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda.  Her personal goal is educate her children. 

She has been working in the butcher business for ten years after diverting from farming. The challenge she facing is insufficient capital and her dream is to own a ranch. Dalia needs a loan to buy meat.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 53-year-old Lebanese married man, living with his wife and four children. One child is working and three are still attending school. Because of the heavy life expenses and his children’s educational costs, Khalil was obliged to work hard to cover their needs.  Despite all that, he was thankful to have such a united and lovely family. 

He has twenty-five years experience in the field of agriculture until he opened his own agricultural products shop. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen S.A.L. to pay his children’s university fees and expenses until graduation. In the future, he plans to open another business where his children can work on his behalf.

loans.use: to pay his children’s university fees and expenses until graduation.

loans.name: Kabende Tukurakurane Group

texts.en:
John is a hardworking young man, married with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He owns a carpentry workshop that he has been operating for the last six years and faces the challenges of price fluctuations and inflation.  In spite of this, John has a dream of expanding his business into new markets and have a more permanent location. 

Targeting the Christmas season, he needs the loan to buy wood, mattresses and covers to use to make furniture to sell.

loans.use: to buy wood, mattresses and covers to use to make furniture to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy cosmetics

loans.name: Phidiliah

texts.en:
Phidiliah is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school while one is working. Her husband is a constructor who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Phidiliah has operated a motorcycle transportation business for the past three years; in addition she also sells cereals. Her potential clients are the local villagers. She faces a major challenge of the rising cost of fuel. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase spare parts and repair her motorcycle and also buy cereals for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and repair her motorcycle and also to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Khalisse

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de six enfants dont trois élèves.Elle vend des produits agricoles comme le mil,  le haricot et l'arachide dans un magasin au marché central.Elle appuie son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille avec les revenus tirés de son commerce.Elle s'occupe surtout  des frais de scolarité  des enfants,de leur habillement et participe dans les dépenses d'alimentation. Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un prêt de 500000f pour acheter de l'arachide, du mil et du haricot. Son ambition est d'agrandir son magasin.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married woman and the mother of six children, of whom three are students. She sells agricultural products such as millet, beans and peanuts in a store at the central market.

She supports her husband in dealing with family needs using the income from her business. She deals mainly with the children's tuition fees, their clothing and part of the family's food expenditures.

To increase her business assets, she is requesting a loan to buy 500,000 francs worth of peanuts, millet and beans. Her ambition is to enlarge her store.

loans.use: buy peanuts, millet and beans

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is a 38-year-old married woman, mother of three children. Christian opened a grocery store in 2008, in order to help her husband in their living, and to start a career that might develop in time.

Christian is a hard working woman, she is well known in the region with a good reputation, in addition to the hard work she puts and the effort she makes to develop herself and her family's situation. 

Christian never stops future plans, she is working hard to provide her family with the best living, and that's why she applied for a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua, in order to start a new business that can help in her development.

Christian will open a speciA. reA. estate office.  She will start this kind of business because she is well-known and most of her customers support her to do so because of her excellent communication network.

loans.use: to start a new business in real estate.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a 48-year old married woman who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has owned a shop where she sells used clothes for five years.  Zubeda  started by selling her clothes door-to-door, but was successful enough to secure a permanent place from which to sell.

Zubeda says challenges she faces in business include customers not paying on time and a lack of capital to buy inventory.  Her dream is to be able to educate her children and build a permanent home.  Zubeda plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy clothes to resell this holiday season.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to resell

loans.name: Devota

texts.en:
Devota is a married woman with 4 school going children. Her husband is an engineer who contributes to the family's  basic needs. She owns a house with piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Devota has operated a water selling business for the past 4 years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of damaged pipes sometimes causing water loss. 

With a Kshs 50,000 loan Devota wants to purchase a water tank and construct another water storage facility for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and construct another water storage facility for her business.

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en: Anne is the facilitator of the Wesakulila group. Anne and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. Anne takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to grow enough to feed her family and educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Anne had an excellent maize yield harvesting 23 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 13 bags of maize on one acre of land. With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Anne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. With income from her maize sales, Anne will build a house and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land. She is pictured in the photograph with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Wellington

texts.en:
Wellington is a married man of fifty years. He lives in Barazani in the outskirts of Emali town with his family of ten people. He buys and sells cows in Emali town and has been doing so for seven years. He gets a monthly income of eight thousand shillings.

This will be Wellington's seventh loan with KADET LTD. He has successfully repaid all the other loans. With this loan he plans to buy more cows so that he can sell them and make a profit. 

In the  future Wellington plans to educate his children to higher education, and also to save some money.

loans.use: To   buy more cows for sale

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man living on his own. He’s the one responsible for himself, enjoying his life and doing the best he can to enrich his way of living. Despite his young age, he decided to open his own business, a cattle farm, in 2007. He likes his job and knows very well that with a little more carefulness his business will grow faster. Today, he’s requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fodder in order to feed his animals. He notes that this will enhance his business and boost his productivity. In the future, he plans to enlarge his business and purchase added animals.

loans.use: to purchase fodder in order to feed his animals

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié .Il est père de cinq enfants dont les deux fréquentent l'école primaire.Il exerce l'activité de commerce de bétail.Il parcourt les différents marchés hebdomadaires du pays à la recherche de vaches et de moutons à bon prix qu'il achète et revend sur les marchés environnants de sa localité.Cette activité lui procure des revenus consistants qui lui permettent de prendre en charge l'essentiel des  besoins de sa famille.Pour renforcer son activité , il sollicite un prêt de 400000f pour acheter 10 moutons.Son ambition est de construire une ferme pour faire de l'embouche ovine.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married man. He is the father of five children of whom two attend primary school.

He is in the business of livestock trading. He travels to various weekly markets throughout the country in search of cows and sheep he buys at a low price. He then resells them in the markets of his surrounding area.

This activity provides him with significant income allowing him to meet most of his family's needs.

To strengthen his business, he is requesting a 400,000 francs loan to buy ten sheep. His ambition is to build a farm where he will fatten sheep.

loans.use: buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more retail stock, such as maize flour, beans, sugar and candles

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with 8 school going children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Hadija has operated as a farmer for the past 13 years. Her potential clients are café owners. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, Hadija she wants to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm. She decided to join Yehu because it has fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Abdukahor

texts.ru: Абдукахор более 23 лет занимается откормом и продажей скота. Он имеет достаточно богатый опыт, чтобы продолжить и расширить этот бизнес. Его жена и сын помогают ему по ухаживанию  и откорму скота. Абдукахор всегда мечтал получить хорошую прибыль для того чтобы содержать свою семью в хороших условиях жизни, чтобы они жили в достатке. С этой целью Абдукахор запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарить вас за ваше доброе сердце.
texts.en: Abdukahor has been involved in fattening up and selling livestock for over 23 years.  He has a fairly extensive experience in order to continue and expand this business.  His wife and son help with caring for and feeding livestock.  Abdukahor always dreamt of making a good profit in order to provide good conditions for his family, so that they could live in abundance.  This is why Abdukahor is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000 to purchase livestock.  He hopes to get your help and thanks you in advance for your kind heart.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Neema Group in Western Kenya! Irene is the facilitator of the Neema group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Irene  takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Irene had a very good maize yield, harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Irene was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irene  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Irene will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Neema group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Neema and group members and their field officer, far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rukhsana Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana Bibi is 39 years old and married with four children. All of her children are getting their education. She and her husband are very hard working by nature. Her husband sells construction supplies. He operates his business from the market where he deals with construction material such as cement, bricks, and sand. Rukhsana Bibi and her husband help each other financially by doing their respective work. 

Rukhsana herself owns and operates a sewing and embroidering business. Her work is home-based. She collects orders from clients in her community and from her relatives as well. She charges based on the amount of work per sewing or embroidering job. Her clients pay what she asks without arguing because they receive quality and timely work from her. 

Rukhsana is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing and embroidery business. She intends to use the loan to purchase an embroidery machine because currently she makes embroidery by hand. This is the season of marriages. Therefore, Rukhsana Bibi would like to purchase an embroidery machine so she will be able to receive larger orders and finish them more efficiently. In the future, she hopes to be able to save money for expanding her business.

In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rukhsana Bibi.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine for a sewing and embroidering business.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune marié qui pratique le commerce.Il vit dans la maison familiale avec ses frères et sœurs. Pour palier à la promiscuité, il envisage de construire trois chambres et y héberger son épouse.Il sollicite ainsi un prêt de 400000f pour compléter l'achat de matériel de construction. Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
The borrower is a newlywed who works as a merchant. He lives in the family home with his brothers and sisters. To improve intimacy, he plans to build three rooms to accommodate his wife.

Therefore he is requesting a 400,000 loan to complete his purchase of construction materials. His ambition is to build his own house.

loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, age 40, has worked in construction since 1994. He specializes in pasting and polishing tiles and also offers painting services. He is a hard worker and a very kind father who works hard for his children's happiness and satisfaction. He and his wife have four children.
 
In addition to his construction business, Ali has been a partner in a bakery. Recently, he bought out his partner and now needs to do necessary maintenance to his new business. He is confident that this step will have a significant and positive effect on his family's situation.
 
Through a requested loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, Ali will buy new machines and an improved wide oven in addition to purchasing necessary raw materials. 

Ali hopes to expand both businesses in a very strategic way, and to gain and preserve his customers' trust.

loans.use: to buy new new machines for his bakery and raw materials for his construction business

loans.name: Naser

texts.en: Naser is a 38-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. He’s the main income provider in the family after his father became too old to bear this big responsibility. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2000 and has fifteen years' experience in this area. Until now he has gotten a fair number of customers asking for his services. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new blacksmith equipment for his business. This will help him continue his work in a proper way and respond to his customers’ demands. In the future, he plans to join a local company and benefit from their experience.

loans.use: to purchase new blacksmith equipment for his business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is applying for another loan to expand her current business. She will use this 40,000 Kes loan to purchase more stocks of rice, beans, coconuts, sugar and cooking oil for her café. In the future, she aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Amina has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice, beans, coconuts, sugar and cooking oil for her café.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is 35 years old. He lives in a small village in the Gori Region with his family: his wife, Kristine, his 3-month-old daughter, and his parents, who are retired. Kristine works as a nurse in the village. Ramin manages the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of income for them. 

The family owns a dairy farm with two milk cows and two calves. They produce and sell cheese locally. They also have two pigs and sell, on average, 20 piglets per year at the local market. Ramin also has 16 bee-hives with bee-colonies. He sells honey in the village. In addition, Ramin runs a small grocery store in the village. He purchases grocery products at the wholesale market in Tbilisi and sells them in his store. The total average monthly income of the family is 1500 Laris, including the monthly pensions of Ramin’s parents. 

Ramin requested credit to buy more stock for his grocery store because a wide assortment of products on the shelves will attract additional customers, and the sales of the store will increase. This will positively impact the income of the family. Ramin plans to reinvest part of the income in further development of his bee-keeping, which is his favorite of his businesses.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for increasing stock in trade in the grocery store

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny, a 46-year-old mother of one child, has been farming for 40 years, since she was 6, in a village located in the Moung Russey district. To better feed her family, she also catches fish to sell for additional income. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver.

With her current business, Ny, who leads a group of two female members, earns less than 5 US dollars per day. She and the other member of her group have been with VisionFund for two and three years respectively. As a result of her second loan with VisionFund, Ny can now afford to buy enough food to feed her children and have a regular income.

Now applying for her third loan to pay others to plant her rice, Ny hopes to have more rice to sell for a good price so as to earn more income. She plans to set aside some money to send her child to school.

loans.use: to pay for labor on her rice plantation.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié sans enfants.Il exerce dans l'informatique et tient un cybercafé dans sa localité.Il entretient sa petite famille avec les revenus tirés des services qu'il offre à sa clientèle. Pour renforcer son activité, il sollicite un prêt de 200000f pour acheter des accessoires informatiques ( cd, disques dur, écran...).Son ambition est d'élargir son activité aux localité environnantes de sa ville.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man who has no children. He is active in the computing business and has a cybercafé in his town. He looks after his small famiL. with the income he makes from the services he offers to his customers. In order to strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan of 20,000 francs to buy computer accessories (CDs, hard disks, screens..). His ambition is to expand his business to areas surrounding his town.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories (CDs, hard disks, screens..)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Makina Shg Group

texts.en:
Milka is the facilitator of the Makina SHG group. Milka and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Milka is a mother of three children. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Milka had a very good maize yield, harvesting 11 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Milka was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Milka and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Milka will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Makina SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of regional juice specialities

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, age 42, has worked in construction for 20 years. His construction work is his only source of income, so he works hard to keep his business updated with new construction tools. He and his wife have four children.
 
Ibrahim is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools and wood for his business. He intends to save part of it to pay for his children's education fees. This is Ibrahim's seventh cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and all his previous loans were repaid on time. 
 
Ibrahim is a borrower in good standing and a man with a very good reputation. He is highly recommended by his customers. He hopes to stay capable of educating his children and providing them with a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: to buy necessary wood and tools for his business

loans.name: Sérigne

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il exerce l'activité d'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine. Il achète des bœufs qu'il engraisse et revend au bout de quatre ou six mois. Cette activité génère des revenus consistants avec lesquels il arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.Pour renforcer son activité, il sollicite un prêt de 350000f pour acheter deux bœufs .Son ambition est d'acquérir assez de fonds pour élargir son activité.
texts.en:
Sérigne is married and the father of three children. He raises livestocks, notably cattle. He buys oxen that he fattens and resells after four or six months.

This business earns him a consistent income, which enables him to provide for his family. To bolster his business, he's seeking a loan of XOF 350'000 in order to buy two oxen.

He ambitions to have enough capital to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy two oxen

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two siblings. His father is the main source of income in the family, and he’s doing the best he can to cover their expenses and fulfill their needs. For this reason, Jalal started to work at an early age in order to help his father. So he opened his own fruits and vegetables shop in 2008 and continues to further grow it. 

Today, he’s looking to borrow $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a weighing machine to be able to enhance his control over his products. In the future, he plans to deliver some of his goods to the neighboring areas.

loans.use: to purchase a weighing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Davlatpochoh

texts.ru: Давлатпочох замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Она занимается шитьем национальных и европейских женских платьев. Имеет большой опыт в своем работе, так как она более 15 лет занималась этим. Давлатпочох имеет много клиентов, которые заказывает ей и доверяет в её рук дело. Она хочет купить новую швейную машинку для того чтобы шить более качественно с новыми технологиями. Она надеется на вашу помощь и признательно вам за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Davlatpochoh is married and is a mother of two children.  She is involved in sewing national and European women's dresses.  She has an extensive experience in this business since she has been involved in it for over 15 years.  Davlatpochoh has many clients, who order from her and trust her with their orders.  She wants to purchase a new sewing machine in order to use new technologies to sew with better quality.  She hopes to get your help and is grateful to you for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Organic Group

texts.en:
Jane is the facilitator of the Organic group. Jane and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jane takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Jane had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Jane was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½  acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Jane will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Organic group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Jane is pictured with her group members and their field officer, far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married man with six children; four attend school while two are yet to join. His wife is a teacher who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Emmanuel has operated a livestock (cattle and goats) selling business for the past five years; in addition, he also practices small-scale farming. His potential clients are his neighbors, relatives and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase more cattle and goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to get working capital for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle and goats for resale.

loans.name: Karapet

texts.en:
Karapet is from the village of Balkho, South Georgia. He is 49 years old and lives in the village with his family: his wife Tamara, two sons who are 19 and 18 years old, an 11-year-old daughter, and his 85-year-old mother. His children go to school. 

Karapet and Tamara manage the agricultural business of the family. In particular, they have milk cows and produce cheese, which is sold at the local market. Also, the family grows potatoes on a family-owned plot of land. The potatoes are also sold locally. 

Karapet requested credit for purchasing a house in his village. The house will be used by Karapet’s sons when they marry. The family's existing house is too small and can’t hold more people.

loans.use: to purchase a house in the village.

loans.name: Mwamunga

texts.en:
Mwamunga has operated a firewood-selling business for the past two years, selling his wares to members of the local community. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of selling firewood in wholesale.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, he wants to purchase more bundles of firewood to offer for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds in order to expand his business.

Mwamunga and his wife have two school-going children. His wife is a tailor who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood to offer for sale

loans.name: Choeum's Group

texts.en:
Choeum, age 44, leads this group of two borrowers. She is a wholesale vendor of fish-paste in a village in Moung Russey district. She has been making and selling fish-paste for almost 20 years. She supplements her income by selling rice soup in front of her house. In addition, her husband chops wood and offers the firewood for sale to raise additional income. They have four children. The eldest works in Thailand while the other three are dependents. 
 
Choeum has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles while her fellow borrower has just joined VisionFund and is receiving her first loan. Choeum successfully repaid her previous loans with VisionFund. After these loans, she can afford to buy enough food for her family and provide better living conditions through regular income. 

She is now requesting another loan. She will use this loan to buy fish-paste to offer for sale. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business and earn more income so as to set aside some savings for their future needs.

loans.use: to buy fish-paste to offer for wholesale sale

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en: Haitham is a 45-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and has two children. One child is working and the other one is still attending school. With the cooperation of his working child, he has been able to cover the heavy life expenses and pay his child’s educational fees. He has owned a mobile phones shop since 2006 and he’s known for his high quality items and good reputation. Today, he’ asking for a loan of $1200 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new supplies and phones accessories related to his business. He notes that being up to date will increase the number of his clients and thus his revenues. In the future, he plans to open new branches in several areas.

loans.use: to purchase new supplies and phones accessories related to his business.

loans.name: Fadhili

texts.en:
Fadhili is a married man with nine school going children. He owns a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

Fadhili has operated a retail shop for the past year. In addition he owns a rental house. His potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of owning another rental house.

With the Kshs 100,000 he wants to purchase more stocks of rice, sugar and maize flour for his shop and also renovate his rental house. He decided to join Yehu to get capital to improve his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of rice, sugar and maize flour for his shop and also to renovate his rental house.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is a married man with four school going children. His wife Rehema is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.  

Katana has operated a tailoring business for the past 9 years; his potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of debtors taking too long to pay their debts. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase fabrics and embroideries for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access fund to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and embroideries for his business.

loans.name: Chifui

texts.en:
Chifui is a married man with three children, one of whom attends school while the others are married. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Chifui has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 7 years. His potential clients are his neighbors and people passing by. He faces a major challenge of insecurity. He dreams of owning a pick up truck.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access financial facilities to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Samaki Shg Group

texts.en:
Hudson is the facilitator of the Samaki SHG group. Hudson and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
