Hudson takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Hudson had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 13 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Hudson was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hudson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Hudson will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Samaki SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Hudson is pictured with his group members and the field officer, far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 30 year old married man. He has been selling used hardware spare parts for 13 years.
His business is unique and improving these days. That is why he applied for a loan with Kiva partner Al Majmoua--in order to increase his business capital through buying new used spare parts. These products are highly requested by those who deal with electronics maintenance.
Ibrahim is a hardworking man and liked by most of his customers.
He hopes to improve his business in a very organized way and to expand it through opening a big warehouse capable of storing the huge number of stocks he's going to be trading with.

loans.use: To increase his business capital through buying new used spare parts.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a 31 year old Lebanese woman living with her husband and only one child. Since their marriage, and after having their child, Salma and her husband find it really hard to cover their expenses. That is why they are cooperating together in order to earn superior income and have a fair way of living. She decided to start her own business as a beautician since 2009. She has been working on a freelance basis for the past seven years. She’s too friendly and knows very well how to deA. and stay in good relationships with her clients. Her husband has been working in a locA. company for the past four years. Today, she’s requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase tools and beauty supplies such as makeup, hair extensions and many other items for her business. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase added tools and beauty supplies such as makeup, hair extensions and many other items.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is 57 years old. She lives in the village of Korkhi, South Georgia. Nina lives alone; she performs night-watch duties at a local school and receives a monthly salary of 80 GEL. 

Nina's main source of income is agriculture. In particular, she has a milk cow, and she produces cheese and sells it at the local market. Along with the dairy farm, Nina is also busy growing potatoes. She sells the harvested vegetables in the village to retailers. 

Nina requested credit for purchasing calves, piglets, and wood.  Nina will feed calves and piglets during the winter months and sell them in spring for a higher price. She will use the wood to heat her house.

Nina plans to save some part of the received income for further development of potato growing, as this business has a high profit margin. Part of the income will be also used for purchasing additional household goods to improve Nina’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves and piglets and to purchase wood for warming the house.

loans.name: Risolat

texts.ru: Рисолат активная трудолюбия предпринимательница. На протяжении многих лет она занимается купле продажей женской одежды. Все ее труды идут на благосостояние семьи и содержания троих детей. Она замужем Муж работает водителем. У них  дружная семья. Вся прибыль идет на расширения товара. К праздникам и к зимнему сезону она хочет пополнить ассортимент товара. Для этого она хочет получить займ в размере 8000 сомони. Она благодарна тем, кто выручит её в нужный для нее день. Она надеется  на то что добрые люди помогут ей. Спасибо
texts.en: Risolat is an active and hardworking entrepreneur.  She has been involved in buying and selling women's clothing for many years.  All of her work goes toward the family's well-being and supporting her three children.  She is married, and her husband works as a driver.  They have a friendly family.  All of the profit is used to expand merchandise selection.  Risolat wants to expand her merchandise assortment for the holidays and winter season.  This is why she wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 8000 somoni.  She is grateful to all, who would help her out when necessary.  She hopes that kind people will help her.  Thank you.

loans.use: to expand merchandise assortment

loans.name: Musundi A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Musundi A Group in Western Kenya! Joyce is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 Joyce takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had a good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joyce was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joyce and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Joyce will educate her children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Musundi A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire qui vend des chaussures et des habits au marché central de sa localité.Il s'approvisionne en gros dans la capitale et revend ses articles au détail. Il parvient à obtenir des bénéfices qui lui assurent une bonne prise en charge de ses petits frères et sœurs qui sont tous à sa charge. Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce , il sollicite un prêt de 400000f pour acheter trois caisses de chaussures et des pantalons "jean". Son ambition est d'ouvrir une seconde cantine.
texts.en:
Alpha is a young bachelor. He sells shoes and clothing at the central market in his town. He buys his supplies wholesale in the capital, and retails his products.

He manages to turn a profit that enables him to take good care of his younger brothers and sisters, whom he has to support.

To bolster his business, he's seeking a loan of XOF 400'000 in order to buy three boxes of shoes and jeans. He ambitions to open a second shop.

loans.use: to buy three boxes of shoes and jeans

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a married man with five children, three of whom attend school while the two are still too young for school. His wife Tabu is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Omar has operated a retail shop for the past five years. His potential clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil for resale. He decided to join Yehu because they offer loans with low interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru: Мутабар занимается скотоводством. В основном она откармливает и продает скот. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Она берет кредит для закупа несколько голов бычков и телят.
texts.en: Mutabar practices animal husbandry. Generally she raises and then sells livestock. She is 39 years old, married, and has six children. She is incurring this debt in order to buy several head of young cattle.

loans.use: Buy several calves.

loans.name: Déguène

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée qui tient une table sous l'arbre à palabre de son village.Elle y vend des produits alimentaire comme le mil, l'arachide.Elle sert également du café"touba" aux passants.Avec les modestes bénéfices qu'elle tire de son commerce, elle parvient à subvenir à certains besoins vestimentaires de ses enfants et à améliorer leur alimentation. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter des arachides, du mil, du haricot et 5 sacs de café touba. Son ambition est de louer une cantine au marché central.
texts.en:
This borrower is a married woman who has a booth under the village’s baobab tree where she sells food products such as millet and groundnuts. She also serves Touba coffee to the passersby. The modest revenue earned from this activity allows her to provide for some of her children’s needs with respect to food and clothing. 

In order to increase her working capital, she is seeking a loan of 100,000F to buy groundnuts, millet, beans, and five bags of Touba coffee. Her goal is to lease a stall at the central market.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, millet, beans and Touba coffee

loans.name: Mairamkhon

texts.ru: Майрамхон вот уже четыре года занимается купле продажей национальных тканей. Ткани она привозит из соседней республики в месяц два раза она ездит за товаром. Семья у них большая Муж строитель. Трое детей. Двое внуков и невестка- вот состав ее семьи. Она хочет закупить новый ассортимент товара к предстоящим праздникам. Ведь на праздник все стараются купить новое платьев. Она весьма благодарна тем, кто поможет ей в получении займа в размере 10 000 сомони для пополнения ассортимента товара. Она надеется на вашу помощь спасибо за доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: It has already been four years since Mairamkhon began to work in sales of traditional fabrics. She imports the fabrics from neighboring countries. She makes two trips each month to pick up the merchandise. Her family is large. Her husband is a construction worker. They have three children, two grandchildren and a daughter-in-law; these are the members of her family. Mairamkhon wants to buy a new selection of merchandise for the approaching holiday season since many people try to buy new dresses for the holidays.  She is very thankful for those who help her in procuring a loan of 10,000 somoni for improvement of her merchandise selection. She hopes for your help. Thank you for your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is a 32 year old married woman with four children. All of the children are in school. She has had a business of selling maize grains in Kator South Sudan for five years.
Vicky requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase maize. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase chalks of maize grains for sale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with eight children, six of whom attend school while the other two are still too young for school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Ali has operated a tailoring business for the past eight years. His potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of debtors not paying their dues on time. He dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 he wants to purchase fabrics and embroideries for his business. He decided to join Yehu because of their fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and embroideries for his business.

loans.name: Mankaa

texts.en:
Pictured is a young single mother of two children under 15 years old. They live in a two-room house at Mile-Two Nkwen Bamenda in the North West region of Cameroon. She is saddened whenever she thinks about being a school drop-out, the death of her father, the death of her group member, and about poverty.

This dynamic lady joined GHAPE in 2003 and has successfully taken and repaid empowerment credit five times. She struggles to educate her two children so that they can have the knowledge she never had. Given a loan, she will invest in her snack bar and restaurant business. The loan will be used to buy crates, drinks, and kitchen utensils. 

She plans to plough back part of the profit into her business, buy a piece of land, and build a house. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates and an ample investment period, as well as training received from GHAPE in business management and marketing.

loans.use: to buy crates, drinks, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal, solder sticks, iron bars

loans.name: Sinoko B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sinoko B Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 
Dorcas is the facilitator of this group. She is a mother of two children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Dorcas had a good maize yield harvesting nine bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Dorcas was only able to harvest three bags of maize on half an acre of land. 
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dorcas and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Dorcas will educate her children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Sinoko B Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various fabrics

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru: Мастона уже четыре года занимается скотоводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. У нее имеются условия для разведения скота. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж занимается растениеводством. У них четверо детей. Мастона берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Mastona has been involved in animal husbandry for four years.  She breeds cattle at home.  Mastona has the right conditions for breeding livestock.  She is 35 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband is involved in agriculture.  Mastona is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle in order to increase its quantity.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Asiaha

texts.en:
Asiaha is a 30 year old married woman with five children. Four of them are in school. She has had a business selling tea in Kator South Sudan for four years.
Asiaha requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for sale.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru: Махмуд молодой перспективный парень. Он женат и у них на воспитании один ребенок. Жена работает швеёй. Он сам на протяжении пяти лет занимается купле продажей мужской одежды и обуви. С наступлением зимы все переходят на зимнюю одежду, поэтому он хочет получить займ в размере 1900$ США для пополнения ассортимента зимними товарами. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и ждет одобрения займа. Ведь скоро Новый год и все хотят купить что-то новое. Спасибо тем, кто поддержит его и даст возможность расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Mahmud is a young and promising man.  He is married and is raising one child.  Mahmud's wife works as a seamstress.  He has been involved in buying and selling men's clothing and shoes for five years. With the onset of winter, everyone transitions to winter clothing, and this is why he wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1906 to purchase winter merchandise.  Mahmud hopes to get your support and awaits loan approval.  New Year's is coming up soon, and everyone wants to buy something new.  Thank you to those, who support him and provide him with an opportunity to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase winter merchandise

loans.name: Hamad

texts.en:
Hamad is a 33-year-old married father of two children, one of whom is enrolled in school while the other is yet too young to attend. His wife, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of family basic needs. Hamad owns a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Hamad has operated a clothes-selling business for the past four years; his potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, and dreams of opening a cosmetics shop in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand his business, Hamad is requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to purchase more stocks of fabrics, hand bags and cosmetics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of fabrics, hand bags and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 26-year-old, married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. She has had a butcher shop for 6 years. She started the business with money earned from farming. The hardship she is facing is insufficient capital to meet demand. However, she has a goal of setting up another butcher shop in town. She intends to buy meat for sale with the loan requested.

loans.use: to buy meat for sale

loans.name: Vosse

texts.ru: Воссе  способный, находчивый  предприниматель. Его стаж – 15 лет. Все эти годы он занимается торговлей мясных изделий. Он женат и отец четверых детей. Семья его гордость , именно ради семьи  и своих детей он старается на работе , чтобы содержать их в достатке. Жена прекрасная домохозяйка.  Скоро Новый год и к новому году все накрывают праздничный стол. А изделия , которыми он торгует пользуются большим спросом. Его торговая точка находится на очень выгодном месте – здесь много покупателей. Он хочет получить займ в размере 800$ США для пополнения товарооборота, закупа мясных изделий оптом. Он весьма благодарен вам за поддержку.
texts.en: Vosse is a capable, resourceful entrepreneur. He has fifteen years experience. All these years he has been selling meat. He is married and the father of four children. His family is his pride. For the sake of his family and their children, he works to keep them prosperous. His wife is a wonderful housekeeper.  The New Year is coming soon, and everyone will buy food for the holiday dinner. The products he sells will be in great demand. His shop is in an excellent location.  He has many customers. He wants to take out a loan of $800 to supplement his trade by purchasing meat in bulk. He is very grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy meat wholesale

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale is a mason. He has operated his business for six years and offers his services to members of the local community. He faces a major challenge in his lack of capital to expand his business. He dreams of establishing his own construction office. 

He and his wife have one small child who is still too young for school. They own a house with electricity but no piped water. Mangale's greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 
 
With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase building blocks, sand, and cement so as to expand his business. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase building blocks, sand, and cement so as to expand his business

loans.name: Liana

texts.ru:
Лиана родилась в 1984 году в городе Ашхабаде, Туркменской Республики. В возрасте 14 лет она с семьей переехала в  Армению и поселилась в городе Капане. После окончания средней школы она вышла замуж и переехала к мужу в деревню Гехи (Geghi). У Лианы двое сыновей: старший учится в средней школе, а младший посещает детский сад. В данный момент Лиана работает в сельской общине. 
Лиана и ее муж на протяжении 10 лет занимаются сельскохозяйственным бизнесом. Они выращивают овощи и фрукты, а также разводят крупный рогатый скот, овец и свиней. 
Выращенные овощи и фрукты они продают на рынках Сьюникской области, а  мясо и молоко у них покупают постоянные скупщики прямо из дома. Благодаря занятию сельским хозяйством Лиана и ее муж содержат семью.
Лиане нужен кредит на сумму 1.000.000 армянских драм, для покупки сена, комбинированного корма и нескольких свиней.
texts.en:
Liana was born in 1984 in Ashgabat, the Turkmen Republic. At age 14 she and her family moved to Armenia and settled in the town of Kapan. After graduating from high school she married and moved with her husband to the village of Geghi. Liana has two sons. The elder son goes to high school and the younger one goes to kindergarten. At the moment Liana works on a communal farm.. 

For ten years, Liana and her husband have been doing farm work. They grow vegetables and fruit, as well as breeding cattle, sheep and pigs. The fruit and vegetables they produce are sold in markets in the Syunikskoy area, and they sell meat and milk out of their home to regular customers. Thanks to the farm, Liana and her husband are able to provide for the family. Liana needs a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy hay, feed, and a few pigs.

loans.use: To buy fodder for her farm animals and also to buy some pigs

loans.name: Mauzu

texts.en:
Mauzu is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling bread in Kator, South Sudan, for six years.

Mauzu requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread to sell. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bread for resale.

loans.name: Dalerzhon

texts.ru: Далержон несмотря на молодость занимается предпринимательством. Он холост, но помогает своим родителям. Готовится к семейной жизни. Четыре года  он торгует продовольственными  товарами. Бизнес прибыльный, востребован везде. Он приобретает товар в городе и продает в своем регионе. Он хочет получить займ 8800 сомони и пополнить ассортимент товара. Он надеется, что его поддержат как молодого предпринимателя и помогут  в расширение бизнеса. Спасибо.
texts.en: Dalerzhon, despite his youth, works in business. He is single but helps his parents. He is preparing for family life. He has been selling food for four years. The business is lucrative; it is in demand everywhere. He gets goods in the city and sells them in the country. He wants to get a loan of 8800 somoni to replenish his inventory.  He hopes that he will receive support as a young entrepreneur and help in expanding his business. Thank you.

loans.use: Buying goods

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 28-year-old married woman. She has two children, both of whom are in school. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and transport. 

Susan has operated a clothes selling business for the past two years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune marié sans enfants.Il exerce dans le transport par motocyclette qui constitue le principal moyen de déplacement dans sa localité.Il tire des revenus substantiels de cette activité et participe fortement aux dépenses d'entretien de sa famille.Il prend aussi ses besoins en charge entièrement.Il sollicite un prêt de 400000f pour acheter une nouvelle motocyclette.
texts.en:
Daouda is a newly wed without children. He's a motorcycle taxi, which is the main transportation mean in his town.

He earns a substantial income from this business, and contributes a great deal to taking care of his family's expenses.

He also provides for himself entirely. He's seeking a loan of XOF 400'000 in order to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.ru: Азамжон занимается растениеводством. Он арендует участок земли, где сеет зерновые культуры. Ему 32 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Целью получения кредита является покупка семян пшеницы и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: Azamjon is a farmer. He rents the land where he sows his crops. He is 32 years old. He is married. He has three children. His wife works on a small farm. He is taking out a loan to buy wheat seed and fuel for a tractor.

loans.use: to buy wheat seed and fuel for a tractor.

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en:
Kamene is a married woman with two children who are enrolled in college. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and house rent.
 
Kamene has operated a retail shop for the past four years; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of owning a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and soap for her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access funds for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire qui vend des produits cosmétiques, des chaussures et des habits pour femme.Il tient une cantine au marché de sa localité.Son activité génère des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses propres besoins et de soutenir sa famille sur le plan alimentaires et du paiement des factures d'eau et d'électricité. Pour renforcer son activité, il sollicite un prêt de 250000f pour acheter 4 caisses de produits cosmétiques, des chaussures et des vêtements. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en:
Bassirou is a young bachelor who sells cosmetics, shoes, and women's clothing. He runs a small shop at the market in his town.

His business earns him a consistent income, which enables him to provide for himself and support his family by paying for their food, as well as their water and electricity bills.

To bolster his business, he's seeking a loan of XOF 250'000 in order to buy four boxes of cosmetics, shoes, and clothing. He ambitions to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy four boxes of cosmetics, shoes, and clothing

loans.name: Salomatkhon

texts.ru: Саломатхон занимается купле-продажей фруктов и овощей. Она вдова и имеет 3 троих детей, она сама воспитывает их и ей тяжело одному. Более 5 лет она продает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Она хочет улучшить свое жилищные условия и устроит своих детей в школу и ВУЗ-ах. Саломатхон запрашивает займ для покупки овощей и фруктов. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит вас за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Salomatkhon works buying and selling fruit and vegetables. She is a widow and has three children. She is raising them herself, and it is difficult for her. For more than five years she has been selling produce. She wants to improve their standard of living and to enroll her children in school and college. Salomatkhon is asking for a loan to buy vegetables and fruit. She looks forward to your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more CDs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. Neither of them are in school. She has a business of selling beer in Kator, South Sudan for three years.

Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale.

loans.name: Colonel

texts.en: Colonel is a 30-year-old, hardworking man with 8 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been farming for the past 10 years and with the income earned, he has been able to buy land and expand his gardens. He has the challenge of seasonal weather. His dream is to buy land and grow more crops. Colonel needs the loan to pay workers who are weeding his gardens.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding his gardens

loans.name: Atanga

texts.en:
She is 48 years old, married and a mother of 8 children, two of them younger than 15 years old. She lives in Mile Three Nkwen, Mezam, North West Region of Cameroon.

She hates thinking of the fact that her husband lost his job prematurely, her sister was killed on the farm in 2008, and her electricity connection was disconnected because of lack of money to pay her bills. She also feels bad because she has some tenants who stay in her house for up to a year without paying her rent.

She joined GHAPE in 2004 and has received and repaid EC several times. She invested her past EC's in crop cultivation and pig farming. She used the profits to educate her children and to expand her pig farm.

Given a loan, she will continue doing crop cultivation and pig farming. She will also fry gateaux. She thinks these businesses will succeed because they are very profitable and also because she has the necessary experience in them. This EC activity will be of great help to the community in that the sale of manure from her piggery will help to increase yield on farms in her locality. It will also provide employment opportunities for retailers who will buy food stuffs from her to retail.

With the proceeds from this EC activity, she will continue to sponsor her children in school and increase facilities in her house by buying in bulk. She prefers a GHAPE loan because she repays in bits, which is very convenient to her. This makes her active always, and also she can easily do withdrawals from her savings.

loans.use: purchase pig feed, fertilizer, vegetable oil, flour, and sugar

loans.name: Alioune

texts.fr: Monsieur Alioune est âgé de 38 ans. Il vit au Sénégal depuis plusieurs années. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre un et sept ans. Il exerce l’activité de pêcheur  depuis 1988. Il est issu d’une famille de pêcheur  raison pour laquelle il a choisi cette activité dans le but de se procurer des revenus qui  peuvent l’aider dans la gestion des charges de sa famille. Il est membre d’un des  guichets de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il vit depuis mars 2010.Il a sollicité un prêt de 50 000frs qui était prévu pour l’achat d’un mouton , destiné a célébrer la fête de Tabaski pour sa famille. Ce financement  pourra l’aider a maintenir l’équilibre social de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Alioune is 38 years old. He has been living in Senegal for several years. He is married and the father of three children between the ages of one and seven.
He has been a fisherman since 1988. He is from a family of fishermen, which is why he elected this activity to generate revenues and help him support his family. He is a member of one of the local branches of U-IMCEC in the town where he has been living since 2010.
He requested a loan for 50,000 XOF, which was earmarked for the purchase of one lamb intended to celebrate the Tabaski festival with his family. This financing will help him maintain the social standing of his family.

loans.use: to buy lamb to celebrate a national holiday with his family.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 40-year-old a married woman with two children. Neither of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for six years.

Hellen requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Uchkunali

texts.ru: Учкунали занимается выращиванием овощей для продажи. Более 15 лет он занимается этим видом деятельности. Он женат. Ему 37 лет. У него четверо детей. Учкунали берет кредит для закупа топлива и семян.
texts.en: Uchkunali is involved in growing vegetables for sale.  He has been in this business for over 15 years.  Uchkunali is 37 years old, married and has four children.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fuel and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding his garden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vegetables and build a business stall.

loans.name: Sengesamba

texts.en:
Mr. Sengesamba, 44, is a freight transportation driver by mini-truck. He has been running his business for 3 years. During these years, he has already made permanent customers. He lives with his 2 children and his wife in a ger, the nomadic Mongolia traditional tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Indeed, he is a man and father who always wants to get his family in a good living condition. He thinks that he needs to earn more and more than before. 

Lately, his truck has become very bad and has damaged parts. Due to this, his earnings have been decreased in the last several months and sometimes he can not fulfill the orders of his customers. Therefore, he is planning to make a renovation to his truck. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchasing new spare parts for his freight transportation truck.

loans.use: to purchase new spare parts for his freight transportation truck

loans.name: Ouindinmanegde Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTA  est la représentante du groupe OUINDINMANEGDE. Elle est mariée  et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 01an09mois.02  vont à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des  plats en plastique (gobelets, sceaux, plats, bouillards etc.) depuis  03ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de sankariyaaré en ville .Ses clients sont  les femmes et les hommes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01 douzaine de plats ,03 douzaines de  gobelets 01 douzaine de sceaux.

 Elle épargne  ses bénéfices pour  agrandir son commerce et pour s’acheter un motocycle. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir une grande boutique.
texts.en:
Mrs. BINTA is the representative of the Ouindinmanegde group. She is married with three children, of whom two attend school. The oldest is 10 years old and the youngest is one year and nine months, so she has three dependents.

For the past three years, she has been selling kitchenware (cups, buckets, dishes, kettles, etc.). She resupplies at the sankariyaaré market in town. Her customers are both women and men.

She wants to buy one dozen dishes, three dozen cups, and one dozen buckets.

She is saving her profits to expand her business and buy a motorcycle. She aims to open a large store.

loans.use: buy one dozen dishes, three dozen cups, and one dozen buckets

loans.name: Mirali

texts.ru: Мирали житель города Курган-Тюбе. Ему 22 года. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Мирали занимается развозкой пассажиров по маршруту Курган-Тюбе – Душанбе. Этим видом деятельности он занимается два года. Кредит берет для закупа легкового автомобиля.
texts.en: Mirali is a resident of the city of Qurgan-Tube.  He is 22 years old, single and lives together with his parents.  Mirali is involved in transporting passengers along the Qurgan-Tube - Dushanbe route.  He has been in this business for two years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a passenger car.

loans.use: to purchase a passenger car

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 28-year-old married woman with one child who is still too young for school. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and transport. 

Juliet has operated as a tailor for the past two years; her potential clients are the local area women. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase more fabrics and embroidery thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and embroidery thread for her business.

loans.name: Selevano

texts.en: Selevano is a thirty seven year old married man living in Kyenjojo,Uganda. He has been in the agricultural sector for fifteen years and this has enabled him to provide basics for his family. He has challenges of unpredictable seasonal weather changes and his dream is to farm extensively. Selevano needs the loan facility to plant more crops.

loans.use: to plant more crops.

loans.name: Unsi

texts.en:
Unsi is a 40-year-old married woman with six children. All of them are in school. She's had a business of selling maize in Kator, South Sudan for seven years.
 
Unsi requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase maize. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase maize for sale.

loans.name: Takou Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Groupe crée depuis l'ouverture du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui haibitent pratiquement la même localité. 

Madame Khady, debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46  Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a aussi en charge les 3 enfants de sa co-épouse. 

Elle fait comme activité l'embouche ovine. Avec son financement elle va acheter des brebis pour l'engraisser et les revendre. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple en participant à l'amélioration de la nourriture.
texts.en:
This group, created at the opening of the banc villageois, is composed of 10 women who live around the same location. 

Madame Khady, standing on the far right of the photo, is the leader of the group. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She is also responsible for the 3 children of her co-spouse. 

She works as a sheep fattener. With this loan she is going to buy sheep for fattening that she can then resell. She is experienced in this domain, having practiced this trade for many years. 

Her profits will permit her to support her husband in taking care of the family, for example, by helping to improve their nourishment.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 48 years old. She is married and has five children, of whom, three are under 15 years of age. She lives with her family Behind P.M.I. Nkwen, a neighborhood in Bamenda, the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life like the death of her father and brother, lack of money to pay her children’s school fees and sickness. 

Sylvia believes in the saying “No Food for a lazy man”. So, to earn a living, she sells cooked food and Palm wine at mile four park Nkwen. After joining GHAPE in 2007, she has taken and repaid her empowerment credit thrice.  If she is given a loan, it will enable her to buy palm wine and raw food stuff like Koki beans for her restaurant business. This woman believes her business is going to be a success because customers are always available, since she sells at the park. People travel daily to the park. She is helping the community to not to go hungry for scarcity of food.  

With the proceeds from her business, she will be able to pay her children’s school fees, improve on the business and to buy seeds for her farm. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because the interest rates are lower and because of the regular training GHAPE provides to its members.

loans.use: buy raw food stuff like koki beans.

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée qui vend devant son domicile des produits agricoles tels que l'arachide,le haricot...Elle exerce cette activité depuis trois ans et arrive à obtenir des revenus assez consistants pour prendre en charge les besoins de ses 4 enfants notamment sur le plan alimentaire, sanitaire et de la scolarité. Elle sollicite un prêt de 250000f pour acheter des produits agricoles et élargir ainsi son fonds de commerce. Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Mbène is a married woman who sells farm products (such as peanuts and beans) in front of her home. She's been running this business for three years, and manages to turn enough profits to provide for herself and her four children, in particular with respects to food, healthcare and schooling.

She's seeking a loan of XOF 250'000 in order to buy farm products and bolster her stock. Her ambition is to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy farm products (such as peanuts and beans)

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 46 years old with four children aged 14 to 17. She is a widow and she sells foodstuffs in a store that she has run for four years. She would like a loan to buy more cassava, sweet potatoes and beans to sell in her store. Olive would like to use any profits to create savings and solve minor issues for her family. She dreams to have a large stock of inventory and to become a distributor.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Gaggawala Development Group

texts.en:
In the estimation of many who know her, 31-year-old Mariam is a resolute stickler for diligence. She personifies it by the organized and dedicated way she goes about her clothing sales business tasks in Kampala.

Mariam, a single and warm-hearted mother of two, has four years experience in this trade. She has been banking on her earnings to extricate her family out of its below-the-bread-line existence. As of now, her family is enjoying the good graces that have come as a result of her hard work.
Her business generates weekly sales returns to the total of 100,000 UGX.
 
Mariam is upbeat about her future prospects and she reckons she will be able to expand her business as her profit trajectory improves.

Her dream is to build a magnificent family house. She says she wants to go against the established grain and show other women in her locality that they can also succeed on their own, through hard work.

Mariam says she is to use her loan to purchase more bales of clothing to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Madame Maimouna  vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 10 et 39 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente de poissons depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle a choisi cette activité du fait que ses enfants possèdent  des pirogues et qu’elle a la facilité de se procurer le  produit qu’elle commercialise. La satisfaction qu’elle procure à sa clientèle l’intéresse  beaucoup mais aussi les profits qu’elle réalise a travers son activité. Elle  est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poissons à revendre. Elle souhaite augmenter l’offre qu’elle propose à sa clientèle  et aussi diversifier la gamme de produits qu’elle vend. Son objectif final est d’accroitre ses revenus  pour mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Madame Maimouna living in Senegal. She is married and the mother of 10 children which range in age from 10 to 39-years-old. She has worked in the commerce sector, selling fish, for more than 10 years. She chose this activity because her children possess some canoes which gives her the means to procure the product that she sells. She takes great interest in the satisfaction of her clients but also in the profits that she makes through this activity. She has been a member of one of the local branches of the U-IMCEC since August 2011. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs, which she plans to use for the purchase of fish to resell. She hopes to increase her offerings to her clients and also to diversify the range of products that she sells. Her final goal is to increase her earnings in order to better the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Ega has operated as a small-scale farmer for the past six years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of owning a large-scale farm in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase seedlings and farm products and hire laborers to help her cultivate her farm. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and farm products and hire laborers to help her cultivate her farm.

loans.name: Esperence

texts.en:
Esperence is 59 years old and has six children age 28 to 32. 

She is a widow and she sells foodstuffs in a store that she has run for six years. 

She would like a loan to buy more beans to sell. Esperence will use any profits to create savings for her future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Madelena

texts.en:
Madelena is a 45-year-old married woman with six children. One of them is in school. 

She has had a business of selling cooking oil in Kator, South Sudan, for seven years.

Madelena requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Kusema

texts.en: Kusema is a twenty five year old married man living in a permanent house in Kyenjojo,Uganda. His personal goal is buying land in town and constructing rentals. He has been operating a retail shop for two years, despite challenges in limited capital to meet the increasing demand. His business dream is to have a wholesale shop. Kusema needs the loan to buy sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar to sell.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 53 years old with one child, age 13. She is a widow and her child is currently in school. 

She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for seven years. 

Immaculee would like a loan to buy sugar, rice, sweet potatoes, potatoes, and other items to sell in her store. She hopes to use any profits to create savings and help her family. She hopes to have a prosperous business and satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sweet potatoes and other items to sell.

loans.name: Mialie

texts.en:
Mialie is a married woman with two children who are grown up. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mialie has operated as a food vendor for the past 10 years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a café.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings she wants to purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Baye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié et père de 7 filles et 3 garçons dont trois vont à l'école.Il exerce l'activité d'élevage notamment l'embouche ovine.Il fait également de la culture de l'arachide et du mil en saison des pluies.Il entretient sa famille avec les revenus tirés de l'embouche et prend en charge les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.Pour relancer son activité, à la sortie des travaux champêtres, il sollicite un pret de 200000f afin d'acheter 20 moutons qu'il va engraisser et revendre au bout de quatre mois. Son ambition est de se lancer dans l'embouche bovine.
texts.en:
Baye is married and the father of seven girls and three boys. Out of them, three attend school. His business consists in raising livestocks, mainly sheep.

He also grows peanuts and millet during the rainy season. He provides for his family with the income earned from his business, and takes care of the school expenses of his children.

To bolster his business at the end of the farm works, he's seeking a loan of XOF 200'000 in order to buy 20 sheep to fatten and resell after four months.

He ambitions to start raising cattle.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de dos de las miembros del grupo, quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más del  Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, ellas invitaron a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 21 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
Claudia es una de las integrantes, quien comenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de joyas. Su venta es muy buena, ya que siempre tiene mucha variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, sumado a eso su amabilidad y su buena forma de venta. Cuenta que gracias a su negocio ha podido ayudar a su familia y salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar cadenas, pulseras, anillos, tobilleras, y demás tipos de joyas con las cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by two members of the group who had gone to the office of the Paraguayan Foundation in order to get better acquainted with the Committee of Enterprising Women's programs. They invited their friends and acquaintances from the neighborhood and decided to start working together to get ahead and thereby improve their lifestyles. They are 21 hardworking, modest women who must earn a living every day. 

Claudia, one of the members, mentions that she makes a living selling all types of jewelry. Her business is very good because, on top of her friendliness and good sales approach, she always has a lot of variety to offer her clients. She says that thanks to her business she has been able to help her family and get ahead. 

She is asking for the loan to buy chains, bracelets, rings, anklets, and all other types of jewelry she can stock up on to satisfy her clients.

loans.use: to buy chains, bracelets, rings, and anklets to resell.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona is a 35-year-old married woman with four children; two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling beans in Kator, South Sudan, for four years.

Lona requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans for sale.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a 31-year-old married woman with four school-going children. Her husband is businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanahamisi has operated a food stall for the past four years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase building blocks to renovate her house. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase building blocks to renovate her house.

loans.name: Clautilde

texts.en: Clautilde is a 52-year-old widow. She has four children who range in age from 27 to 32. She earns a living by selling food in a store that she has owned for the last seven years. Clautilde is applying for a loan to buy sugar, rice, potatoes, cassava and vegetables to sell to her customers. She would like to use the profits made possible by this loan to save for her future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, potatoes and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Chiabi

texts.en:
Born on December 25th 1972, Chiabi is happily married and has been blessed with five children. Out of the five, just one of the children is below the age of 15. They live in a four room apartment at Green town, Nkwen, Bamenda in the Northwest Region of Cameroon. The death of her father, harassment by thieves and the unemployment problem of her children are the major challenges she has faced in her life. 

As hard working as she is, she operates a cosmetic store and a poultry business. In addition to that, she also sells smoked fish. Since she became a member of GHAPE, Chiabi's standard of living has greatly improved. This woman has successfully taken and repaid empowerment credit three times. She used the profit from her past loans to pay school fees and hospital bills of her children.

Given a loan, she will stock cosmetic items and more chicks for her poultry farm. She believes that this business will be a success because she sells cosmetic items like mesh, rubbing oil and pads, which are in very high demand. This business activity will be of great help to the community in that it will reduce the distance people would have moved to the market to get those same items.

With the profit from this loan, she will educate and provide medication for her children. She prefers a GHAPE loan because the interest rates are lower than those of other financial institutions.

loans.use: to buy mesh, rubbing oil, pads and sprays.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables and bolster his stock

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye  est âgée  de 44 ans. Elle vit au  Sénégal.  Elle est mariée et mère 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 2 et 16 ans. Elle évolue  dans le secteur du petit commerce et pratique la vente de légumes et poissons depuis  3 mois.  C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par passion mais  aussi dans le but de se procurer des revenus. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle vit depuis aout 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100, 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de légumes et de poissons a revendre  dans le but de renforcer son activité de commerce. Elle souhaite  accroitre ses bénéfices pour mieux assister ses enfants dans leurs besoins vitaux.
texts.en:
Mrs Ndeye, age 44, lives in Senegal. She's married and the mother of three children, whose ages range from 2 to 16. She's a merchant, and has been selling vegetables and fish for three months. 

She chose this business out of passion, but also in order to earn a living. She's been a member of the local branch of Kiva's partner, UIMCEC, since August 2011.

She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000 intended to buy vegetables and fish to resell, in order to bolster his business. She would like to increase her profits to better provide for her children and their vital needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fish to resell

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is 33 years old, married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Her largest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. For the last six years, Mwanajuma has earned a living by selling leso, a type of cloth that is very popular in East Africa. Her business is very seasonal, but she dreams of someday owning a store where she can sell her products. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 10,000 to buy more leso cloth to sell to her customers. She joined Yehu to access loans that would allow her to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 100 washtubs, 100 buckets and 60 pots

loans.name: Naima

texts.en: Naima is 35 years old, married and has six children, all of whom are in school. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling maize flour to people who live in her town, Kator, South Sudan. She is applying for a loan from BRAC South Sudan to buy more flour to sell to her customers. She will use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy maize flour to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.ru:
Гарник родился в 1957 году. Он окончил школу-интернат в городе Капане, после чего поступил в Капанское профессионально-техническое училище, где получил специальности токаря. 
Гарник женат и у него трое детей: сын и две дочери. Сын женат и живет со своей семьей отдельно от родителей; старшая дочь не замужем, она живет с родителя и преподает в школе; младшая дочь учится в средней школе. 
С 2008 года Гарник занимается частным предпринимательством: торгует овощами и фруктами. Гарник сам построил помещение, где осуществляет свой бизнес. Благодаря своему бизнесу Гарник приобрел небольшой грузовой автомобиль, на котором он раз в неделю ездит в Ереван за товаром для своего бизнеса. Жена Гарника помогает ему в бизнесе и благодаря этому они работают без выходных. 
Гарнику нужен кредит на сумму 900.000 армянских драм для завершения внутренней отделки, торгового помещения и установления окон и дверей в нем.
texts.en: Garnik was born in 1957.  He graduated from a boarding school in the city of Kapan and then was accepted to the Kapan professional-technical college, where he obtained a profession of a turner.  Garnik is married and has three children: a son and two daughters.  The son is married and lives with his family separately from the parents.  The oldest daughter is not married, lives with the parents and teaches at a school.  The youngest daughter attends a secondary school.  Since 2008, Garnik has been involved in a private entrepreneurship and selling vegetables and fruits.  Garnik himself built the store space, where he runs his business.  Thanks to his business, he bought a small truck, which he uses to travel to Yerevan once per week to get products for his business.  Garnik's wife helps him with the business, and, thanks to this, they work without days off.  Garnik needs a loan in the sum of 900,000 Armenian dram to finish the interior decoration of his store space and to install windows and doors there.

loans.use: to finish the interior decoration of his store space and to install windows and doors there

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 45 years old and a widow. She has three children aged 11 to 13. All of her children are in school. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for six years. 

Odette would like a loan to buy more rice, beans, bananas, potatoes, and cooking oil to sell in her store. She hopes to use any profits to create savings for her family’s future. She hopes to provide sufficient products for her customers.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Bok Ndeye Group

texts.fr:
Groupe crée depuis le 17/04/10,il est composé de 11 femmes habitant toutes dans le village.Elles font du commerce et de l'embouche ovine.
Mame Diarra âgée de 21 ans est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle a en charge une de ses sœurs.Elle est la responsable du groupe de Bok Ndéye.Elle se situe sur la photo à l'extrême droite.
Elle fait de la couture en confectionnant des robes et des pagnes.
Avec le prêt de 80 000 elle va acheter des tissus pour coudre des robes et pagnes.Elle vend ses produits au niveau de son village.Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pendant plusieurs années.
Ses bénéfices lui permettront d'assurer un bon couverture sanitaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Bok Ndeye group was created on the 17th of April, 2010. It is made up of 11 women who all live in the same village. They are all involved in commerce or sheep fattening.

Mame Diarra, on the far right of the picture, is the leader of the group. She is 21 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She is also responsible for one of her sisters. She is a seamstress and makes dresses and pagnes (traditional sarong-like clothing) for resale.

Mame Diarra will use her part of the loan, 80 000 francs, to buy fabric so that she can make more dresses and pagnes. She is an experienced saleswoman who has been selling her products in her village for several years. She will use her profits to make sure her children have good health coverage.

loans.use: to buy fabric for dressmaking.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 26 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is old enough to attend school. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling food to people who live in her town, Kator, South Sudan. She is applying for this loan from BRAC South Sudan to buy tomatoes and onions to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to begin building a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and onions to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en: Matia is a thirty three year old married man with a child living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for two years despite challenges in price fluctuation. His dream is to build a permanent house for residence. Matia needs the loan facility to purchase sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 49 year old married woman with four children who are all grown up. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanasha has operated as a weaver (weaving coconut roofing thatches) for the past ten years. Her potential clients are the local area hotel owners. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase weaving materials like coconut leaves for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials like coconut leaves for her business.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is 50 years old and is a widow. She has two children ages 14 and 28. She sells foodstuffs in a store that she has run for four years. Veneranda would like a loan to buy more sorghum, coffee, beans, and cassava to sell in her store. Any profits will be used to create savings for her future. She dreams to one day become a food distributor.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is applying for another loan to purchase domestic supplies that she needs for the holidays. She will use this 10,000 Kes loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. In the future, Mwanasha aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanasha has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 35 year old married woman with three children. Two of them are in school. She has a business of selling g-nuts (short for ground nuts or also known as peanuts) in Kator South Sudan for four years.
Joyce requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase g-nuts. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase g-nuts for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 37-year-old married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been growing coffee and maize for four years despite the challenges of price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goal to educate his children, and his business dream is to expand his plantation. Stephen is requesting a loan to buy maize and coffee to plant for future sale.

loans.use: to buy maize and coffee for planting.

loans.name: Domithille

texts.en: Domithille is 56 years old and is a widow. She has three children ages 26 to 34. She sells foodstuffs in a store that she has run for eight years. Domithille would like a loan to buy more maize flour, rice, beans, peanuts, and cooking oil to sell in her store. Any profits will be used to create savings for her family. She dreams to see her business grow and prosper.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour, rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Sahity

texts.fr: Monsieur Sahity habite au Sénégal dans l’une de ses communautés ou il vit depuis plusieurs années. C’est un  homme marié de 48 ans, père de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 8 et 25 ans. Il est originaire d’une région au sud du Sénégal.  Concernant son activité il est superviseur d’une auberge depuis 5 ans.  Il éprouve beaucoup de passion et de plaisir dans son activité. Les éléments qui  l’intéressent  le plus sont le contact permanent qu’il noue avec la population mais aussi les revenus que lui procure cette dernière. Il est membre  du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité en question et sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour supporter les frais de voyage de ses enfants qui doivent se rendre dans leur région natale pour un séjour. Ce  crédit lui permettra de satisfaire un besoin social.
texts.en:
Sahity is originally from southern Senegal, though he has lived in a different area of the country for several years. He is 48 years old, married and the father of 3 children aged between 8 and 25. He has been the manager of a hostel for 5 years and enjoys his job greatly. He especially likes forging strong links with the community and running a profitable business.

Sahity is a member of his local UIMCEC branch and is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs with which to pay the cost of a visit by his children to their native region. This loan will enable him to satisfy their social needs.

loans.use: to pay his family´s travel expenses.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 32-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has had a food stall business in Kator, South Sudan, for four years.

Anna requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Sonia Mariela

texts.es:
Sonia Mariela  tiene 21 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con la hija y el hijo de tres y cuatro meses de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC. SAN JOSE Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El Rosario, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Sonia se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos hace muchos años, se dedica también a la agricultura hace tres años y a la cría de chanchos, ganados y gallinas.
Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita este crédito para poder sembrar maíz, comprar insumos, fertilizantes, urea, abonos.
El sueño es poder construir una casa , no se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problemas.
En los tiempos libres le gusta ver televisión.

CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO ANTERIOR  ha podido invertir en la agricultura ha sembrado maíz, arroz y fréjol ayudado muchísimo a obtener beneficios económicos para el bienestar de la familia.
"Está muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada"
texts.en:
Sonia Maria, age 21, is married and has two children. She lives with her husband, three year old daughter, and four month old son in Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province.

The San Jose Communal Bank is located in the El Rosario section of Ventanas Canton. This communal bank concentrates on short cycle agricultural work—the planting of corn and rice.

Sonia has been involved with domestic work for many years. She also has been engaged in farming for three years and in raising pigs, cattle, and chickens. She carries out her purchases and sales in Ventanas.

Sonia is applying for this loan in order to be able to plant corn by purchasing fertilizers, urea, and compost. Her dream is to construct a house. She hasn’t had any problems with her business. During her free time, she likes to watch television.

With the help of her prior loan she was able to invest in farming and planted corn, rice and beans. This helped very much in obtaining economic benefits for the wellbeing of her family. She is very thankful for the help she has been offered.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, urea, and compost.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with five children, two of whom are enrolled in school while the other three have completed school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation.

Mwanatumu has operated as a small scale farmer keeping farm animals and also crop farming for the past ten years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 90,000 she wants to purchase a motorbike for her new motorbike transportation business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her new motorbike transportation business.

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos is a farmer from the village of Diliska, South Georgia. He is 26 years old and married. He lives with his family, including his wife Anichka, one-year-old son, mother, sister, and grandmother. The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. They grow potatoes on a family-owned plot of land and sell their harvest locally, as well as in other nearby towns. Sos also has milk cows, which he uses to produce cheese to sell in the local market. 

Sos has requested a loan to purchase seed potatoes. High-quality seeds are essential to a good harvest in the spring. Sos hopes that weather conditions will be favorable. He will use the income from his harvest to finance the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes.

loans.name: Sisina Shg Group

texts.en:
Zebedayo is the facilitator of the Sisina SHG group. His group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Zebedayo takes care of ten children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Zebedayo had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Zebedayo was only able to harvest two and a half bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Zebedayo and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Zebedayo will educate his children and buy more land. In 2012, the members of Sisina SHG Group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
In the photograph above, Zebedayo is pictured with his group members. The field officer is on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy herbicides for controlling weeds.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en: Marceline is a 49-year-old widow with three children who range in age from 5 to 19. They are all in school, and she has earned a living for the last 10 years by running a canteen. She is applying for this loan to buy sugar, milk, soda, juice and fruit to sell to her customers. She will use the additional profits made possible by this loan to set aside some savings for the future. One day, she dreams of opening a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar Manuel tiene 42 años de edad  es casado tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de  8, 7 y 5 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La VRC. SAN JOSE Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El Rosario, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.
Oscar se dedica a la Agricultura tiene ya trabajando durante 27 años siembra fréjol, maíz, cacao. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para poder invertir en el ciclo corto siembra de maíz, fréjol , comprar abonos, urea, fertilizantes. 
El sueño es poder seguir aumentando la productividad. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.
En los tiempos libres le gusta dedicarse a la finca
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior ha podido invertir en la agricultura ha sembrado maíz,arroz, fréjol y  ha mejorado los ingresos económicos.
"Está muy agradeciodo por el crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Oscar Manues is 42 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives with his wife and children, ages 8, 7, and 5, in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

VCR San Jose is located in the El Rosario area, belonging to the canton of Ventanas.  This area is dedicated to farming short-cycle seeds like corn and rice.

Oscar has farmed for 27 years, planting beans, corn, and cacao.  He buys and sells in Ventanas.

He requests the loan to invest in short-cycle seeds like corn and beans, and to buy fertilizers.

His dream is to be able to keep increasing productivity.  He has not yet had any problems doing so.

In his free time he likes to work on the property.

With the help of the last loan he was able to invest in farming and has sown corn, rice and beans and is improving his finances.

He is very grateful for the previous loan.

loans.use: invest in short-cycle seeds like corn and beans, and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Tagavuma

texts.en:
Tagavuma is applying for another loan to renovate her house that got demolished during the rainy season. She will use this 40,000 Kes loan to purchase building blocks and renovate her house which got demolished during the rains. In the future, Tagavuma aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Tagavuma has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase building blocks and renovate her house which got demolished during the rains.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 33 years old, single and the mother one school-aged child. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the last three years, Naomi has earned a living by operating a medical clinic which provides services to her neighbors. Her income is variable, but she dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 80,000 to buy equipment to improve her laboratory. She decided to join Yehu because of the fair terms and conditions under which it provides help to people like her.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a medical laboratory.

loans.name: Cañaveral Group

texts.es:
Cañaveral es D. la ciudad D. Lambaré, está integrado por 12 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en el segundo ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la fundación paraguaya. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo D. obtener mayores ingresos con lo cual podrán ayudar a sus hijos y familiares.
Una D. esas mujeres es la señora Digna, quien se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que diariamente se esfuerza por darle a su familia lo mejor, para que nos les falte nada. Ella se dedica a la venta D. bebidas D. todo tipo, como ser cervezas, vinos, gaseosas y demás, con lo que ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. cervezas, vinos, gaseosas y demás tipos D. bebidas, con las cuales podrá abastecer su local.
texts.en:
The group Cañaveral is from the city of Lambaré. It is maD. up of 12 women who can be found happily working in the second cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs in the Fundación Paraguaya. They were united by the objective of earning more income with which they would be able to help their children and families. 

One of these women is Digna, who describes herself as “a hardworking, fighting woman, who every day struggles to give her family the best, so that we don’t lack for anything.”

She sells all kinds of drinks, such as beer, wine, soft drinks and others, with which she has been able to get ahead and to help her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy beer, wine, soft drinks and other types of beverages with which she will be able to supply her facility.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, soft drinks and other types of beverages

loans.name: Juboo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe juboo est composé de 8 femmes. Elles font comme activité l'embouche ovine et le commerce.Elles se sont regroupées pour travailler ensemble et s'entre aider.

Saye Femme mariée, mère de 5 enfants et une sœur en charge.Elle est membre du  BV depuis son ouverture.Elle est la responsable du groupe; sur la photo elle est située à droite. 

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Avec son financement de 100 000, elle va acheter 2 brebis.Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.Les bénéfices générés lui permettront de soutenir son mari afin d'assurer de meilleures conditions de vie à la famille.
texts.en:
Juboo Group is made up of eight women. Their businesses consist in raising sheep, and in buying and selling. They got together to work and help each other.

Saye is married, and the mother of five children. She also has one sister to support. She's been a member of the Banc Villageois since its establishment. She's on the right in the photograph.

She raises sheep. With her loan of XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 200) she will buy two ewes. She has a good experience in this field.

Her profits will enable her to help her husband ensure a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy to ewes

loans.name: Joaquin Guillermo
