texts.es: El señor Joaquín a sus 45 años de edad es padre de dos hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad, se dedica al transporte de animales como cerdos, vacas y terneros en su propio camión. Esta labor, el señor Joaquín la realiza desde hace 6 años a diferentes clientes fijos que se localizan en un lugar de la ciudad de Medellín llamado Feria de Ganado, en este sitio, se reúnen vendedores y compradores de ganado, a los cuales el señor Joaquín les transporta los animales. El señor Joaquín necesita realizarle a su camión mantenimiento, esto debido a la orina del ganado ha deteriorado el piso de la parte de atrás del vehículo del señor Joaquín. El señor Joaquín sueña con tener otro camión y en este poder generar empleos directos y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Joaquín, who is 45 years old, is the father of two children, who are 18 and 14 years old. His work is transporting animals such as pigs, cows, and calves in his own truck. He has been doing this work for 6 years for various regular customers who are located in the part of the city of Medellin called Feria de Ganado. In this area, buyers and sellers of livestock meet, and Sr. Joaquin transports their animals. Sr. Joaquin needs to do some maintenance on his truck, due to the animal urine that has deteriorated the floor in the back part of the vehicle. Sr. Joaquin dreams of having another truck and in this way generating jobs and offering his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his work vehicle

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a 55-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. The rest of her children are grown. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Saumu has operated a coconut selling business for the past ten years; her potential clients are the local area residents. The major challenge she faces is transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the loan of 50,000 KES she wants to purchase more coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Kyakatwire Tweyambe Group

texts.en: Christine is a 32-year-old married woman with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has been running a bar for four years. Her personal goal is to educate her children, and her business dream is to diversify her business to include a hotel. She is a member of a group whose policy is that every member guarantees the others in order to access the loan. Christine is requesting a loan to buy a music system for her bar to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a music system for her bar.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Three years ago, Martha came to the United States from Colombia to find a better education and future for her children. Knowing how independent and motivated she was, she knew she would start a business in the US. With her savings, she decided to buy a cleaning service franchise because it would be a perfect fit for her and she would still have time to dedicate to her family. In 2010, Martha received a loan from Kiva partner Accion USA, which helped her grow the business. She now has three part-time employees and hopes to expand by starting another cleaning service at a different location.
Martha’s second loan from Accion USA will enable her to sign a new cleaning contract with a major local company as well as buy new cleaning supplies.
Martha says, “My vision for the future is to continue being an enthusiastic entrepreneur, to find more success in my work, and remain a good mother to my children."

loans.use: to pay for new cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
In pursuit of the American dream, Manuela and her daughter moved to New York City from the Dominican Republic 13 years ago. Her love for children inspired her to open a day care service. About eight years later, she has a license to care for up to 14 children and has an assistant to help her. Manuela is very well-liked by the parents and has a waiting list for places in the day care center. As a charismatic entrepreneur, she says it’s her dream come true to be able to grow her business. She plans to move to a bigger space and extend her day care services to more families in the community.
This loan will enable Manuela to purchase additional cradles, high chairs, toys, and floor mats. She will use the rest to pay for advertising in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional cradles, high chairs, toys, and floor mats.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal, onions, and maize flour for her business. In the future, Emma aspires to continue expanding her business. 

Since receiving her last Kiva loan, Emma has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal, onions, and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El señor Luis Alberto a sus 28 años de edad es padre de tres hijos de 6, 4 y 2 de edad, se dedica desde hace más de 4 años a la venta de mercancía, esta labor la realiza en los pueblos cercanos a la ciudad de Medellín. El señor Luis Alberto trabaja solo, su metodología es viajar cada 15 días a cobrar y llevar más mercancía a los diferentes pueblos donde tiene sus clientes. El señor Luis Alberto desea comprar surtido referente a la época de navidad y así poder incrementar sus ingresos y a la vez mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El señor Luis Alberto sueña con tener su propio almacén con gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis Alberto is 28 years old and the father of three children (ages 6, 4, and 2). He has been selling merchandise for more than four years. Luis conducts business in the towns near the city of Medellín. He works alone. His routine includes traveling every 15 days to collect payments. This allows him to bring more merchandise to different towns where he has customers.

Sr. Luis Alberto wants to buy merchandise for the Christmas season so that he can increase his income and improve his family’s quality of life. He dreams of having his own store with a wide variety of products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is a farmer from the village of Chkhenishi, West Georgia. He is married and lives with his family, including his wife Makvala, four-year-old son, and mother (who is retired). Lasha is managing the family's agriculture business. The family owns a dairy farm with five milk cows. Makvala produces and sells an average of 80 kg of traditional Georgian cheese per month. The family has one pig and sells 12 piglets per year, on average. In addition, the family has one hectare of land, where they grow maize and soybeans. Their corn harvest is sold in a local market. The family's total average monthly income is 600 Laris. 

Lasha has requested a loan to purchase calves. He will raise the calves during the winter months to sell in the spring. This activity will generate additional income for the family, which they will use to renovate their house in order to create a better living environment.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a 26-year-old man with four children, all of whom are enrolled in school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Abdalla has operated a fish selling business for the past six years; his potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the 20,000 KES he wants to purchase a boat and fishing nets for his business. He decided to join Yehu because they have fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and fishing nets for his business.

loans.name: Dulia Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Dulia;  La socia tiene 37 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 18, 16, 12 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores; la socia tiene patos, pavos, gallinas; La socia también se dedica  a la agricultura como actividad principal, la socia siembra y cosecha maíz; La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y siempre está ocupada en todo lo que pueda hacer, ella tiene en su propia casa un espacio en el primer piso que vende chicha de jora, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra de fertilizantes para abonar su terreno de cultivo de maíz, también desea invertir en la compra de animales menores como pollos para criar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y animales menores
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Dulia is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Concebida de Arin” which is located in the District of Arin in Calca Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 37 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 18, 16, and 12). Dulia raises small animals such as ducks, turkeys, and chickens. She also engages in farming as her main business activity, growing and harvesting corn. Dulia is a hardworking woman who always stays busy in everything that she does. She owns a home and has a space on the first floor where she sells “chicha de jora” (a beverage made from corn). On this occasion, she wants to invest in the purchase of fertilizers to apply on her land for growing corn. Dulia also wants to buy small animals, such as chickens to raise. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers and small animals.

Dulia is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and small animals.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 41-year-old married man with four school-going children. His wife is employed and contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children.

Hussein has operated a fish selling business for the past ten years; his potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of establishing a shop for selling fishing equipment.

With the 20,000 KES he wants to purchase fishing equipment like fishing nets for his business. He decided to join Yehu because of their fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment like fishing nets for his business.

loans.name: Maria Eloisa

texts.es: La señora María Eloisa a sus 47 años de edad es madre de una hija de 10 años, se dedica a la venta de mercancía tal como ropa de niño, dama y caballero. Este negocio surge de la necesidad de aumentar sus ingresos, esto debido a que su hija se encuentra en situación de discapacidad cognitiva y su madre esta muy enferma, la señora María Eloisa debe estar al cuidado de ellas dos. Las señora María Eloisa desea comprar surtido con el cual pueda suplir la demanda por temporada de fin de año. Lo anterior le permitirá a la señora María Eloisa incrementar sus ingresos y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su madre e hija. La señora María Eloisa sueña con tener su propio almacén y ver con mejor estado de salud a su madre e hija.
texts.en:
María Eloisa is 47 years old and has a 10-year-old daughter.  Her business is selling merchandise such as men's, women's and children's clothing.  This business came about as she needed to increase her income because her daughter has a cognitive disability and her mother is very sick.  María Eloisa must care for the two of them.

María Eloisa would like to buy stock so that she can meet her end-of-year demand.  Her previous loan allowed her to increase her income and thereby improve her mother and daughter's quality of life.  María Eloisa dreams of owning her own store and seeing her mother and daughter in better health.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
El grupo se forma gracias a la iniciativa de una de las miembros, quien se informo acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, luego logró juntar a 15 amigas y vecinas de su ciudad, quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familias, quienes diariamente se esfuerzan por darle a sus familias las mínimas comodidades.
una de ellas es la señoras es Venancia, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, ella comenta que le va muy bien con las ventas, por lo que ya ha logrado hacerse de una clientela bien definida. Ella todo lo que hace es por darle a su familia un futuro mejor sin privaciones.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano para la posterior venta, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to the initiative of one of its members who approached Fundación Paraguaya to find out about their Entrepreneurial Women's Program.  She then got together 15 friends and neighbors from her city and they are working very happily together.  They are all heads of household who work hard every day to provide their families with minimal comforts.  

One of the members of this group is Venancia who sells all kinds of clothing.  She says that her sales are doing well and she has managed to gain a well-defined customer base.  Everything she does is done in order to provide her family with a better future, without hardships.  She is requesting this loan to buy summer clothing to re-sell.  This will enable her to stock up and meet her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: C13505 New Life Group

texts.en:
Eric is 35 years old and is married with two children between the ages of 6 and 10. Eric is also the leader of his group, which is called "New Life." He is the first person on the right in the picture. 

Eric employs four people to help him, and he has four years of experience. He works from 7:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m every day. Eric has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more clothes to sell. With his profits, Eric will reinvest in his business, and he will buy a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 60-year-old married man with six school-going children. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expanse is school fees for his children.

Mohamed has operated a fish selling business for the past twelve years; his potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He aspires to expand his business.

With the loan of 20,000 KES he wants to purchase a boat and fishing nets for his business. He decided to join Yehu because of their flexible terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a boat and fishing nets for his business.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Feliciana;  La socia tiene 49 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 23 años de edad; la socia tiene un kiosko en el cual vende todo producto de abarrotes y golosinas; la socia también se dedica  a tejer chompas, chalinas, gorros; la socia en esta ocasión desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de productos de abarrotes, la socia desea comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, gelatinas, mazamorras entre otros productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Feliciana is a member of the "Virgen Concebida de Arin" community bank which is located in Arin district, in Calca province, in Cusco department. Feliciana is 49 years old, married, and has a 23-year-old son. She has a stall from which she sells groceries and candies. She also knits sweaters, scarves and hats. On this occasion, Feliciana would like a loan to invest in buying groceries. She would like to buy rice, sugar, milk, gelatin desserts, mazamorras (corn pudding) and other products. She is requesting this loan to invest in buying basic household products. Feliciana is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying basic household products

loans.name: Bimboje

texts.en: Bimboje is 40 years old, married and has nine children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is a fisherman who uses his income to help support their family. They live in a house that has electricity and piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the last 10 years, Bimboje has earned a living by selling the fish that her husband catches. Her goal for the future is to expand her business. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 50,000 to buy more equipment, cooking oil and salt. She joined Yehu to access loans that would allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more equipment, cooking oil and salt for her business.

loans.name: Retoños Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RETOÑOS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Collpani, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Magdalena es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de enaguas, producción de mantillas, tejido de mantas y chompas, tienda de barrio, venta de menudencias.

La señora Magdalena,  indica que hace cinco meses que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tucumanas que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de víveres) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “RETOÑOS” community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional office.  The group has six members and is run by a board of directors which has Magdalena as its president.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: sewing skirts, making shawls, knitting blankets and sweaters, running a neighborhood store and selling miscellaneous goods.

Magdalena tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for five months and joined through an invitation from a promoter.  She currently has a business selling fried empanadas which she has been running for years.

The loan that Magdalena is taking out will be used to increase her capital (buying food products).  She will buy her products in La Ceja and then sell them in local markets.  This work enables her to make income with which to support her family.  Magdalena is married.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Magdalena replied that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La socia ahora esta trabajando en el area de limpieza en una casa,la socia tambien tiene un negocio de construccion junto con su esposo,su esposo es el que pinta casas,construye casas y hace refacciones de casas y su esposa es la que lleva la comida a sus esposo,por medio de este negocio y trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar en su trabajo.La socia solicita el credito para comprar herramientas para el negocio de construccion.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Silvia now works as a house cleaner.  In addition, she has a construction business with her husband.  Her husband builds, repairs and paints houses, and Silvia brings food to her husband.  Through this business and work, she provides for her children.  Silvia wants to expand and improve her business.  She requests a loan to buy tools for her construction business. 

Silvia is happy to have this loan, and she pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy tools for her construction business

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is 59 years old. He is from the village of Bashi, West Georgia, where he lives with his wife Mzia. He works as a repairman, fixing car and tractor motors in a small workshop at his home. Otar is also actively involved in his family's agriculture business: they have three milk cows and they produce and sell an average of 50 kg of cheese per month. They also have 1.25 hectares of land, where they grow maize, cucumbers, tomatoes, and watermelons to sell to local retailers. The family's total average monthly income is 700 Laris.

Otar has requested a loan to purchase a mini-bus so he can take his products to nearby towns and villages and sell them for higher prices. According to Otar’s calculations, he will earn a much higher profit this way, even taking into account the transportation costs. With their increased income, the family will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus for transporting green grocery products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elisa;  La socia tiene 26 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 9 años de edad; la socia se dedica  la agricultura y a la ganadería, la socia tiene vacas, toros y también cria animales menores, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de un torete pequeño para criarlo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un torito.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Elisa is a member of the 'Virgen Concebida de Arin' community bank which is located in Arin district, in Calca province, in Cusco department.

Elisa is 26 years old, lives with her partner, and has a 9-year-old son.  Her business is farming and livestock raising.  She owns cows, bulls, and also raises other animals.  She would like to invest this loan in buying a young bull to raise.  She is requesting this loan to buy a young bull.

Elisa is grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying a young bull

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Ana Francisca se sigue dedicando al trabajo en un consultorio dental,ella esta realizando protesis,la socia tambien se dedica a vende productos de belleza como perfumes,cremas y lapiz labiales,ella vende los productos de belleza en forma independiente,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de productos de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos de belleza como perfumes,cremas y lapiz labiales al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ana Francisca continues working in a dental office.  She also sells beauty products such as perfumes, creams and lipsticks.  She sells her beauty products independently.  Ana Francisca works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and, through this business, she provides for her son.  She would like to expand and improve her business selling beauty products.  She is requesting this loan to buy beauty products such as perfumes, creams and lipsticks wholesale.

Ana Francisca is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as perfumes, creams and lipsticks wholesale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth;  La socia tiene 27 años de edad, la socia es viuda, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 10  años de edad; la socia  es comerciante minorista, ella se dedica  a la compra y venta de verduras, la socia también tiene un terreno de cultivo y siembra verduras, la socia lleva su mercadería a vender a Huaran. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para sembrar verduras.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Concebida de Arin."  This communal bank is located in the Arin district in the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco.

Elizabeth is 27 years old and is a widow.  She has a son who is 10 years old.  She works in retail trade, buying and selling vegetables.  She also has some land where she cultivates vegetables.  Elizabeth takes her merchandise to sell in Huaran.  She requests a loan to invest in seeds to plant vegetables.

Elizabeth is grateful for this loan, and promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant vegetables

loans.name: San Antonio De Jicamarca Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “San Antonio D. Jicamarca” es un grupo que lleva 4 meses trabajando con el Programa- Prosperidad, está conformado por 11 socios entusiastas, donD. la Sra. Virginia es una D. las  integrantes. Virginia tiene 62 años D. edad es casada y tiene 08 hijos actualmente sigue apoyando a 06 D. ellos. Virginia empezó trabajando en una hacienda donD. se dedicaban a la crianza D. cerdos y siembra D. gras, pues fue  ahí donD. nació la idea D. independizarse  para  seguir estas actividades, con los conocimientos y  la experiencia que adquirió trabajando inicio su propio negocio, actualmente se dedica a crianza D. cerdos y siembra D. gras, gracias a dichas actividades le han permitido seguir apoyando a sus hijos en su educación, también nos manifiesta  que se dedica a la labranza (producción D. ladrillos) obteniendo así un ingreso mas para su hogar. El deseo D. Virginia es que sus hijos sean profesionales. En esta oportunidad solicito el préstamo para comprar comida balanceada para sus cerdos. La Alcancía Comunal “San Antonio D. Jicamarca” agradecen el crédito brindado. Sonia y Daria no pudieron estar presente  por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en: The communal bank “San Antonio D. Jicamarca” is a group that has been working with Programa-Prosperidad for 4 months.  The group has 11 enthusiastic members, and Virginia is one of them.  Virginia is 62 years old, married, and has 8 children, 6 of whom she continues to support.  Virginia started out working on a farm where she raised animals and cultivated pasture grass.  This is where she got the idea that she could work independently,  using the knowledge and experience that she got from working to start up her own business.  Now she has a business raising pigs and cultivating pasture grass.  Thanks to these activities she has been able to continue to support her children in their education.  In addition, she tells us that she also works as a brickmaker (making bricks), and in this way she can make even more income for her household.  Virginia wants her children to become professionals.  At this time, she requests a loan to buy balanced feed for her pigs.  The communal bank “San Antonio D. Jicamarca” is grateful for the loan that is being provided.  Sonia and Daria could not be present in the photo because they had to work.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her pigs

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio mario se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,el socio es cocinero y prepara diferentes platos como pollo al horno,saltado,cuyes al horno,tallarines entre otros platos,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de comida.El socio solicita el credito para comprar productos para occinar como arroz,carne,pollo y verduras al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mario is continuing with his business selling food.  He is a cook and he prepares a variety of dishes such as baked chicken, saltado (a traditional Peruvian beef dish), roasted guinea pigs, pasta and other dishes.  He works from 8am until 6pm, and through this business he provides for his children.  Mario wants to expand his business selling food.  He requests a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, chicken and vegetables at wholesale.

Mario is happy to be getting this loan, and he pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, chicken and vegetables at wholesale

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Madame Sokhna est une femme mariée de 50 ans. Elle est mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 9 et 18 ans.  Elle évolue dans le commerce et la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine depuis 1999. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par passion. Et ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est l’aspect lucratif de cette dernière. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle vit au Sénégal depuis juillet 2011. Elle sollicite in crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’ustensiles à revendre. Son objectif est d’élargir son activité de commerce  en augmentant  ses revenus pour ainsi pouvoir faire face à ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhna, age 50, is married. She's the mother of four children whose ages range from 9 to 18. She's been selling kitchenware since 1999.

She chose this business out of passion, and she's very interested in its lucrative aspects. She's been a member of the local branch of Kiva's partner, UIMCEC, in the town where she lives, in Senegal, since July 2011.

She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000 intended to buy kitchenware to resell. Her goal is to expand her business and increase her income, in order to provide for her needs.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware to resell

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yadira;  La socia tiene 30 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia es enfermera de profesión y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, ella cría cuyes, pollos, y en esta ocasión la socia desea invertir en la compra de 20 cuyes para la venta, la socia tiene sus contratas para vender cuyes en la zona. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes en un total de 20.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Yadira belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Concebida de Arin."  This communal bank is located in the Arin district of Calca province in the department of Cusco.

Yadira, 30, is single.  She is a nurse by profession, and she also raises small animals.  She raises guinea pigs and chickens, and at this time she wants to invest in the purchase of 20 guinea pigs to sell.  Yadira has contracts to sell guinea pigs in the area.  She requests a loan to invest in a total of 20 guinea pigs.

Yadira is grateful for this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of 20 guinea pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cassava and plantain to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah sells cooked rice and stew in Besease near Elmina. Hannah has been into this business for the past 10 years. She is married to a teacher and has six dependents. Hannah supports her husband in paying their children's school fees. 

She will use her loan to purchase bulk rice and fish. With the new profit, Hannah plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk rice and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cassava and meat for the preparation of the kokonte (a local meal).

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.es: La socia Adelayda se sigue dedicando a trabajar haciendo limpieza departamentos y tambien sigue vendiendo productos de belleza como cremas y perfumes,la socia los productos de belleza lo vende en forma independiente,por medio de este negocio y trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de productos de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos de belleza como perfumes,cremas y lapiz labiales al por mayor.
texts.en: The member, Adelayda, is still continuing to work by cleaning departments and also selling beauty products like creams and perfumes.  The member sells these beauty products independently, through this business and work she moves forward for her children. The member wants to expand and improve the business of selling beauty products. The credit she is requesting is to purchase beauty products like perfumes, creams and lipstick wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products like perfumes, creams and lipstick wholesale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a single parent and has two dependents. Ama sells cloth in Besease. She has been into this business since 12 years ago. She is responsible for the upkeep of her children. 

Ama will use her loan to purchase more cloth for sale. Ama plans to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth for sale.
